qa_pairs.question: Water dog
qa_pairs.answer: It means A dog accustomed to the water, or trained to retrieve waterfowl. Retrievers, waters spaniels, and Newfoundland dogs are so trained.

qa_pairs.question: Water drain
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A drain or channel for draining off water.

qa_pairs.question: Water drainage
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The draining off of water.

qa_pairs.question: Water dressing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The treatment of wounds or ulcers by the application of water; also, a dressing saturated with water only, for application to a wound or an ulcer.

qa_pairs.question: Water dropwort
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A European poisonous umbelliferous plant (Enanthe fistulosa) with large hollow stems and finely divided leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Water eagle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The osprey.

qa_pairs.question: Water elder
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The guelder-rose.

qa_pairs.question: Water elephant
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The hippopotamus.

qa_pairs.question: Water engine
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An engine to raise water; or an engine moved by water; also, an engine or machine for extinguishing fires; a fire engine.

qa_pairs.question: Waterer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who, or that which, waters.

qa_pairs.question: Waterfall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A fall, or perpendicular descent, of the water of a river or stream, or a descent nearly perpendicular; a cascade; a cataract.

qa_pairs.question: Water feather
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The water violet (Hottonia palustris); also, the less showy American plant Hottonia inflata.

qa_pairs.question: Water flag
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A European species of Iris (Iris Pseudacorus) having bright yellow flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Water flannel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A floating mass formed in pools by the entangled filaments of a European fresh-water alga (Cladophora crispata).

qa_pairs.question: Water flea
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of small aquatic Entomostraca belonging to the genera *Cyclops*, *Daphnia*, etc; -- so called because they swim with sudden leaps, or starts.

qa_pairs.question: Waterflood
qa_pairs.answer: It means A flood of water; an inundation.

qa_pairs.question: Water flounder
qa_pairs.answer: It means The windowpane (Pleuronectes maculatus).

qa_pairs.question: Waterfowl
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any bird that frequents the water, or lives about rivers, lakes, etc., or on or near the sea; an aquatic fowl; -- used also collectively.

qa_pairs.question: Water fox
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The carp; -- so called on account of its cunning.

qa_pairs.question: Water frame
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A name given to the first power spinning machine, because driven by water power.

qa_pairs.question: Water furrow
qa_pairs.answer: It means A deep furrow for conducting water from the ground, and keeping the surface soil dry.

qa_pairs.question: Water-furrow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make water furrows in.

qa_pairs.question: Water gage
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Water gauge.

qa_pairs.question: Water gall
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A cavity made in the earth by a torrent of water; a washout.

qa_pairs.question: Water gang
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A passage for water, such as was usually made in a sea wall, to drain water out of marshes.

qa_pairs.question: Water gas
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See under Gas.

qa_pairs.question: Water gate
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A gate, or valve, by which a flow of water is permitted, prevented, or regulated.

qa_pairs.question: Water gauge
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A wall or bank to hold water back.

qa_pairs.question: Water gavel
qa_pairs.answer: It means A gavel or rent paid for a privilege, as of fishing, in some river or water.

qa_pairs.question: Water germander
qa_pairs.answer: It means A labiate plant (Teucrium Scordium) found in marshy places in Europe.

qa_pairs.question: Water gilding
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act, or the process, of gilding metallic surfaces by covering them with a thin coating of amalgam of gold, and then volatilizing the mercury by heat; -- called also also known as wash gilding.

qa_pairs.question: Water glass
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Soluble glass, under Glass.

qa_pairs.question: Water god
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A fabulous deity supposed to dwell in, and preside over, some body of water.

qa_pairs.question: Water grass
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A tall march perennial grass (Paspalum dilatatum) of the southern United States and the American tropics.

qa_pairs.question: Water gruel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A liquid food composed of water and a small portion of meal, or other farinaceous substance, boiled and seasoned.

qa_pairs.question: Water hammer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A vessel partly filled with water, exhausted of air, and hermetically sealed. When reversed or shaken, the water being unimpeded by air, strikes the sides in solid mass with a sound like that of a hammer.

qa_pairs.question: Water hare
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A small American hare or rabbit (Lepus aquaticus) found on or near the southern coasts of the United States; -- called also also known as water rabbit, and also known as swamp hare.

qa_pairs.question: Water hemlock
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A poisonous umbelliferous plant (Cicuta virosa) of Europe; also, any one of several plants of that genus.

qa_pairs.question: Water hemp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See under Hemp.

qa_pairs.question: Water hen
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any gallinule.

qa_pairs.question: Water hog
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The capybara.

qa_pairs.question: Water horehound
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Bugleweed.

qa_pairs.question: Waterhorse
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A pile of salted fish heaped up to drain.

qa_pairs.question: Water hyacinth
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Either of several tropical aquatic plants of the genus *Eichhornia*, related to the pickerel weed.

qa_pairs.question: Water ice
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Water flavored, sweetened, and frozen, to be eaten as a confection.

qa_pairs.question: Waterie
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The pied wagtail; -- so called because it frequents ponds.

qa_pairs.question: Water inch
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Inch of water, under Water.

qa_pairs.question: Wateriness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being watery; moisture; humidity.

qa_pairs.question: Watering
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as (a. & n.) from Water, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Waterish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Resembling water; thin; watery.

qa_pairs.question: Waterishness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality of being waterish.

qa_pairs.question: water jacket
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A joint in a stone pavement where the stones are left slightly higher than elsewhere, the rest of the surface being sunken or dished. The raised surface is intended to prevent the settling of water in the joints.

qa_pairs.question: Water junket
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The common sandpiper.

qa_pairs.question: Water-laid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having a left-hand twist; -- said of cordage; as, a water-laid, or left-hand, rope.

qa_pairs.question: Waterlander
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of a body of Dutch Anabaptists who separated from the Mennonites in the sixteenth century; -- so called from a district in North Holland denominated Waterland.

qa_pairs.question: Water laverock
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The common sandpiper.

qa_pairs.question: Waterleaf
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any plant of the American genus *Hydrophyllum*, herbs having white or pale blue bell-shaped flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Water leg
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Leg, 7.

qa_pairs.question: Water lemon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The edible fruit of two species of passion flower (Passiflora laurifolia, and Passiflora maliformis); -- so called in the West Indies.

qa_pairs.question: Waterless
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Destitute of water; dry.

qa_pairs.question: Water lettuce
qa_pairs.answer: It means A plant (Pistia stratiotes) which floats on tropical waters, and forms a rosette of spongy, wedge-shaped leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Water level
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The level formed by the surface of still water.

qa_pairs.question: Water lily
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A blossom or plant of any species of the genus Nymphaea, distinguished for its large floating leaves and beautiful flowers. See Nymphaea.

qa_pairs.question: Water lime
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Hydraulic lime.

qa_pairs.question: Water line
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of certain lines of a vessel, model, or plan, parallel with the surface of the water at various heights from the keel.

qa_pairs.question: Water lizard
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any aquatic lizard of the genus *Varanus*, as the monitor of the Nile. See Monitor, (n.), 3.

qa_pairs.question: Water locust
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A thorny leguminous tree (Gleditschia monosperma) which grows in the swamps of the Mississippi valley.

qa_pairs.question: Water-logged
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Filled or saturated with water so as to be heavy, unmanageable, or loglike; -- said of a vessel, when, by receiving a great quantity of water into her hold, she has become so heavy as not to be manageable by the helm.

qa_pairs.question: Waterman
qa_pairs.answer: It means A man who plies for hire on rivers, lakes, or canals, or in harbors, in distinction from a seaman who is engaged on the high seas; a man who manages fresh-water craft; a boatman; a ferryman.

qa_pairs.question: Watermanship
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The business or skill of a waterman.

qa_pairs.question: Watermark
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mark indicating the height to which water has risen, or at which it has stood; the usual limit of high or low water.

qa_pairs.question: Water meadow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A meadow, or piece of low, flat land, capable of being kept in a state of fertility by being overflowed with water from some adjoining river or stream.

qa_pairs.question: Water measure
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A measure formerly used for articles brought by water, as coals, oysters, etc. The water-measure bushel was three gallons larger than the Winchester bushel.

qa_pairs.question: Water measurer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of numerous species of water; the skater. See Skater, (n.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: Watermelon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The very large ovoid or roundish fruit of a cucurbitaceous plant (Citrullus vulgaris) of many varieties; also, the plant itself. The fruit sometimes weighs many pounds; its pulp is usually pink in color, and full of a sweet watery juice. It is a native of tropical Africa, but is now cultivated in many countries. See Illust. of Melon.

qa_pairs.question: Water meter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A contrivance for measuring a supply of water delivered or received for any purpose, as from a street main.

qa_pairs.question: Water milfoil
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any plant of the genus *Myriophyllum*, aquatic herbs with whorled leaves, the submersed ones pinnately parted into capillary divisions.

qa_pairs.question: Water mill
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mill whose machinery is moved by water; -- distinguished from a windmill, and a steam mill.

qa_pairs.question: Water mint
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kind of mint (Mentha aquatica) growing in wet places, and sometimes having a perfume resembling bergamot.

qa_pairs.question: Water mite
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any of numerous species of aquatic mites belonging to *Hydrachna* and allied genera of the family Hydrachnidae, usually having the legs fringed and adapted for swimming. They are often red or red and black in color, and while young are parasites of fresh-water insects and mussels. Called also also known as water tick, and also known as water spider.

qa_pairs.question: Water moccasin
qa_pairs.answer: It means A venomous North American snake (Ancistrodon piscivorus) allied to the rattlesnake but destitute of a rattle. It lives in or about pools and ponds, and feeds largely of fishes. Called also also known as water snake, also known as water adder, also known as water viper.

qa_pairs.question: Water mole
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The shrew mole. See under Shrew.

qa_pairs.question: Water monitor
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A very large lizard (Varanaus salvator) native of India. It frequents the borders of streams and swims actively. It becomes five or six feet long. Called also also known as two-banded monitor, and also known as kabaragoya. The name is also applied to other aquatic monitors.

qa_pairs.question: Water monkey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A jar or bottle, as of porous earthenware, in which water is cooled by evaporation.

qa_pairs.question: Water motor
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A water engine.

qa_pairs.question: Water mouse
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of several species of mice belonging to the genus *Hydromys*, native of Australia and Tasmania. Their hind legs are strong and their toes partially webbed. They live on the borders of streams, and swim well. They are remarkable as being the only rodents found in Australia.

qa_pairs.question: Water murrain
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of murrain affecting cattle.

qa_pairs.question: Water newt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of aquatic salamanders; a triton.

qa_pairs.question: Water nymph
qa_pairs.answer: It means A goddess of any stream or other body of water, whether one of the Naiads, Nereids, or Oceanides.

qa_pairs.question: Water oat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Indian rice. See under Rice.

qa_pairs.question: Water opossum
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Yapock, and the Note under Opossum.

qa_pairs.question: Water ordeal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Ordeal by water. See the Note under Ordeal, (n.), 1.

qa_pairs.question: Water ousel
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of several species of small insessorial birds of the genus *Cinclus* (or *Hydrobates*), especially the European water ousel (Cinclus aquaticus), and the American water ousel (Cinclus Mexicanus). These birds live about the water, and are in the habit of walking on the bottom of streams beneath the water in search of food.

qa_pairs.question: Water parsnip
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any plant of the aquatic umbelliferous genus *Sium*, poisonous herbs with pinnate or dissected leaves and small white flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Water parting
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A summit from the opposite sides of which rain waters flow to different streams; a line separating the drainage districts of two streams or coasts; a divide; a watershed.

qa_pairs.question: Water partridge
qa_pairs.answer: It means The ruddy duck.

qa_pairs.question: Water pennywort
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Marsh pennywort. See under Marsh.

qa_pairs.question: Water pepper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Smartweed.

qa_pairs.question: Water pheasant
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The pintail. See Pintail, (n.), 1.

qa_pairs.question: Water piet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The water ousel.

qa_pairs.question: Water pig
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The capybara.

qa_pairs.question: Water pillar
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A waterspout.

qa_pairs.question: Water pimpernel
qa_pairs.answer: It means A small white-flowered shrub; brookweed.

qa_pairs.question: Water pipe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A pipe for conveying water.

qa_pairs.question: Water pitcher
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A pitcher for water.

qa_pairs.question: Water plant
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A plant that grows in water; an aquatic plant.

qa_pairs.question: Water plantain
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kind of plant with acrid leaves. See under 2d Plantain.

qa_pairs.question: Water plate
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A plate heated by hot water contained in a double bottom or jacket.

qa_pairs.question: Water poa
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Meadow reed grass. See under Reed.

qa_pairs.question: Water pocket
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A water hole in the bed of an intermittent stream, esp. the bowl at the foot of a cliff over which the stream leaps when in the flood stage.

qa_pairs.question: Water poise
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A hydrometer.

qa_pairs.question: Water pore
qa_pairs.answer: It means A pore by which the water tubes of various invertebrates open externally.

qa_pairs.question: Waterpot
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vessel for holding or conveying water, or for sprinkling water on cloth, plants, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Water power
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The power of water employed to move machinery, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Water pox
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A variety of chicken pox, or varicella.

qa_pairs.question: Water privilege
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The advantage of using water as a mechanical power; also, the place where water is, or may be, so used. See under Privilege.

qa_pairs.question: Waterproof
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Proof against penetration or permeation by water; impervious to water; as, a waterproof garment; a waterproof roof.

qa_pairs.question: Waterproof
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A substance or preparation for rendering cloth, leather, etc., impervious to water.

qa_pairs.question: Waterproof
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To render impervious to water, as cloth, leather, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Waterproofing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of making waterproof.

qa_pairs.question: Water purslane
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See under Purslane.

qa_pairs.question: Water qualm
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Water brash, under Brash.

qa_pairs.question: Water rabbit
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Water hare.

qa_pairs.question: Water radish
qa_pairs.answer: It means A coarse yellow-flowered plant (Nasturtium amphibium) related to the water cress and to the horse-radish.

qa_pairs.question: Water rail
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of numerous species of rails of the genus *Rallus*, as the common European species (Rallus aquaticus). See Illust. of Rail.

qa_pairs.question: Water ram
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An hydraulic ram.

qa_pairs.question: Water rat
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The water vole. See under Vole.

qa_pairs.question: Water rate
qa_pairs.answer: It means A rate or tax for a supply of water.

qa_pairs.question: Water rattle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The diamond rattlesnake (Crotalus adamanteus); -- so called from its preference for damp places near water.

qa_pairs.question: Water-ret
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To ret, or rot, in water, as flax; to water-rot.

qa_pairs.question: Water rice
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Indian rice. See under Rice.

qa_pairs.question: Water rocket
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A cruciferous plant (Nasturtium sylvestre) with small yellow flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Water-rot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To rot by steeping in water; to water-ret; as, to water-rot hemp or flax.

qa_pairs.question: Water sail
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A small sail sometimes set under a studding sail or under a driver boom, and reaching nearly to the water.

qa_pairs.question: Water sapphire
qa_pairs.answer: It means A deep blue variety of iolite, sometimes used as a gem; -- called also also known as saphir d'eau.

qa_pairs.question: Waterscape
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sea view; -- distinguished from landscape.

qa_pairs.question: Water scorpion
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Nepa.

qa_pairs.question: Water screw
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A screw propeller.

qa_pairs.question: Watershed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The whole region or extent of country which contributes to the supply of a river or lake.

qa_pairs.question: Water shield
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An aquatic American plant (Brasenia peltata) having floating oval leaves, and the covered with a clear jelly.

qa_pairs.question: Watershoot
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sprig or shoot from the root or stock of a tree.

qa_pairs.question: Water shrew
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of shrews having fringed feet and capable of swimming actively. The two common European species (Crossopus fodiens, and Crossopus ciliatus) are the best known. The most common American water shrew, or marsh shrew (Neosorex palustris), is rarely seen, owing to its nocturnal habits.

qa_pairs.question: Water snail
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any aquatic pulmonate gastropod belonging to *Planorbis*, *Limnaea*, and allied genera; a pond snail.

qa_pairs.question: Water snake
qa_pairs.answer: It means A common North American colubrine snake (Tropidonotus sipedon) which lives chiefly in the water.

qa_pairs.question: Water-soak
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To soak water; to fill the interstices of with water.

qa_pairs.question: Water soldier
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An aquatic European plant (Stratiotes aloides) with bayonet-shaped leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Water souchy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A dish consisting of small fish stewed and served in a little water.

qa_pairs.question: Water spaniel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A curly-haired breed of spaniels, naturally very fond of the water.

qa_pairs.question: Water sparrow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The reed warbler.

qa_pairs.question: Water speedwell
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of speedwell (Veronica Anagallis) found in wet places in Europe and America.

qa_pairs.question: Water spider
qa_pairs.answer: It means An aquatic European spider (Argyoneta aquatica) which constructs its web beneath the surface of the water on water plants. It lives in a bell-shaped structure of silk, open beneath like a diving bell, and filled with air which the spider carries down in the form of small bubbles attached one at a time to the spinnerets and hind feet. Called also also known as diving spider.

qa_pairs.question: Water spinner
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The water spider.

qa_pairs.question: Waterspout
qa_pairs.answer: It means A remarkable meteorological phenomenon, of the nature of a tornado or whirlwind, usually observed over the sea, but sometimes over the land.

qa_pairs.question: Water sprite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sprite, or spirit, imagined as inhabiting the water.

qa_pairs.question: Water-standing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Tear-filled.

qa_pairs.question: Water star grass
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An aquatic plant (Schollera graminea) with grassy leaves, and yellow star-shaped blossoms.

qa_pairs.question: Water starwort
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See under Starwort.

qa_pairs.question: Water supply
qa_pairs.answer: It means A supply of water; specifically, water collected, as in reservoirs, and conveyed, as by pipes, for use in a city, mill, or the like.

qa_pairs.question: Water tabby
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of waved or watered tabby. See Tabby, (n.), 1.

qa_pairs.question: Water table
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A molding, or other projection, in the wall of a building, to throw off the water, -- generally used in the United States for the first table above the surface of the ground (see Table, (n.), 9), that is, for the table at the top of the foundation and the beginning of the upper wall.

qa_pairs.question: Watertath
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of coarse grass growing in wet grounds, and supposed to be injurious to sheep.

qa_pairs.question: Water telescope
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A telescope in which the medium between the objective and the eye piece is water instead of air, used in some experiments in aberration.

qa_pairs.question: Water tender
qa_pairs.answer: It means In the United States navy, a first-class petty officer in charge in a fireroom. He chief water tender, who is a chief petty officer.

qa_pairs.question: Water thermometer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A thermometer filled with water instead of mercury, for ascertaining the precise temperature at which water attains its maximum density. This is about 39<deg/ Fahr., or 4<deg/ Centigrade; and from that point down to 32<deg/ Fahr., or 0<deg/ Centigrade, or the freezing point, it expands.

qa_pairs.question: Water thief
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A pirate.

qa_pairs.question: Water thrush
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A North American bird of the genus *Seiurus*, belonging to the Warbler family, especially the common species (Seiurus Noveboracensis).

qa_pairs.question: Water thyme
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Anacharis.

qa_pairs.question: Water tick
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Water mite.

qa_pairs.question: Water tiger
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A diving, or water, beetle, especially the larva of a water beetle. See Illust. _b_ of Water beetle.

qa_pairs.question: Water-tight
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as So tight as to retain, or not to admit, water; not leaky.

qa_pairs.question: Water torch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The common cat-tail (Typha latifolia), the spike of which makes a good torch soaked in oil.

qa_pairs.question: Water tower
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A large metal pipe made to be extended vertically by sections, and used for discharging water upon burning buildings.

qa_pairs.question: Water tree
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A climbing shrub (Tetracera alnifolia syn. Tetracera potatoria) of Western Africa, which pours out a watery sap from the freshly cut stems.

qa_pairs.question: Water trefoil
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The buck bean.

qa_pairs.question: Water tube
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of a system of tubular excretory organs having external openings, found in many invertebrates. They are believed to be analogous in function to the kidneys of vertebrates. See Illust. under Trematodea, and Sporocyst.

qa_pairs.question: Water tupelo
qa_pairs.answer: It means A species of large tupelo (Nyssa aquatica) growing in swamps in the southern of the United States. See Ogeechee lime.

qa_pairs.question: Water turkey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The American snakebird. See Snakebird.

qa_pairs.question: Water tuy<egrave/re
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A tuy<egrave/re kept cool by water circulating within a casing. It is used for hot blast.

qa_pairs.question: Water twist
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Yarn made by the throstle, or water frame.

qa_pairs.question: Water vine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any plant of the genus *Phytocrene*, climbing shrubs of Asia and Africa, the stems of which are singularly porous, and when cut stream with a limpid potable juice.

qa_pairs.question: Water violet
qa_pairs.answer: It means See under Violet.

qa_pairs.question: Water viper
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Water moccasin.

qa_pairs.question: Water vole
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See under Vole.

qa_pairs.question: Water wagtail
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See under Wagtail.

qa_pairs.question: Waterway
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Heavy plank or timber extending fore and aft the whole length of a vessel's deck at the line of junction with the sides, forming a channel to the scuppers, which are cut through it. In iron vessels the waterway is variously constructed.

qa_pairs.question: Water way
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Water course.

qa_pairs.question: Waterweed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Anacharis.

qa_pairs.question: Water wheel
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any wheel for propelling machinery or for other purposes, that is made to rotate by the direct action of water; -- called an overshot wheel when the water is applied at the top, an undershot wheel when at the bottom, a breast wheel when at an intermediate point; other forms are called reaction wheel, vortex wheel, turbine wheel, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Water willow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An American aquatic plant (Dianthera Americana) with long willowlike leaves, and spikes of small purplish flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Water wing
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of two walls built on either side of the junction of a bridge with the bank of a river, to protect the abutment of the bridge and the bank from the action of the current.

qa_pairs.question: Water witch
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The dabchick.

qa_pairs.question: Water-withe
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A vinelike plant (Vitis Caribaea) growing in parched districts in the West Indies, and containing a great amount of sap which is sometimes used for quenching thirst.

qa_pairs.question: Waterwork
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Painting executed in size or distemper, on canvas or walls, -- formerly, frequently taking the place of tapestry.

qa_pairs.question: Waterworn
qa_pairs.answer: It means Worn, smoothed, or polished by the action of water; as, waterworn stones.

qa_pairs.question: Waterwort
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any plant of the natural order Elatineae, consisting of two genera (*Elatine*, and *Bergia*), mostly small annual herbs growing in the edges of ponds. Some have a peppery or acrid taste.

qa_pairs.question: Watery
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to water; consisting of water.

qa_pairs.question: Watt
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A unit of power or activity equal to 107 C.G.S. units of power, or to work done at the rate of one joule a second. An English horse power is approximately equal to 746 watts.

qa_pairs.question: Watteau
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having the appearance of that which is seen in pictures by Antoine Watteau, a French painter of the eighteenth century; -- said esp. of women's garments; as, a Watteau bodice.

qa_pairs.question: Watteau back
qa_pairs.answer: It means The back of a woman's gown in which one or more very broad folds are carried from the neck to the floor without being held in at the waist, while the front and sides of the gown are shaped to the person and have a belt or its equivalent.

qa_pairs.question: Wattmeter
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for measuring power in watts, -- much used in measuring the energy of an electric current.

qa_pairs.question: Wattle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A twig or flexible rod; hence, a hurdle made of such rods.

qa_pairs.question: Wattle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To bind with twigs.

qa_pairs.question: Wattlebird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of honey eaters belonging to *Anthochaera* and allied genera of the family Meliphagidae. These birds usually have a large and conspicuous wattle of naked skin hanging down below each ear. They are natives of Australia and adjacent islands.

qa_pairs.question: Wattled
qa_pairs.answer: It means Furnished with wattles, or pendent fleshy processes at the chin or throat.

qa_pairs.question: Wattless
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Without any power (cf. Watt); -- said of an alternating current or component of current when it differs in phase by ninety degrees from the electromotive force which produces it, or of an electromotive force or component thereof when the current it produces differs from it in phase by 90 degrees.

qa_pairs.question: Wattling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of binding or platting with twigs; also, the network so formed.

qa_pairs.question: Waucht
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large draught of any liquid.

qa_pairs.question: Waul
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cry as a cat; to squall; to wail.

qa_pairs.question: Waur
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Worse.

qa_pairs.question: Wave
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Waive.

qa_pairs.question: Wave
qa_pairs.answer: It means To play loosely; to move like a wave, one way and the other; to float; to flutter; to undulate.

qa_pairs.question: Wave
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To move one way and the other; to brandish.

qa_pairs.question: Wave
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An advancing ridge or swell on the surface of a liquid, as of the sea, resulting from the oscillatory motion of the particles composing it when disturbed by any force their position of rest; an undulation.

qa_pairs.question: Waved
qa_pairs.answer: It means Exhibiting a wavelike form or outline; undulating; intended; wavy; as, waved edge.

qa_pairs.question: Waveless
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Free from waves; undisturbed; not agitated; as, the waveless sea.

qa_pairs.question: Wavelet
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A little wave; a ripple.

qa_pairs.question: Wavellite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A hydrous phosphate of alumina, occurring usually in hemispherical radiated forms varying in color from white to yellow, green, or black.

qa_pairs.question: Waver
qa_pairs.answer: It means To play or move to and fro; to move one way and the other; hence, to totter; to reel; to swing; to flutter.

qa_pairs.question: Waver
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sapling left standing in a fallen wood.

qa_pairs.question: Waverer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who wavers; one who is unsettled in doctrine, faith, opinion, or the like.

qa_pairs.question: Waveringly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a wavering manner.

qa_pairs.question: Waveringness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of wavering.

qa_pairs.question: Waveson
qa_pairs.answer: It means Goods which, after shipwreck, appear floating on the waves, or sea.

qa_pairs.question: Wave-worn
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Worn by the waves.

qa_pairs.question: Wavey
qa_pairs.answer: It means The snow goose.

qa_pairs.question: Waviness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being wavy.

qa_pairs.question: Wavure
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Waivure.

qa_pairs.question: Wavy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Rising or swelling in waves; full of waves.

qa_pairs.question: Wawaskeesh
qa_pairs.answer: It means The wapiti, or wapiti, or American elk.

qa_pairs.question: Wawe
qa_pairs.answer: It means Woe.

qa_pairs.question: Wawe
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A wave.

qa_pairs.question: Wawl
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Waul.

qa_pairs.question: Wax
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To increase in size; to grow bigger; to become larger or fuller; -- opposed to wane.

qa_pairs.question: Wax
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A fatty, solid substance, produced by bees, and employed by them in the construction of their comb; -- usually called also known as beeswax. It is first excreted, from a row of pouches along their sides, in the form of scales, which, being masticated and mixed with saliva, become whitened and tenacious. Its natural color is pale or dull yellow.

qa_pairs.question: Wax
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To smear or rub with wax; to treat with wax; as, to wax a thread or a table.

qa_pairs.question: Waxberry
qa_pairs.answer: It means The wax-covered fruit of the wax myrtle, or bayberry. See Bayberry, and Candleberry tree.

qa_pairs.question: Waxbill
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of numerous species of finchlike birds belonging to *Estrelda* and allied genera, native of Asia, Africa, and Australia. The bill is large, conical, and usually red in color, resembling sealing wax. Several of the species are often kept as cage birds.

qa_pairs.question: Waxbird
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The waxwing.

qa_pairs.question: Waxen
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Made of wax.

qa_pairs.question: Waxiness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Quality or state of being waxy.

qa_pairs.question: Waxwing
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of several species of small birds of the genus *Ampelis*, in which some of the secondary quills are usually tipped with small horny ornaments resembling red sealing wax. The Bohemian waxwing (see under Bohemian) and the cedar bird are examples. Called also also known as waxbird.

qa_pairs.question: Waxwork
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Work made of wax; especially, a figure or figures formed or partly of wax, in imitation of real beings.

qa_pairs.question: Waxworks
qa_pairs.answer: It means An exhibition of wax figures, or the place of exhibition; as, Madame Toussaud's Waxworks.

qa_pairs.question: Waxworker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who works in wax; one who makes waxwork.

qa_pairs.question: Waxy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Resembling wax in appearance or consistency; viscid; adhesive; soft; hence, yielding; pliable; impressible.

qa_pairs.question: Way
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Away.

qa_pairs.question: Way
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That by, upon, or along, which one passes or processes; opportunity or room to pass; place of passing; passage; road, street, track, or path of any kind; as, they built a way to the mine.

qa_pairs.question: Way
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To go or travel to; to go in, as a way or path.

qa_pairs.question: Way
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To move; to progress; to go.

qa_pairs.question: Waybill
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A list of passengers in a public vehicle, or of the baggage or gods transported by a common carrier on a land route. When the goods are transported by water, the list is called a bill of lading.

qa_pairs.question: Waybread
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The common dooryard plantain (Plantago major).

qa_pairs.question: Waybung
qa_pairs.answer: It means An Australian insessorial bird (Corcorax melanorhamphus) noted for the curious actions of the male during the breeding season. It is black with a white patch on each wing.

qa_pairs.question: Wayed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Used to the way; broken.

qa_pairs.question: Wayfare
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To journey; to travel; to go to and fro.

qa_pairs.question: Wayfare
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of journeying; travel; passage.

qa_pairs.question: Wayfarer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who travels; a traveler; a passenger.

qa_pairs.question: Wayfaring
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Traveling; passing; being on a journey.

qa_pairs.question: Waygate
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The tailrace of a mill.

qa_pairs.question: Way-going
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Going away; departing; of or pertaining to one who goes away.

qa_pairs.question: Way-goose
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Wayz-goose, (n.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: Wayk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Weak.

qa_pairs.question: Waylay
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To lie in wait for; to meet or encounter in the way; especially, to watch for the passing of, with a view to seize, rob, or slay; to beset in ambush.

qa_pairs.question: Waylayer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who waylays another.

qa_pairs.question: Wayless
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having no road or path; pathless.

qa_pairs.question: Wayleway
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Welaway.

qa_pairs.question: Waymaker
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who makes a way; a precursor.

qa_pairs.question: Waymark
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mark to guide in traveling.

qa_pairs.question: Wayment
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To lament; to grieve; to wail.

qa_pairs.question: Wayment
qa_pairs.answer: It means Grief; lamentation; mourning.

qa_pairs.question: -ways
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A suffix formed from way by the addition of the adverbial -s (see -wards). It is often used interchangeably with wise; as, endways or endwise; noways or nowise, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Way shaft
qa_pairs.answer: It means A rock shaft.

qa_pairs.question: Wayside
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The side of the way; the edge or border of a road or path.

qa_pairs.question: Wayside
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the wayside; as, wayside flowers.

qa_pairs.question: Wayward
qa_pairs.answer: It means Taking one's own way; disobedient; froward; perverse; willful.

qa_pairs.question: Way-wise
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Skillful in finding the way; well acquainted with the way or route; wise from having traveled.

qa_pairs.question: Waywiser
qa_pairs.answer: It means An instrument for measuring the distance which one has traveled on the road; an odometer, pedometer, or perambulator.

qa_pairs.question: Waywode
qa_pairs.answer: It means Originally, the title of a military commander in various Slavonic countries; afterwards applied to governors of towns or provinces. It was assumed for a time by the rulers of Moldavia and Wallachia, who were afterwards called hospodars, and has also been given to some inferior Turkish officers.

qa_pairs.question: Waywodeship
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The office, province, or jurisdiction of a waywode.

qa_pairs.question: Wayworn
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wearied by traveling.

qa_pairs.question: Wayz-goose
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A stubble goose.

qa_pairs.question: We
qa_pairs.answer: It means The plural nominative case of the pronoun of the first person; the word with which a person in speaking or writing denotes a number or company of which he is one, as the subject of an action expressed by a verb.

qa_pairs.question: Weak
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Wanting physical strength.

qa_pairs.question: Weak
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make or become weak; to weaken.

qa_pairs.question: Weaken
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make weak; to lessen the strength of; to deprive of strength; to debilitate; to enfeeble; to enervate; as, to weaken the body or the mind; to weaken the hands of a magistrate; to weaken the force of an objection or an argument.

qa_pairs.question: Weaken
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To become weak or weaker; to lose strength, spirit, or determination; to become less positive or resolute; as, the patient weakened; the witness weakened on cross-examination.

qa_pairs.question: Weakener
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who, or that which, weakens.

qa_pairs.question: Weakfish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any fish of the genus *Cynoscion*; a squeteague; -- so called from its tender mouth. See Squeteague.

qa_pairs.question: Weak-hearted
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having little courage; of feeble spirit; dispirited; faint-hearted.

qa_pairs.question: Weakish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Somewhat weak; rather weak.

qa_pairs.question: Weakishness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Quality or state of being weakish.

qa_pairs.question: Weak-kneed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having weak knees; hence, easily yielding; wanting resolution.

qa_pairs.question: Weakling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A weak or feeble creature.

qa_pairs.question: Weakling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Weak; feeble.

qa_pairs.question: Weakly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a weak manner; with little strength or vigor; feebly.

qa_pairs.question: Weakly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Not strong of constitution; infirm; feeble; as, a weakly woman; a man of a weakly constitution.

qa_pairs.question: Weak-minded
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having a weak mind, either naturally or by reason of disease; feebleminded; foolish; idiotic.

qa_pairs.question: Weakness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being weak; want of strength or firmness; lack of vigor; want of resolution or of moral strength; feebleness.

qa_pairs.question: Weal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The mark of a stripe. See Wale.

qa_pairs.question: Weal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To mark with stripes. See Wale.

qa_pairs.question: Weal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sound, healthy, or prosperous state of a person or thing; prosperity; happiness; welfare.

qa_pairs.question: Weal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To promote the weal of; to cause to be prosperous.

qa_pairs.question: Weal-balanced
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Balanced or considered with reference to public weal.

qa_pairs.question: Weald
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A wood or forest; a wooded land or region; also, an open country; -- often used in place names.

qa_pairs.question: Wealden
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the lowest division of the Cretaceous formation in England and on the Continent, which overlies the Oolitic series.

qa_pairs.question: Wealden
qa_pairs.answer: It means The Wealden group or strata.

qa_pairs.question: Wealdish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to a weald, esp. to the weald in the county of Kent, England.

qa_pairs.question: Wealful
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Weleful.

qa_pairs.question: Wealsman
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A statesman; a politician.

qa_pairs.question: Wealth
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weal; welfare; prosperity; good.

qa_pairs.question: Wealthful
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Full of wealth; wealthy; prosperous.

qa_pairs.question: Wealthily
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a wealthy manner; richly.

qa_pairs.question: Wealthiness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being wealthy, or rich; richness; opulence.

qa_pairs.question: Wealthy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having wealth; having large possessions, or larger than most men, as lands, goods, money, or securities; opulent; affluent; rich.

qa_pairs.question: Wean
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To accustom and reconcile, as a child or other young animal, to a want or deprivation of mother's milk; to take from the breast or udder; to cause to cease to depend on the mother nourishment.

qa_pairs.question: Wean
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A weanling; a young child.

qa_pairs.question: Weanedness
qa_pairs.answer: It means Quality or state of being weaned.

qa_pairs.question: Weanel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A weanling.

qa_pairs.question: Weanling
qa_pairs.answer: It means (a. & n.) from Wean, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Weanling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A child or animal newly weaned; a wean.

qa_pairs.question: Weanling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Recently weaned.

qa_pairs.question: Weapon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An instrument of offensive of defensive combat; something to fight with; anything used, or designed to be used, in destroying, defeating, or injuring an enemy, as a gun, a sword, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weaponed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Furnished with weapons, or arms; armed; equipped.

qa_pairs.question: Weaponless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having no weapon.

qa_pairs.question: Weaponry
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weapons, collectively; as, an array of weaponry.

qa_pairs.question: Wear
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Weir.

qa_pairs.question: Wear
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cause to go about, as a vessel, by putting the helm up, instead of alee as in tacking, so that the vessel's bow is turned away from, and her stern is presented to, the wind, and, as she turns still farther, her sails fill on the other side; to veer.

qa_pairs.question: Wear
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To carry or bear upon the person; to bear upon one's self, as an article of clothing, decoration, warfare, bondage, etc.; to have appendant to one's body; to have on; as, to wear a coat; to wear a shackle.

qa_pairs.question: Wear
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To endure or suffer use; to last under employment; to bear the consequences of use, as waste, consumption, or attrition; as, a coat wears well or ill; -- hence, sometimes applied to character, qualifications, etc.; as, a man wears well as an acquaintance.

qa_pairs.question: Wear
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of wearing, or the state of being worn; consumption by use; diminution by friction; as, the wear of a garment.

qa_pairs.question: Wearable
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Capable of being worn; suitable to be worn.

qa_pairs.question: Wearer
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who wears or carries as appendant to the body; as, the wearer of a cloak, a sword, a crown, a shackle, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weariable
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That may be wearied.

qa_pairs.question: Weariful
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Abounding in qualities which cause weariness; wearisome.

qa_pairs.question: Weariless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Incapable of being wearied.

qa_pairs.question: Wearily
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a weary manner.

qa_pairs.question: Weariness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being weary or tried; lassitude; exhaustion of strength; fatigue.

qa_pairs.question: Wearing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of one who wears; the manner in which a thing wears; use; conduct; consumption.

qa_pairs.question: Wearing
qa_pairs.answer: It means Pertaining to, or designed for, wear; as, wearing apparel.

qa_pairs.question: Wearish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weak; withered; shrunk.

qa_pairs.question: Wearisome
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Causing weariness; tiresome; tedious; weariful; as, a wearisome march; a wearisome day's work; a wearisome book.

qa_pairs.question: Weary
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the strength exhausted by toil or exertion; worn out in respect to strength, endurance, etc.; tired; fatigued.

qa_pairs.question: Weary
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To reduce or exhaust the physical strength or endurance of; to tire; to fatigue; as, to weary one's self with labor or traveling.

qa_pairs.question: Weary
qa_pairs.answer: It means To grow tired; to become exhausted or impatient; as, to weary of an undertaking.

qa_pairs.question: Weasand
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The windpipe; -- called also, formerly, also known as wesil.

qa_pairs.question: Weasel
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of various species of small carnivores belonging to the genus *Putorius*, as the ermine and ferret. They have a slender, elongated body, and are noted for the quickness of their movements and for their bloodthirsty habit in destroying poultry, rats, etc. The ermine and some other species are brown in summer, and turn white in winter; others are brown at all seasons.

qa_pairs.question: Weasel-faced
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having a thin, sharp face, like a weasel.

qa_pairs.question: Weaser
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The American merganser; -- called also also known as weaser sheldrake.

qa_pairs.question: Weasiness
qa_pairs.answer: It means Quality or state of being weasy; full feeding; sensual indulgence.

qa_pairs.question: Weasy
qa_pairs.answer: It means Given to sensual indulgence; gluttonous.

qa_pairs.question: Weather
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The state of the air or atmosphere with respect to heat or cold, wetness or dryness, calm or storm, clearness or cloudiness, or any other meteorological phenomena; meteorological condition of the atmosphere; as, warm weather; cold weather; wet weather; dry weather, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weather
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To expose to the air; to air; to season by exposure to air.

qa_pairs.question: Weather
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To undergo or endure the action of the atmosphere; to suffer meteorological influences; sometimes, to wear away, or alter, under atmospheric influences; to suffer waste by weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weather
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Being toward the wind, or windward -- opposed to lee; as, weather bow, weather braces, weather gauge, weather lifts, weather quarter, weather shrouds, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-beaten
qa_pairs.answer: It means Beaten or harassed by the weather; worn by exposure to the weather, especially to severe weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-bit
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A turn of the cable about the end of the windlass, without the bits.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherbit
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To take another turn with, as a cable around a windlass.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-bitten
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Eaten into, defaced, or worn, by exposure to the weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherboard
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That side of a vessel which is toward the wind; the windward side.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-board
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To nail boards upon so as to lap one over another, in order to exclude rain, snow, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherboarding
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The covering or siding of a building, formed of boards lapping over one another, to exclude rain, snow, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-bound
qa_pairs.answer: It means Kept in port or at anchor by storms; delayed by bad weather; as, a weather-bound vessel.

qa_pairs.question: Weathercock
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A vane, or weather vane; -- so called because originally often in the figure of a cock, turning on the top of a spire with the wind, and showing its direction.

qa_pairs.question: Weathercock
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To supply with a weathercock; to serve as a weathercock for.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-driven
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Driven by winds or storms; forced by stress of weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weathered
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Made sloping, so as to throw off water; as, a weathered cornice or window sill.

qa_pairs.question: Weather-fend
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To defend from the weather; to shelter.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherglass
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An instrument to indicate the state of the atmosphere, especially changes of atmospheric pressure, and hence changes of weather, as a barometer or baroscope.

qa_pairs.question: Weathering
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The action of the elements on a rock in altering its color, texture, or composition, or in rounding off its edges.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherliness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality of being weatherly.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Working, or able to sail, close to the wind; as, a weatherly ship.

qa_pairs.question: Weather map
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A map or chart showing the principal meteorological elements at a given hour and over an extended region. Such maps usually show the height of the barometer, the temperature of the air, the relative humidity, the state of the weather, and the direction and velocity of the wind. Isobars and isotherms outline the general distribution of temperature and pressure, while shaded areas indicate the sections over which rain has just fallen. Other lines inclose areas where the temperature has fallen or risen markedly. In tabular form are shown changes of pressure and of temperature, maximum and minimum temperatures, and total rain for each weather station since the last issue, usually 12 hours.

qa_pairs.question: Weathermost
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Being farthest to the windward.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherproof
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Proof against rough weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weather signal
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any signal giving information about the weather. The system used by the United States Weather Bureau includes temperature, cold or hot wave, rain or snow, wind direction, storm, and hurricane signals.

qa_pairs.question: Weather station
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A station for taking meteorological observations, making weather forecasts, or disseminating such information. Such stations are of the first order when they make observations of all the important elements either hourly or by self-registering instruments; of the second order when only important observations are taken; of the third order when simpler work is done, as to record rainfall and maximum and minimum temperatures.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherwise
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Skillful in forecasting the changes of the weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherwiser
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Something that foreshows the weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weatherworn
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Worn by the action of, or by exposure to, the weather.

qa_pairs.question: Weave
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To unite, as threads of any kind, in such a manner as to form a texture; to entwine or interlace into a fabric; as, to weave wool, silk, etc.; hence, to unite by close connection or intermixture; to unite intimately.

qa_pairs.question: Weave
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To practice weaving; to work with a loom.

qa_pairs.question: Weave
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A particular method or pattern of weaving; as, the cassimere weave.

qa_pairs.question: Weaver
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who weaves, or whose occupation is to weave.

qa_pairs.question: Weaverfish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weever.

qa_pairs.question: Weaving
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of one who, or that which, weaves; the act or art of forming cloth in a loom by the union or intertexture of threads.

qa_pairs.question: Weazand
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weasand.

qa_pairs.question: Weazen
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Thin; sharp; withered; wizened; as, a weazen face.

qa_pairs.question: Weazeny
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Somewhat weazen; shriveled.

qa_pairs.question: Web
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A weaver.

qa_pairs.question: Web
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That which is woven; a texture; textile fabric; esp., something woven in a loom.

qa_pairs.question: web
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The world-wide web; -- usually referred to as also known as the web.

qa_pairs.question: Web
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To unite or surround with a web, or as if with a web; to envelop; to entangle.

qa_pairs.question: Webbed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Provided with a web.

qa_pairs.question: Webber
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who forms webs; a weaver; a webster.

qa_pairs.question: Webbing
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A woven band of cotton or flax, used for reins, girths, bed bottoms, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Webby
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to a web or webs; like a web; filled or covered with webs.

qa_pairs.question: Weber
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The standard unit of electrical quantity, and also of current. See Coulomb, and Amp<?/re.

qa_pairs.question: Webeye
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Web, (n.), 8.

qa_pairs.question: Web-fingered
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having the fingers united by a web for a considerable part of their length.

qa_pairs.question: Webfoot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A foot the toes of which are connected by a membrane.

qa_pairs.question: Web-footed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having webbed feet; palmiped; as, a goose or a duck is a web-footed fowl.

qa_pairs.question: Webster
qa_pairs.answer: It means A weaver; originally, a female weaver.

qa_pairs.question: Websterite
qa_pairs.answer: It means A hydrous sulphate of alumina occurring in white reniform masses.

qa_pairs.question: Web-toed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the toes united by a web for a considerable part of their length.

qa_pairs.question: Webworm
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of various species of moths whose gregarious larvae eat the leaves of trees, and construct a large web to which they retreat when not feeding.

qa_pairs.question: Wed
qa_pairs.answer: It means A pledge; a pawn.

qa_pairs.question: Wed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To take for husband or for wife by a formal ceremony; to marry; to espouse.

qa_pairs.question: Wed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To contact matrimony; to marry.

qa_pairs.question: Weddahs
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Veddahs.

qa_pairs.question: Wedded
qa_pairs.answer: It means Joined in wedlock; married.

qa_pairs.question: Wedder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Wether.

qa_pairs.question: Wedding
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nuptial ceremony; nuptial festivities; marriage; nuptials.

qa_pairs.question: Weder
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weather.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A piece of metal, or other hard material, thick at one end, and tapering to a thin edge at the other, used in splitting wood, rocks, etc., in raising heavy bodies, and the like. It is one of the six elementary machines called the mechanical powers. See Illust. of Mechanical powers, under Mechanical.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cleave or separate with a wedge or wedges, or as with a wedge; to rive.

qa_pairs.question: Wedgebill
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An Australian crested insessorial bird (Sphenostoma cristatum) having a wedge-shaped bill. Its color is dull brown, like the earth of the plains where it lives.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge-formed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the form of a wedge; cuneiform.

qa_pairs.question: wedge gauge
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A wedge with a graduated edge, to measure the width of a space into which it is thrust.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge gear
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A friction gear wheel with wedge-shaped circumferential grooves.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge-shaped
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having the shape of a wedge; cuneiform.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge-shell
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of small marine bivalves belonging to *Donax* and allied genera in which the shell is wedge-shaped.

qa_pairs.question: Wedge-tailed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having a tail which has the middle pair of feathers longest, the rest successively and decidedly shorter, and all more or less attenuate; -- said of certain birds. See Illust. of Wood hoopoe, under Wood.

qa_pairs.question: Wedgewise
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In the manner of a wedge.

qa_pairs.question: Wedgwood ware
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kind of fine pottery, the most remarkable being what is called jasper, either white, or colored throughout the body, and capable of being molded into the most delicate forms, so that fine and minute bas-reliefs like cameos were made of it, fit even for being set as jewels.

qa_pairs.question: Wedgy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Like a wedge; wedge-shaped.

qa_pairs.question: Wedlock
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The ceremony, or the state, of marriage; matrimony.

qa_pairs.question: Wedlock
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To marry; to unite in marriage; to wed.

qa_pairs.question: Wednesday
qa_pairs.answer: It means The fourth day of the week; the next day after Tuesday.

qa_pairs.question: Wee
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A little; a bit, as of space, time, or distance.

qa_pairs.question: Wee
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Very small; little.

qa_pairs.question: Weech-elm
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The wych-elm.

qa_pairs.question: Weed
qa_pairs.answer: It means A garment; clothing; especially, an upper or outer garment.

qa_pairs.question: Weed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sudden illness or relapse, often attended with fever, which attacks women in childbed.

qa_pairs.question: Weed
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Underbrush; low shrubs.

qa_pairs.question: Weed
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To free from noxious plants; to clear of weeds; as, to weed corn or onions; to weed a garden.

qa_pairs.question: Weeder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, weeds, or frees from anything noxious.

qa_pairs.question: Weedery
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weeds, collectively; also, a place full of weeds or for growing weeds.

qa_pairs.question: Weeding
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (a. & n.) from Weed, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Weeding-rhim
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of implement used for tearing up weeds esp. on summer fallows.

qa_pairs.question: Weedless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Free from weeds or noxious matter.

qa_pairs.question: Weed out
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as to selectively remove; same as weed{2}, (v. t.); -- of things that are useless or harmful.

qa_pairs.question: Weedy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to weeds; consisting of weeds.

qa_pairs.question: Weedy
qa_pairs.answer: It means Dressed in weeds, or mourning garments.

qa_pairs.question: Week
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A period of seven days, usually that reckoned from one Sabbath or Sunday to the next.

qa_pairs.question: Week-end
qa_pairs.answer: It means The end of the week, usually comprising the period from Friday evening to Monday morning, observed commonly as a period of respite from work or school; as, to visit one for a week-end; also, a house party during a week-end. Contrasted to work days.

qa_pairs.question: Weekly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to a week, or week days; as, weekly labor.

qa_pairs.question: Weekly
qa_pairs.answer: It means A publication issued once in seven days, or appearing once a week.

qa_pairs.question: Weekly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Once a week; by hebdomadal periods; as, each performs service weekly.

qa_pairs.question: Weekwam
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Wigwam.

qa_pairs.question: Weel
qa_pairs.answer: It means Well.

qa_pairs.question: Weel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A whirlpool.

qa_pairs.question: Weel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of trap or snare for fish, made of twigs.

qa_pairs.question: Ween
qa_pairs.answer: It means To think; to imagine; to fancy.

qa_pairs.question: Weep
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The lapwing; the wipe; -- so called from its cry.

qa_pairs.question: Weep
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as (imp.) of Weep, for wept.

qa_pairs.question: Weep
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Formerly, to express sorrow, grief, or anguish, by outcry, or by other manifest signs; in modern use, to show grief or other passions by shedding tears; to shed tears; to cry.

qa_pairs.question: Weep
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To lament; to bewail; to bemoan.

qa_pairs.question: Weeper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who weeps; esp., one who sheds tears.

qa_pairs.question: Weepful
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Full of weeping or lamentation; grieving.

qa_pairs.question: Weeping
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of one who weeps; lamentation with tears; shedding of tears.

qa_pairs.question: Weeping
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Grieving; lamenting; shedding tears.

qa_pairs.question: weeping beech
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a variety of European beech (Fagus pendula, Fagus sylvatica pendula) with pendulous limbs.

qa_pairs.question: weeping love grass
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a perennial South African grass (Eragrostis curvula) having densly clumped flimsy stems; introduced into U.S. esp. for erosion control.

qa_pairs.question: Weepingly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a weeping manner.

qa_pairs.question: Weeping-ripe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Ripe for weeping; ready to weep.

qa_pairs.question: weeping spruce
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a medium-sized spruce of California and Oregon (Picea breweriana) having pendulous branches.

qa_pairs.question: Weeping tree
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any tree having pendulous branches.

qa_pairs.question: weeping tree broom
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a small shrubby tree of New Zealand having weeping branches and racemes of white to violet flowers followed by woolly indehiscent 2-seeded pods.

qa_pairs.question: weeping widow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is same as crumblecap.

qa_pairs.question: Weeping willow
qa_pairs.answer: It means a tree (Salix babylonica) of the willow family with slender leaves, native to China, whose branches grow very long and slender, and hang down almost perpendicularly. It grows best where soil is moist, as by the banks of streams and is widely cultivated as an ornamental tree.

qa_pairs.question: Weerish
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Wearish.

qa_pairs.question: Weesel
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Weasel.

qa_pairs.question: Weet
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wet.

qa_pairs.question: Weet
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To know; to wit.

qa_pairs.question: Weet-bird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The wryneck; -- so called from its cry.

qa_pairs.question: Weetingly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Knowingly.

qa_pairs.question: Weetless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Unknowing; also, unknown; unmeaning.

qa_pairs.question: Weet-weet
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The common European sandpiper.

qa_pairs.question: Weet-weet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A throwing toy, or implement, of the Australian aborigines, consisting of a cigar-shaped stick fastened at one end to a flexible twig. It weighs in all about two ounces, and is about two feet long.

qa_pairs.question: Weever
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of several species of edible marine fishes belonging to the genus *Trachinus*, of the family Trachinidae. They have a broad spinose head, with the eyes looking upward. The long dorsal fin is supported by numerous strong, sharp spines which cause painful wounds.

qa_pairs.question: Weevil
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of snout beetles, or Rhynchophora, in which the head is elongated and usually curved downward. Many of the species are very injurious to cultivated plants. The larvae of some of the species live in nuts, fruit, and grain by eating out the interior, as the plum weevil, or curculio, the nut weevils, and the grain weevil (see under Plum, Nut, and Grain). The larvae of other species bore under the bark and into the pith of trees and various other plants, as the pine weevils (see under Pine). See also Pea weevil, Rice weevil, Seed weevil, under Pea, Rice, and Seed.

qa_pairs.question: Weeviled
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Infested by weevils; as, weeviled grain.

qa_pairs.question: Weevily
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having weevils; weeviled.

qa_pairs.question: Weezel
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weasel.

qa_pairs.question: Weft
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as (imp. & p. p.) of Wave.

qa_pairs.question: Weft
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A thing waved, waived, or cast away; a waif.

qa_pairs.question: Weft
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The woof of cloth; the threads that cross the warp from selvage to selvage; the thread carried by the shuttle in weaving.

qa_pairs.question: Weftage
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Texture.

qa_pairs.question: Wegotism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Excessive use of the pronoun we; -- called also also known as weism.

qa_pairs.question: Wehrgeld
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weregild.

qa_pairs.question: Wehrwolf
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Werewolf.

qa_pairs.question: Weigela
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A hardy garden shrub (Diervilla Japonica) belonging to the Honeysuckle family, with white or red flowers. It was introduced from China.

qa_pairs.question: Weigh
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A corruption of Way, used only in the phrase under weigh.

qa_pairs.question: Weigh
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To bear up; to raise; to lift into the air; to swing up; as, to weigh anchor.

qa_pairs.question: Weigh
qa_pairs.answer: It means To have weight; to be heavy.

qa_pairs.question: Weigh
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A certain quantity estimated by weight; an English measure of weight. See Wey.

qa_pairs.question: Weighable
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Capable of being weighed.

qa_pairs.question: Weighage
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A duty or toil paid for weighing merchandise.

qa_pairs.question: Weighbeam
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kind of large steelyard for weighing merchandise; -- also called also known as weighmaster's beam.

qa_pairs.question: Weighboard
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Clay intersecting a vein.

qa_pairs.question: Weighbridge
qa_pairs.answer: It means A weighing machine on which loaded carts may be weighed; platform scales.

qa_pairs.question: Weigher
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who weighs; specifically, an officer whose duty it is to weigh commodities.

qa_pairs.question: Weigh-house
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A building at or within which goods, and the like, are weighed.

qa_pairs.question: Weighing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (a. & n.) from Weigh, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Weighlock
qa_pairs.answer: It means A lock, as on a canal, in which boats are weighed and their tonnage is settled.

qa_pairs.question: Weighmaster
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One whose business it is to weigh ore, hay, merchandise, etc.; one licensed as a public weigher.

qa_pairs.question: Weight
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality of being heavy; that property of bodies by which they tend toward the center of the earth; the effect of gravitative force, especially when expressed in certain units or standards, as pounds, grams, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weight
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To load with a weight or weights; to load down; to make heavy; to attach weights to; as, to weight a horse or a jockey at a race; to weight a whip handle.

qa_pairs.question: Weightily
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a weighty manner.

qa_pairs.question: Weightiness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being weighty; weight; force; importance; impressiveness.

qa_pairs.question: Weightless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having no weight; imponderable; hence, light.

qa_pairs.question: Weighty
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having weight; heavy; ponderous; as, a weighty body.

qa_pairs.question: Weils disease
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An acute infectious febrile disease, resembling typhoid fever, with muscular pains, disturbance of the digestive organs, jaundice, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Weir
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A dam in a river to stop and raise the water, for the purpose of conducting it to a mill, forming a fish pond, or the like.

qa_pairs.question: Weird
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Fate; destiny; one of the Fates, or Norns; also, a prediction.

qa_pairs.question: Weird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to fate; concerned with destiny.

qa_pairs.question: Weird
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To foretell the fate of; to predict; to destine to.

qa_pairs.question: Weirdness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being weird.

qa_pairs.question: Weism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Wegotism.

qa_pairs.question: Weismannism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The theories and teachings in regard to heredity propounded by the German biologist August Weismann, esp. in regard to germ plasm as the basis of heredity and the impossibility of transmitting acquired characteristics; -- often called also known as neo-Darwinism.

qa_pairs.question: Weiss beer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A light-colored highly effervescent beer made by the top-fermentation process.

qa_pairs.question: Weive
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Waive.

qa_pairs.question: Weka
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A New Zealand rail (Ocydromus australis) which has wings so short as to be incapable of flight.

qa_pairs.question: Wekau
qa_pairs.answer: It means A small New Zealand owl (Sceloglaux albifacies). It has short wings and long legs, and lives chiefly on the ground.

qa_pairs.question: Wekeen
