qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The meadow pipit.

qa_pairs.question: Welaway
qa_pairs.answer: It means Alas!

qa_pairs.question: Wel-begone
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Surrounded with happiness or prosperity.

qa_pairs.question: Welch
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Welsh.

qa_pairs.question: Welcher
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Welsher.

qa_pairs.question: Welchman
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Welshman.

qa_pairs.question: Welcome
qa_pairs.answer: It means Received with gladness; admitted willingly to the house, entertainment, or company; as, a welcome visitor.

qa_pairs.question: Welcome
qa_pairs.answer: It means Salutation to a newcomer.

qa_pairs.question: Welcome
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To salute with kindness, as a newcomer; to receive and entertain hospitably and cheerfully; as, to welcome a visitor; to welcome a new idea.

qa_pairs.question: Welcomely
qa_pairs.answer: It means In a welcome manner.

qa_pairs.question: Welcomeness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being welcome; gratefulness; agreeableness; kind reception.

qa_pairs.question: Welcomer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who welcomes; one who salutes, or receives kindly, a newcomer.

qa_pairs.question: Weld
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To wield.

qa_pairs.question: Weld
qa_pairs.answer: It means An herb (Reseda luteola) related to mignonette, growing in Europe, and to some extent in America; dyer's broom; dyer's rocket; dyer's weed; wild woad. It is used by dyers to give a yellow color.

qa_pairs.question: Weld
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To press or beat into intimate and permanent union, as two pieces of iron when heated almost to fusion.

qa_pairs.question: Weld
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The state of being welded; the joint made by welding.

qa_pairs.question: Weldable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being welded.

qa_pairs.question: Welder
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who welds, or unites pieces of iron, etc., by welding.

qa_pairs.question: Welder
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who welds, or wields.

qa_pairs.question: Weldons process
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A process for the recovery or regeneration of manganese dioxide in the manufacture of chlorine, by means of milk of lime and the oxygen of the air; -- so called after the inventor.

qa_pairs.question: Weld steel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A compound of iron, such as puddled steel, made without complete fusion.

qa_pairs.question: Wele
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Prosperity; happiness; well-being; weal.

qa_pairs.question: Weleful
qa_pairs.answer: It means Producing prosperity or happiness; blessed.

qa_pairs.question: Welew
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To welk, or wither.

qa_pairs.question: Welfare
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Well-doing or well-being in any respect; the enjoyment of health and the common blessings of life; exemption from any evil or calamity; prosperity; happiness.

qa_pairs.question: Welfaring
qa_pairs.answer: It means Faring well; prosperous; thriving.

qa_pairs.question: Welk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To wither; to fade; also, to decay; to decline; to wane.

qa_pairs.question: Welk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cause to wither; to wilt.

qa_pairs.question: Welk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A pustule. See 2d Whelk.

qa_pairs.question: Welk
qa_pairs.answer: It means A whelk.

qa_pairs.question: Welked
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Whelked.

qa_pairs.question: Welkin
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The visible regions of the air; the vault of heaven; the sky.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An issue of water from the earth; a spring; a fountain.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To issue forth, as water from the earth; to flow; to spring.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To pour forth, as from a well.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: It means In a good or proper manner; justly; rightly; not ill or wickedly.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Good in condition or circumstances; desirable, either in a natural or moral sense; fortunate; convenient; advantageous; happy; as, it is well for the country that the crops did not fail; it is well that the mistake was discovered.

qa_pairs.question: Welladay
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Alas! Welaway!

qa_pairs.question: Wellat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The king parrakeet See under King.

qa_pairs.question: Well-being
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The state or condition of being well; welfare; happiness; prosperity; as, virtue is essential to the well-being of men or of society.

qa_pairs.question: Well-born
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Born of a noble or respect able family; not of mean birth.

qa_pairs.question: Well-bred
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having good breeding; refined in manners; polite; cultivated.

qa_pairs.question: Welldoer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who does well; one who does good to another; a benefactor.

qa_pairs.question: Welldoing
qa_pairs.answer: It means A doing well; right performance of duties. Also used adjectively.

qa_pairs.question: Welldrain
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To drain, as land; by means of wells, or pits, which receive the water, and from which it is discharged by machinery.

qa_pairs.question: Wellfare
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Welfare.

qa_pairs.question: Well-favored
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Handsome; wellformed; beautiful; pleasing to the eye.

qa_pairs.question: Wellhead
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A source, spring, or fountain.

qa_pairs.question: Wellhole
qa_pairs.answer: It means The open space in a floor, to accommodate a staircase.

qa_pairs.question: Well-informed
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Correctly informed; provided with information; well furnished with authentic knowledge; intelligent.

qa_pairs.question: Wellington boot
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A riding boot for men, the front of which came above the knee; also, a similar shorter boot worn under the trousers.

qa_pairs.question: Wellingtonia
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A name given to the <ldquo/big trees<rdquo/ (Sequoia gigantea) of California, and still used in England. See Sequoia.

qa_pairs.question: Wellingtons
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of long boots for men.

qa_pairs.question: Well-intentioned
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having upright intentions or honorable purposes.

qa_pairs.question: Well-known
qa_pairs.answer: It means Fully known; generally known or acknowledged.

qa_pairs.question: Well-liking
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Being in good condition.

qa_pairs.question: Well-mannered
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Polite; well-bred; complaisant; courteous.

qa_pairs.question: Well-meaner
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One whose intention is good.

qa_pairs.question: Well-meaning
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having a good intention.

qa_pairs.question: Well-natured
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Good-natured; kind.

qa_pairs.question: Well-nigh
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Almost; nearly.

qa_pairs.question: Well-plighted
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Being well folded.

qa_pairs.question: Well-read
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of extensive reading; deeply versed; -- often followed by in.

qa_pairs.question: Well-seen
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having seen much; hence, accomplished; experienced.

qa_pairs.question: Well-set
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Properly or firmly set.

qa_pairs.question: Well-sped
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having good success.

qa_pairs.question: Well-spoken
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Speaking well; speaking with fitness or grace; speaking kindly.

qa_pairs.question: Wellspring
qa_pairs.answer: It means A fountain; a spring; a source of continual supply.

qa_pairs.question: Well-willer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who wishes well, or means kindly.

qa_pairs.question: Well-wish
qa_pairs.answer: It means A wish of happiness.

qa_pairs.question: Wellwisher
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who wishes another well; one who is benevolently or friendlily inclined.

qa_pairs.question: Well
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Contraction for we will or we shall.

qa_pairs.question: Wels
qa_pairs.answer: It means The sheatfish; -- called also also known as waller.

qa_pairs.question: Welsbach
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to Auer von Welsbach or the incandescent gas burner invented by him.

qa_pairs.question: Welsh
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to Wales, or its inhabitants.

qa_pairs.question: Welsh
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The language of Wales, or of the Welsh people.

qa_pairs.question: Welsh
qa_pairs.answer: It means To cheat by avoiding payment of bets; -- said esp. of an absconding bookmaker at a race track.

qa_pairs.question: Welsher
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who cheats at a horse race; one who bets, without a chance of being able to pay; one who receives money to back certain horses and absconds with it.

qa_pairs.question: Welshman
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A native or inhabitant of Wales; one of the Welsh.

qa_pairs.question: Welsh rarebit
qa_pairs.answer: It means same as Welsh rabbit.

qa_pairs.question: Welsome
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Prosperous; well.

qa_pairs.question: welt
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is That which, being sewed or otherwise fastened to an edge or border, serves to guard, strengthen, or adorn it

qa_pairs.question: Welt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To furnish with a welt; to sew or fasten a welt on; as, to welt a boot or a shoe; to welt a sleeve.

qa_pairs.question: Welt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To wilt.

qa_pairs.question: Weltanschauung
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Lit., world view; a conception of the course of events in, and of the purpose of, the world as a whole, forming a philosophical view or apprehension of the universe; the general idea embodied in a cosmology.

qa_pairs.question: Welte
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as (imp.) of Weld, to wield.

qa_pairs.question: Welter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To roll, as the body of an animal; to tumble about, especially in anything foul or defiling; to wallow.

qa_pairs.question: Welter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To wither; to wilt.

qa_pairs.question: Welter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of, pertaining to, or designating, the most heavily weighted race in a meeting; as, a welter race; the welter stakes.

qa_pairs.question: Welter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as That in which any person or thing welters, or wallows; filth; mire; slough.

qa_pairs.question: Welterweight
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A weight of 28 pounds (one of 40 pounds is called a heavy welterweight) sometimes imposed in addition to weight for age, chiefly in steeplechases and hurdle races.

qa_pairs.question: Weltschmertz
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Sorrow or sadness over the present or future evils or woes of the world in general; sentimental pessimism.

qa_pairs.question: Welwitschia
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An African plant (Welwitschia mirabilis) belonging to the order Gnetaceae. It consists of a short, woody, topshaped stem, and never more than two leaves, which are the cotyledons enormously developed, and at length split into diverging segments.

qa_pairs.question: Wem
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The abdomen; the uterus; the womb.

qa_pairs.question: Wem

qa_pairs.question: Wem

qa_pairs.question: Wemless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having no wem, or blemish; spotless.

qa_pairs.question: Wen
qa_pairs.answer: It means An indolent, encysted tumor of the skin; especially, a sebaceous cyst.

qa_pairs.question: Wench
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A young woman; a girl; a maiden.

qa_pairs.question: Wench
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To frequent the company of wenches, or women of ill fame.

qa_pairs.question: Wencher
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who wenches; a lewd man.

qa_pairs.question: Wenchless
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Being without a wench.

qa_pairs.question: Wend
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is (p. p.) of Wene.

qa_pairs.question: Wend
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To go; to pass; to betake one's self.

qa_pairs.question: Wend
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To direct; to betake; -- used chiefly in the phrase to wend one's way. Also used reflexively.

qa_pairs.question: Wend
qa_pairs.answer: It means A large extent of ground; a perambulation; a circuit.

qa_pairs.question: Wende
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (imp.) of Wene.

qa_pairs.question: Wendic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining the Wends, or their language.

qa_pairs.question: Wendic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The language of the Wends.

qa_pairs.question: Wends
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Slavic tribe which once occupied the northern and eastern parts of Germany, of which a small remnant exists.

qa_pairs.question: Wene
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To ween.

qa_pairs.question: W<ecir/n-li
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The higher literary idiom of Chinese, that of the canonical books and of all composition pretending to literary standing. It employs a classical or academic diction, and a more condensed and sententious style than Mandarin, and differs also in the doubling and arrangement of words.

qa_pairs.question: Wenlock group
qa_pairs.answer: It means The middle subdivision of the Upper Silurian in Great Britain; -- so named from the typical locality in Shropshire.

qa_pairs.question: Wennel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Weanel.

qa_pairs.question: Wennish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the nature of a wen; resembling a wen; as, a wennish excrescence.

qa_pairs.question: Wenona
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sand snake (Charina plumbea) of Western North America, of the family Erycidae.

qa_pairs.question: Went
qa_pairs.answer: It means (imp. & p. p.) of Wend; -- now obsolete except as the imperfect of go, with which it has no etymological connection. See Go.

qa_pairs.question: Went
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Course; way; path; journey; direction.

qa_pairs.question: Wentletrap
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of numerous species of elegant, usually white, marine shells of the genus Scalaria, especially Scalaria pretiosa, which was formerly highly valued; -- called also also known as staircase shell. See Scalaria.

qa_pairs.question: Wep
qa_pairs.answer: It means (imp.) of Weep.

qa_pairs.question: Wepen
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Weapon.

qa_pairs.question: Wept
qa_pairs.answer: It means (imp. & p. p.) of Weep.

qa_pairs.question: Werche
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To work.

qa_pairs.question: Were
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To wear. See 3d Wear.

qa_pairs.question: Were
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A weir. See Weir.

qa_pairs.question: Were
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To guard; to protect.

qa_pairs.question: Were
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The imperfect indicative plural, and imperfect subjunctive singular and plural, of the verb be. See Be.

qa_pairs.question: Were
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A man.

qa_pairs.question: Weregild
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The price of a man's head; a compensation paid of a man killed, partly to the king for the loss of a subject, partly to the lord of a vassal, and partly to the next of kin. It was paid by the murderer.

qa_pairs.question: Werewolf
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A person transformed into a wolf in form and appetite, either temporarily or permanently, whether by supernatural influences, by witchcraft, or voluntarily; a lycanthrope. Belief in werewolves, formerly general, is not now extinct.

qa_pairs.question: Werk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Work.

qa_pairs.question: Wern
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To refuse.

qa_pairs.question: Wernerian
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to A. G. Werner, The German mineralogist and geologist, who classified minerals according to their external characters, and advocated the theory that the strata of the earth's crust were formed by depositions from water; designating, or according to, Werner's system.

qa_pairs.question: Wernerite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The common grayish or white variety of soapolite.

qa_pairs.question: Weroole
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An Australian lorikeet (Ptilosclera versicolor) noted for the variety of its colors; -- called also also known as varied lorikeet.

qa_pairs.question: Werre
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is War.

qa_pairs.question: Werrey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To warray.

qa_pairs.question: Werst
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Verst.

qa_pairs.question: Wert
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The second person singular, indicative and subjunctive moods, imperfect tense, of the verb be. It is formed from were, with the ending -t, after the analogy of wast. Now used only in solemn or poetic style.

qa_pairs.question: Wert
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A wart.

qa_pairs.question: Weryangle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Wariangle.

qa_pairs.question: Wesand
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Weasand.

qa_pairs.question: Wesh
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Washed.

qa_pairs.question: Wesil
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weasand.

qa_pairs.question: Wesleyan
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to Wesley or Wesleyanism.

qa_pairs.question: Wesleyan
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who adopts the principles of Wesleyanism; a Methodist.

qa_pairs.question: Wesleyanism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The system of doctrines and church polity inculcated by John Wesley (b. 1703; d. 1791), the founder of the religious sect called Methodist; Methodism. See Methodist, (n.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: West
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The point in the heavens where the sun is seen to set at the equinox; or, the corresponding point on the earth; that one of the four cardinal points of the compass which is in a direction at right angles to that of north and south, and on the left hand of a person facing north; the point directly opposite to east.

qa_pairs.question: West
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lying toward the west; situated at the west, or in a western direction from the point of observation or reckoning; proceeding toward the west, or coming from the west; as, a west course is one toward the west; an east and west line; a west wind blows from the west.

qa_pairs.question: West
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Westward.

qa_pairs.question: West
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To pass to the west; to set, as the sun.

qa_pairs.question: Westering
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Passing to the west.

qa_pairs.question: Westerly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the west; toward the west; coming from the west; western.

qa_pairs.question: Westerly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Toward the west; westward.

qa_pairs.question: Western
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the west; situated in the west, or in the region nearly in the direction of west; being in that quarter where the sun sets; as, the western shore of France; the western ocean.

qa_pairs.question: Westerner
qa_pairs.answer: It means A native or inhabitant of the west.

qa_pairs.question: Westernmost
qa_pairs.answer: It means Situated the farthest towards the west; most western.

qa_pairs.question: West India
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Belonging or relating to the West Indies.

qa_pairs.question: West Indian
qa_pairs.answer: It means A native of, or a dweller in, the West Indies.

qa_pairs.question: Westing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The distance, reckoned toward the west, between the two meridians passing through the extremities of a course, or portion of a ship's path; the departure of a course which lies to the west of north.

qa_pairs.question: Westling
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A westerner.

qa_pairs.question: Westminster Assembly
qa_pairs.answer: It means See under Assembly.

qa_pairs.question: Westmost
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lying farthest to the west; westernmost.

qa_pairs.question: Westward
qa_pairs.answer: It means Toward the west; as, to ride or sail westward.

qa_pairs.question: Westward
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lying toward the west.

qa_pairs.question: Westward
qa_pairs.answer: It means The western region or countries; the west.

qa_pairs.question: Westwardly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a westward direction.

qa_pairs.question: Westy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Dizzy; giddy.

qa_pairs.question: Wet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Containing, or consisting of, water or other liquid; moist; soaked with a liquid; having water or other liquid upon the surface; as, wet land; a wet cloth; a wet table.

qa_pairs.question: Wet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Water or wetness; moisture or humidity in considerable degree.

qa_pairs.question: Wet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To fill or moisten with water or other liquid; to sprinkle; to cause to have water or other fluid adherent to the surface; to dip or soak in a liquid; as, to wet a sponge; to wet the hands; to wet cloth.

qa_pairs.question: wetback
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A Mexican who enters the United States illegally, by wading across the Rio Grande; -- disparaging and offensive.

qa_pairs.question: Wetbird
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The chaffinch, whose cry is thought to foretell rain.

qa_pairs.question: Wet-bulb thermometer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is That one of the two similar thermometers of a psychrometer the bulb of which is moistened; also, the entire instrument.

qa_pairs.question: Wether
qa_pairs.answer: It means A castrated ram.

qa_pairs.question: Wetness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being wet; moisture; humidity; as, the wetness of land; the wetness of a cloth.

qa_pairs.question: Wet nurse
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A nurse who suckles a child, especially the child of another woman. Cf. Dry nurse.

qa_pairs.question: Wet plate
qa_pairs.answer: It means A plate the film of which retains its sensitiveness only while wet. The film used in such plates is of collodion impregnated with bromides and iodides. Before exposure the plate is immersed in a solution of silver nitrate, and immediately after exposure it is developed and fixed.

qa_pairs.question: Wet-shod
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the feet, or the shoes on the feet, wet.

qa_pairs.question: Wettish
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Somewhat wet; moist; humid.

qa_pairs.question: Wevil
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Weevil.

qa_pairs.question: Wex
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To grow; to wax.

qa_pairs.question: Wex
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Waxed.

qa_pairs.question: Wex
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Wax.

qa_pairs.question: Wey
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Way; road; path.

qa_pairs.question: Wey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To weigh.

qa_pairs.question: Wey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A certain measure of weight.

qa_pairs.question: Weyle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To wail.

qa_pairs.question: Weyleway
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Welaway.

qa_pairs.question: Weyve
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To waive.

qa_pairs.question: Wezand
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Weasand.

qa_pairs.question: Whaap
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The European curlew; -- called also also known as awp, also known as whaup, also known as great whaup, and also known as stock whaup.

qa_pairs.question: whachamacallit
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any object whose name is forgotten, or not known.

qa_pairs.question: Whack
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To strike; to beat; to give a heavy or resounding blow to; to thrash; to make with whacks.

qa_pairs.question: Whack
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To strike anything with a smart blow.

qa_pairs.question: Whack
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A smart resounding blow.

qa_pairs.question: Whacker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who whacks.

qa_pairs.question: Whacking
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Very large; whapping.

qa_pairs.question: Whack off
qa_pairs.answer: It means to sever with a blow; to cut off.

qa_pairs.question: Whack off
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is to masturbate.

qa_pairs.question: Whahoo
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An American tree, the winged elm. (Ulmus alata).

qa_pairs.question: Whala
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To lash with stripes; to wale; to thrash; to drub.

qa_pairs.question: Whale
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any aquatic mammal of the order Cetacea, especially any one of the large species, some of which become nearly one hundred feet long. Whales are hunted chiefly for their oil and baleen, or whalebone.

qa_pairs.question: Whaleback
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A form of vessel, often with steam power, having sharp ends and a very convex upper deck, much used on the Great Lakes, esp. for carrying grain.

qa_pairs.question: Whaleboat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A long, narrow boat, sharp at both ends, used by whalemen.

qa_pairs.question: Whalebone
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A firm, elastic substance resembling horn, taken from the upper jaw of the right whale; baleen. It is used as a stiffening in stays, fans, screens, and for various other purposes. See Baleen.

qa_pairs.question: Whaleman
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A man employed in the whale fishery.

qa_pairs.question: Whaler
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A vessel or person employed in the whale fishery.

qa_pairs.question: Whaler
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who whales, or beats; a big, strong fellow; hence, anything of great or unusual size.

qa_pairs.question: Whaling
qa_pairs.answer: It means The hunting of whales.

qa_pairs.question: Whaling
qa_pairs.answer: It means Pertaining to, or employed in, the pursuit of whales; as, a whaling voyage; a whaling vessel.

qa_pairs.question: Whall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A light color of the iris in horses; wall-eye.

qa_pairs.question: Whally
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having the iris of light color; -- said of horses.

qa_pairs.question: Whame
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A breeze fly.

qa_pairs.question: Whammel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To turn over.

qa_pairs.question: Whan
qa_pairs.answer: It means When.

qa_pairs.question: Whang
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A leather thong.

qa_pairs.question: Whang
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To beat; thrash; bang; also, to throw, hurl, or fling about, violently.

qa_pairs.question: Whang
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A blow; whack.

qa_pairs.question: Whangdoodle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An imaginary creature, of undefined character.

qa_pairs.question: Whanghee
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Wanghee.

qa_pairs.question: Whap
qa_pairs.answer: It means To throw one's self quickly, or by an abrupt motion; to turn suddenly; as, she whapped down on the floor; the fish whapped over.

qa_pairs.question: Whap
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To beat or strike.

qa_pairs.question: Whap
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A blow, or quick, smart stroke.

qa_pairs.question: Whapper
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Something uncommonly large of the kind; something astonishing; -- applied especially to a bold lie. Now (1998) usually spelled whopper.

qa_pairs.question: Whapping
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Very large; monstrous; astonishing; as, a whapping story.

qa_pairs.question: Wharf
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A structure or platform of timber, masonry, iron, earth, or other material, built on the shore of a harbor, river, canal, or the like, and usually extending from the shore to deep water, so that vessels may lie close alongside to receive and discharge cargo, passengers, etc.; a quay; a pier.

qa_pairs.question: Wharf
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To guard or secure by a firm wall of timber or stone constructed like a wharf; to furnish with a wharf or wharfs.

qa_pairs.question: Wharfage
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The fee or duty paid for the privilege of using a wharf for loading or unloading goods; pierage, collectively; quayage.

qa_pairs.question: Wharfing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Wharfs, collectively.

qa_pairs.question: Wharfinger
qa_pairs.answer: It means A man who owns, or has the care of, a wharf.

qa_pairs.question: Wharl
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A guttural pronunciation of the letter _r_; a burr. See Burr, (n.), 6.

qa_pairs.question: Wharp
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of fine sand from the banks of the Trent, used as a polishing powder.

qa_pairs.question: What
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as As an interrogative pronoun, used in asking questions regarding either persons or things; as, what is this? what did you say? what poem is this? what child is lost?

qa_pairs.question: What
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Something; thing; stuff.

qa_pairs.question: What
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Why? For what purpose? On what account?

qa_pairs.question: whatchamacallit
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any object whose name is forgotten, or not known.

qa_pairs.question: Whateer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A contraction of what-ever; -- used in poetry.

qa_pairs.question: Whatever
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Anything soever which; the thing or things of any kind; being this or that; of one nature or another; one thing or another; anything that may be; all that; the whole that; all particulars that; -- used both substantively and adjectively.

qa_pairs.question: Whatnot
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of stand, or piece of furniture, having shelves for books, ornaments, etc.; an <eacute/tag<egrave/re.

qa_pairs.question: Whatso
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whatsoever; whosoever; whatever; anything that.

qa_pairs.question: Whatsoeer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A contraction of whatsoever; -- used in poetry.

qa_pairs.question: Whatsoever
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whatever.

qa_pairs.question: Whaul
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Whall.

qa_pairs.question: Whaup
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Whaap.

qa_pairs.question: Wheal
qa_pairs.answer: It means A pustule; a whelk.

qa_pairs.question: Wheal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A more or less elongated mark raised by a stroke; also, a similar mark made by any cause; a weal; a wale.

qa_pairs.question: Wheal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A mine.

qa_pairs.question: Whealworm
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The harvest mite; -- so called from the wheals, caused by its bite.

qa_pairs.question: Wheat
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A cereal grass (Triticum vulgare) and its grain, which furnishes a white flour for bread, and, next to rice, is the grain most largely used by the human race.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatbird
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A bird that feeds on wheat, especially the chaffinch.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatear
qa_pairs.answer: It means A small European singing bird (Saxicola <oe/nanthe). The male is white beneath, bluish gray above, with black wings and a black stripe through each eye. The tail is black at the tip and in the middle, but white at the base and on each side. Called also also known as checkbird, also known as chickell, also known as dykehopper, also known as fallow chat, also known as fallow finch, also known as stonechat, and also known as whitetail.

qa_pairs.question: Wheaten
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Made of wheat; as, wheaten bread.

qa_pairs.question: Wheat rust
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A disease of wheat and other grasses caused by the rust fungus Puccinia graminis; also, the fungus itself.

qa_pairs.question: Wheat sawfly
qa_pairs.answer: It means A small European sawfly (Cephus pygmaeus) whose larva does great injury to wheat by boring in the stalks.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatsel bird
qa_pairs.answer: It means The male of the chaffinch.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatstones bridge
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See under Bridge.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatstones rods
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Flexible rods the period of vibration of which in two planes at right angles are in some exact ratio to one another. When one end of such a rod is fixed, the free end describes in vibrating the corresponding Lissajous figure. So called because devised by Sir Charles Wheatstone.

qa_pairs.question: Wheatworm
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A small nematode worm (Tylenchus tritici, formerly Anguillula tritici) which attacks wheat, advancing through the stem to the grains in the ear. In wheat affected with smut, each of the diseased grains may contain a large number of the minute young of the worm.

qa_pairs.question: Wheder
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whether.

qa_pairs.question: Wheedle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To entice by soft words; to cajole; to flatter; to coax.

qa_pairs.question: Wheedle
qa_pairs.answer: It means To flatter; to coax; to cajole.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A circular frame turning about an axis; a rotating disk, whether solid, or a frame composed of an outer rim, spokes or radii, and a central hub or nave, in which is inserted the axle, -- used for supporting and conveying vehicles, in machinery, and for various purposes; as, the wheel of a wagon, of a locomotive, of a mill, of a watch, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To convey on wheels, or in a wheeled vehicle; as, to wheel a load of hay or wood.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To turn on an axis, or as on an axis; to revolve; to more about; to rotate; to gyrate.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelband
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The tire of a wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelbarrow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A light vehicle for conveying small loads. It has two handles and one wheel, and is rolled by a single person.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel base
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The figure inclosed by lines through the points contact of the wheels of a vehicle, etc., with the surface or rails on which they run; more esp., the length of this figure between the points of contact of the two extreme wheels on either side.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelbird
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The European goatsucker.

qa_pairs.question: Wheeled
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having wheels; -- used chiefly in composition; as, a four-wheeled carriage.

qa_pairs.question: Wheeler
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who wheels, or turns.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelhouse
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small house on or above a vessel's deck, containing the steering wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Wheeling
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of conveying anything, or traveling, on wheels, or in a wheeled vehicle.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelman
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who rides a bicycle or tricycle; a cycler, or cyclist.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel of fortune
qa_pairs.answer: It means A gambling or lottery device consisting of a wheel which is spun horizontally, articles or sums to which certain marks on its circumference point when it stops being distributed according to varying rules.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel-shaped
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Shaped like a wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelswarf
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Swarf.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelwork
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A combination of wheels, and their connection, in a machine or mechanism.

qa_pairs.question: Wheel-worn
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Worn by the action of wheels; as, a wheel-worn road.

qa_pairs.question: Wheelwright
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A man whose occupation is to make or repair wheels and wheeled vehicles, as carts, wagons, and the like.

qa_pairs.question: Wheely
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Circular; suitable to rotation.

qa_pairs.question: Wheen
qa_pairs.answer: It means A quantity; a goodly number.

qa_pairs.question: Wheeze
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To breathe hard, and with an audible piping or whistling sound, as persons affected with asthma.

qa_pairs.question: Wheeze
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A piping or whistling sound caused by difficult respiration.

qa_pairs.question: Wheezy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Breathing with difficulty and with a wheeze; wheezing. Used also figuratively.

qa_pairs.question: Wheft
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Waft, (n.), 4.

qa_pairs.question: Whelk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one numerous species of large marine gastropods belonging to *Buccinum* and allied genera; especially, Buccinum undatum, common on the coasts both of Europe and North America, and much used as food in Europe.

qa_pairs.question: Whelk
qa_pairs.answer: It means A papule; a pustule; acne.

qa_pairs.question: Whelked
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having whelks; whelky; as, whelked horns.

qa_pairs.question: Whelky
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having whelks, ridges, or protuberances; hence, streaked; striated.

qa_pairs.question: Whelm
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To cover with water or other fluid; to cover by immersion in something that envelops on all sides; to overwhelm; to ingulf.

qa_pairs.question: Whelp
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One of the young of a dog or a beast of prey; a puppy; a cub; as, a lion's whelps.

qa_pairs.question: Whelp
qa_pairs.answer: It means To bring forth young; -- said of the female of the dog and some beasts of prey.

qa_pairs.question: Whelp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To bring forth, as cubs or young; to give birth to.

qa_pairs.question: When
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as At what time; -- used interrogatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whenas
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whereas; while

qa_pairs.question: Whence
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is From what place; hence, from what or which source, origin, antecedent, premise, or the like; how; -- used interrogatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whenceever
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whencesoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whenceforth
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is From, or forth from, what or which place; whence.

qa_pairs.question: Whencesoever
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as From what place soever; from what cause or source soever.

qa_pairs.question: Wheneer
qa_pairs.answer: It means Whenever.

qa_pairs.question: Whenever
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is At whatever time.

qa_pairs.question: Whennes
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whence.

qa_pairs.question: Whensoever
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as At what time soever; at whatever time; whenever.

qa_pairs.question: Wher
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Whether.

qa_pairs.question: Where
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as At or in what place; hence, in what situation, position, or circumstances; -- used interrogatively.

qa_pairs.question: Where
qa_pairs.answer: It means Whereas.

qa_pairs.question: Where
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Place; situation.

qa_pairs.question: Whereabout
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is About where; near what or which place; -- used interrogatively and relatively; as, whereabouts did you meet him?

qa_pairs.question: Whereabout
qa_pairs.answer: It means The place where a person or thing is; as, they did not know his whereabouts.

qa_pairs.question: Whereas
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is At which place; where.

qa_pairs.question: Whereas
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Considering that; it being the case that; since; -- used to introduce a preamble which is the basis of declarations, affirmations, commands, requests, or like, that follow.

qa_pairs.question: Whereat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as At which; upon which; whereupon; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereby
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as By which; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wherever; -- a contracted and poetical form.

qa_pairs.question: Wherefore
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is For which reason; so; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Wherefore
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as the reason why.

qa_pairs.question: Whereform
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as From which; from which or what place.

qa_pairs.question: Wherein
qa_pairs.answer: It means In which; in which place, thing, time, respect, or the like; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereinto
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Into which; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of having a place; ubiety; situation; position.

qa_pairs.question: Whereof
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of which; of whom; formerly, also, with which; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is On which; -- used relatively; as, the earth whereon we live.

qa_pairs.question: Whereout
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Out of which.

qa_pairs.question: Whereso
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wheresoever.

qa_pairs.question: Wheresoeer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Wheresoever.

qa_pairs.question: Wheresoever
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In what place soever; in whatever place; wherever.

qa_pairs.question: Wherethrough
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Through which.

qa_pairs.question: Whereto
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To which; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whereunto
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Whereto.

qa_pairs.question: Whereupon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Upon which; in consequence of which; after which.

qa_pairs.question: Wherever
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is At or in whatever place; wheresoever.

qa_pairs.question: Wherewith
qa_pairs.answer: It means With which; -- used relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Wherewith
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The necessary means or instrument.

qa_pairs.question: Wherewithal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wherewith.

qa_pairs.question: Wherret
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To hurry; to trouble; to tease.

qa_pairs.question: Wherret
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A box on the ear.

qa_pairs.question: Wherry
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A passenger barge or lighter plying on rivers; also, a kind of light, half-decked vessel used in fishing.

qa_pairs.question: Wherry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A liquor made from the pulp of crab apples after the verjuice is expressed; -- sometimes called also known as crab wherry.

qa_pairs.question: Wherso
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Wheresoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To rub or on with some substance, as a piece of stone, for the purpose of sharpening; to sharpen by attrition; as, to whet a knife.

qa_pairs.question: Whet
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of whetting.

qa_pairs.question: Whether
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Which (of two); which one (of two); -- used interrogatively and relatively.

qa_pairs.question: Whether
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In case; if; -- used to introduce the first or two or more alternative clauses, the other or others being connected by or, or by or whether. When the second of two alternatives is the simple negative of the first it is sometimes only indicated by the particle not or no after the correlative, and sometimes it is omitted entirely as being distinctly implied in the whether of the first.

qa_pairs.question: Whethering
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The retention of the afterbirth in cows.

qa_pairs.question: Whetile
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The green woodpecker, or yaffle. See Yaffle.

qa_pairs.question: Whetstone
qa_pairs.answer: It means A piece of stone, natural or artificial, used for whetting, or sharpening, edge tools.

qa_pairs.question: Whetter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, whets, sharpens, or stimulates.

qa_pairs.question: Whettlebones
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The vertebrae of the back.

qa_pairs.question: Whew
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sound like a half-formed whistle, expressing astonishment, scorn, or dislike.

qa_pairs.question: Whew
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To whistle with a shrill pipe, like a plover.

qa_pairs.question: Whewellite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Calcium oxalate, occurring in colorless or white monoclinic crystals.

qa_pairs.question: Whewer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The European widgeon.

qa_pairs.question: Whey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The serum, or watery part, of milk, separated from the more thick or coagulable part, esp. in the process of making cheese.

qa_pairs.question: Whey cure
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Treatment with whey as a drink and in baths.

qa_pairs.question: Wheyey
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of the nature of, or containing, whey; resembling whey; wheyish.

qa_pairs.question: Wheyface
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who is pale, as from fear.

qa_pairs.question: Whey-faced
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having a pale or white face, as from fright.

qa_pairs.question: Wheyish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Somewhat like whey; wheyey.

qa_pairs.question: Which
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of what sort or kind; what; what a; who.

qa_pairs.question: Whichever
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whether one or another; whether one or the other; which; that one (of two or more) which; as, whichever road you take, it will lead you to town.

qa_pairs.question: Whidah bird
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of several species of finchlike birds belonging to the genus *Vidua*, native of Asia and Africa. In the breeding season the male has very long, drooping tail feathers. Called also also known as vida finch, also known as whidah finch, also known as whydah bird, also known as whydah finch, also known as widow bird, and also known as widow finch.

qa_pairs.question: Whider
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Whither.

qa_pairs.question: Whiff
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sudden expulsion of air from the mouth; a quick puff or slight gust, as of air or smoke.

qa_pairs.question: Whiff
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To throw out in whiffs; to consume in whiffs; to puff.

qa_pairs.question: Whiff
qa_pairs.answer: It means To emit whiffs, as of smoke; to puff.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffet
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A little whiff or puff.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffing
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of one who, or that which, whiffs.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To waver, or shake, as if moved by gusts of wind; to shift, turn, or veer about.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffle
qa_pairs.answer: It means To disperse with, or as with, a whiff, or puff; to scatter.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A fife or small flute.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffler
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who whiffles, or frequently changes his opinion or course; one who uses shifts and evasions in argument; hence, a trifler.

qa_pairs.question: Whiffletree
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Whippletree.

qa_pairs.question: Whig
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Acidulated whey, sometimes mixed with buttermilk and sweet herbs, used as a cooling beverage.

qa_pairs.question: Whig
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of a political party which grew up in England in the seventeenth century, in the reigns of Charles I. and II., when great contests existed respecting the royal prerogatives and the rights of the people. Those who supported the king in his high claims were called Tories, and the advocates of popular rights, of parliamentary power over the crown, and of toleration to Dissenters, were, after 1679, called Whigs. The terms Liberal and Radical have now generally superseded Whig in English politics. See the note under Tory.

qa_pairs.question: Whig
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the Whigs.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggamore
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A Whig; -- a cant term applied in contempt to Scotch Presbyterians.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggarchy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Government by Whigs.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggery
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The principles or practices of the Whigs; Whiggism.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggish
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to Whigs; partaking of, or characterized by, the principles of Whigs.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggishly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a Whiggish manner.

qa_pairs.question: Whiggism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The principles of the Whigs.

qa_pairs.question: Whigling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A petty or inferior Whig; -- used in contempt.

qa_pairs.question: While
qa_pairs.answer: It means Space of time, or continued duration, esp. when short; a time; as, one while we thought him innocent.

qa_pairs.question: While
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cause to pass away pleasantly or without irksomeness or disgust; to spend or pass; -- usually followed by away.

qa_pairs.question: While
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To loiter.

qa_pairs.question: While
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is During the time that; as long as; whilst; at the same time that; as, while I write, you sleep.

qa_pairs.question: While
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Until; till.

qa_pairs.question: Whilere
qa_pairs.answer: It means A little while ago; recently; just now; erewhile.

qa_pairs.question: Whiles
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Meanwhile; meantime.

qa_pairs.question: Whiles
qa_pairs.answer: It means During the time that; while.

qa_pairs.question: Whilk
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of mollusk, a whelk.

qa_pairs.question: Whilk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Which.

qa_pairs.question: Whilom
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Formerly; once; of old; erewhile; at times.

qa_pairs.question: Whilst
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is While.

qa_pairs.question: Whim
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The European widgeon.

qa_pairs.question: Whim
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sudden turn or start of the mind; a temporary eccentricity; a freak; a fancy; a capricious notion; a humor; a caprice.

qa_pairs.question: Whim
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To be subject to, or indulge in, whims; to be whimsical, giddy, or freakish.

qa_pairs.question: Whimbrel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of small curlews, especially the European species (Numenius phaeopus), called also also known as Jack curlew, also known as half curlew, also known as stone curlew, and also known as tang whaup. See Illustration in Appendix.

qa_pairs.question: Whimling
qa_pairs.answer: It means One given to whims; hence, a weak, childish person; a child.

qa_pairs.question: Whimmy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Full of whims; whimsical.

qa_pairs.question: Whimper
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cry with a low, whining, broken voice; to whine; to complain; as, a child whimpers.

qa_pairs.question: Whimper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To utter in alow, whining tone.

qa_pairs.question: Whimper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A low, whining, broken cry; a low, whining sound, expressive of complaint or grief.

qa_pairs.question: Whimperer
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who whimpers.

qa_pairs.question: Whimple
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Wimple.

qa_pairs.question: Whimple
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To whiffle; to veer.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsey
qa_pairs.answer: It means A whim; a freak; a capricious notion, a fanciful or odd conceit.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsey
qa_pairs.answer: It means To fill with whimseys, or whims; to make fantastic; to craze.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsical
qa_pairs.answer: It means Full of, or characterized by, whims; actuated by a whim; having peculiar notions; queer; strange; freakish.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsicality
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being whimsical; whimsicalness.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsically
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a whimsical manner; freakishly.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsicalness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being whimsical; freakishness; whimsical disposition.

qa_pairs.question: Whimsy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A whimsey.

qa_pairs.question: Whimwham
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A whimsical thing; an odd device; a trifle; a trinket; a gimcrack.

qa_pairs.question: Whin
qa_pairs.answer: It means Gorse; furze. See Furze.

qa_pairs.question: Whinberry
qa_pairs.answer: It means The English bilberry; -- so called because it grows on moors among the whins, or furze.

qa_pairs.question: Whinchat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A small warbler (Pratincola rubetra) common in Europe; -- called also also known as whinchacker, also known as whincheck, also known as whin-clocharet.

qa_pairs.question: Whine
qa_pairs.answer: It means To utter a plaintive cry, as some animals; to moan with a childish noise; to complain, or to tell of sorrow, distress, or the like, in a plaintive, nasal tone; hence, to complain or to beg in a mean, unmanly way; to moan basely.

qa_pairs.question: Whine
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To utter or express plaintively, or in a mean, unmanly way; as, to whine out an excuse.

qa_pairs.question: Whine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A plaintive tone; the nasal, childish tone of mean complaint; mean or affected complaint.

qa_pairs.question: Whiner
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, whines.

qa_pairs.question: Whinge
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To whine.

qa_pairs.question: Whinger
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of hanger or sword used as a knife at meals and as a weapon.

qa_pairs.question: Whiningly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a whining manner; in a tone of mean complaint.

qa_pairs.question: Whinner
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To whinny.

qa_pairs.question: Whinny
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To utter the ordinary call or cry of a horse; to neigh.

qa_pairs.question: Whinny
qa_pairs.answer: It means The ordinary cry or call of a horse; a neigh.

qa_pairs.question: Whinny
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Abounding in whin, gorse, or furze.

qa_pairs.question: Whinock
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The small pig of a litter.

qa_pairs.question: Whinstone
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A provincial name given in England to basaltic rocks, and applied by miners to other kind of dark-colored unstratified rocks which resist the point of the pick. -- for example, to masses of chert. Whin-dikes, and whin-sills, are names sometimes given to veins or beds of basalt.

qa_pairs.question: Whinyard
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A sword, or hanger.

qa_pairs.question: Whip
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To strike with a lash, a cord, a rod, or anything slender and lithe; to lash; to beat; as, to whip a horse, or a carpet.

qa_pairs.question: Whip
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To move nimbly; to start or turn suddenly and do something; to whisk; as, he whipped around the corner.

qa_pairs.question: Whip
qa_pairs.answer: It means An instrument or driving horses or other animals, or for correction, consisting usually of a lash attached to a handle, or of a handle and lash so combined as to form a flexible rod.

qa_pairs.question: Whipcord
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of hard-twisted or braided cord, sometimes used for making whiplashes.

qa_pairs.question: Whipgraft
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To graft by cutting the scion and stock in a certain manner. See Whip grafting, under Grafting.

qa_pairs.question: Whiplash
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The lash of a whip, -- usually made of thongs of leather, or of cords, braided or twisted.

qa_pairs.question: Whiplash injury
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as an injury to the neck caused by the sudden motion of the head backward and forward, as occurs to the occupants of a vehicle hit from behind by another vehicle.

qa_pairs.question: Whipparee
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large sting ray (Dasybatis Sayi, _or_ Trygon Sayi) native of the Southern United States. It is destitute of large spines on the body and tail.

qa_pairs.question: Whipper
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who whips; especially, an officer who inflicts the penalty of legal whipping.

qa_pairs.question: Whipperin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A huntsman who keeps the hounds from wandering, and whips them in, if necessary, to the of chase.

qa_pairs.question: Whippersnapper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A diminutive, insignificant, or presumptuous person.

qa_pairs.question: Whipping
qa_pairs.answer: It means (a & n.) from Whip, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Whippletree
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The pivoted or swinging bar to which the traces, or tugs, of a harness are fastened, and by which a carriage, a plow, or other implement or vehicle, is drawn; a whiffletree; a swingletree; a singletree. See Singletree.

qa_pairs.question: Whip-poor-will
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An American bird (Antrostomus vociferus) allied to the nighthawk and goatsucker; -- so called in imitation of the peculiar notes which it utters in the evening.

qa_pairs.question: Whipsaw
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A saw for dividing timber lengthwise, usually set in a frame, and worked by two persons; also, a fret saw.

qa_pairs.question: Whipsaw
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To saw with the whipsaw.

qa_pairs.question: Whip-shaped
qa_pairs.answer: It means Shaped like the lash of a whip; long, slender, round, and tapering; as, a whip-shaped root or stem.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstaff
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A bar attached to the tiller, for convenience in steering.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstalk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A whipstock.

qa_pairs.question: Whipster
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A nimble little fellow; a whippersnapper.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstick
qa_pairs.answer: It means Whip handle; whipstock.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstitch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A tailor; -- so called in contempt.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstitch
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To rafter; to plow in ridges, as land.

qa_pairs.question: Whipstock
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The rod or handle to which the lash of a whip is fastened.

qa_pairs.question: Whipt
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Whipped.

qa_pairs.question: Whip-tom-kelly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vireo (Vireo altiloquus) native of the West Indies and Florida; -- called also also known as black-whiskered vireo.

qa_pairs.question: Whipworm
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A nematode worm (Trichocephalus dispar) often found parasitic in the human intestine. Its body is thickened posteriorly, but is very long and threadlike anteriorly.

qa_pairs.question: Whir
qa_pairs.answer: It means To whirl round, or revolve, with a whizzing noise; to fly or more quickly with a buzzing or whizzing sound; to whiz.

qa_pairs.question: Whir
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To hurry a long with a whizzing sound.

qa_pairs.question: Whir
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A buzzing or whizzing sound produced by rapid or whirling motion; as, the whir of a partridge; the whir of a spinning wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Whirl
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To turn round rapidly; to cause to rotate with velocity; to make to revolve.

qa_pairs.question: Whirl
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To be turned round rapidly; to move round with velocity; to revolve or rotate with great speed; to gyrate.

qa_pairs.question: Whirl
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A turning with rapidity or velocity; rapid rotation or circumvolution; quick gyration; rapid or confusing motion; as, the whirl of a top; the whirl of a wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlabout
qa_pairs.answer: It means Something that whirls or turns about in a rapid manner; a whirligig.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlbat
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Anything moved with a whirl, as preparatory for a blow, or to augment the force of it; -- applied by poets to the cestus of ancient boxers.

qa_pairs.question: Whirl-blast
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A whirling blast or wind.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlbone
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The huckle bone.

qa_pairs.question: Whirler
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, whirls.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlicote
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An open car or chariot.

qa_pairs.question: Whirligig
qa_pairs.answer: It means A child's toy, spun or whirled around like a wheel upon an axis, or like a top.

qa_pairs.question: Whirling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (a. & n.) from Whirl, (v. t.)

qa_pairs.question: Whirlpit
qa_pairs.answer: It means A whirlpool.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlpool
qa_pairs.answer: It means An eddy or vortex of water; a place in a body of water where the water moves round in a circle so as to produce a depression or cavity in the center, into which floating objects may be drawn; any body of water having a more or less circular motion caused by its flowing in an irregular channel, by the coming together of opposing currents, or the like.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlwig
qa_pairs.answer: It means A whirligig.

qa_pairs.question: Whirlwind
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A violent windstorm of limited extent, as the tornado, characterized by an inward spiral motion of the air with an upward current in the center; a vortex of air. It usually has a rapid progressive motion.

qa_pairs.question: Whirry
qa_pairs.answer: It means To whir.

qa_pairs.question: Whirtle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A perforated steel die through which wires or tubes are drawn to form them.

qa_pairs.question: Whisk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A game at cards; whist.

qa_pairs.question: Whisk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of whisking; a rapid, sweeping motion, as of something light; a sudden motion or quick puff.

qa_pairs.question: Whisk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To sweep, brush, or agitate, with a light, rapid motion; as, to whisk dust from a table; to whisk the white of eggs into a froth.

qa_pairs.question: Whisk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To move nimbly at with velocity; to make a sudden agile movement.

qa_pairs.question: Whisker
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who, or that which, whisks, or moves with a quick, sweeping motion.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskered
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Formed into whiskers; furnished with whiskers; having or wearing whiskers.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskerless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Being without whiskers.

qa_pairs.question: Whisket
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A basket; esp., a straw provender basket.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskey
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Whisky, a liquor.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A light carriage built for rapid motion; -- called also also known as tim-whiskey.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskey Ring
qa_pairs.answer: It means A conspiracy of distillers and government officials during the administration of President Grant to defraud the government of the excise taxes. The frauds were detected in 1875 through the efforts of the Secretary of the Treasury B. H. Bristow, and most of the offenders were convicted.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A shallow drinking bowl.

qa_pairs.question: Whisking
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Sweeping along lightly.

qa_pairs.question: Whisky
qa_pairs.answer: It means An intoxicating liquor distilled from grain, potatoes, etc., especially in Scotland, Ireland, and the United States. In the United States, whisky is generally distilled from maize, rye, or wheat, but in Scotland and Ireland it is often made from malted barley.

qa_pairs.question: Whiskyfied
qa_pairs.answer: It means Drunk with whisky; intoxicated.

qa_pairs.question: Whisp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Wisp.

qa_pairs.question: Whisp
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A flock of snipe.

qa_pairs.question: Whisper
qa_pairs.answer: It means To speak softly, or under the breath, so as to be heard only by one near at hand; to utter words without sonant breath; to talk without that vibration in the larynx which gives sonorous, or vocal, sound. See Whisper, (n.)

qa_pairs.question: Whisper
qa_pairs.answer: It means To utter in a low and nonvocal tone; to say under the breath; hence, to mention privately and confidentially, or in a whisper.

qa_pairs.question: Whisper
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A low, soft, sibilant voice or utterance, which can be heard only by those near at hand; voice or utterance that employs only breath sound without tone, friction against the edges of the vocal cords and arytenoid cartilages taking the place of the vibration of the cords that produces tone; sometimes, in a limited sense, the sound produced by such friction as distinguished from breath sound made by friction against parts of the mouth. See Voice, (n.), 2, and Guide to Pronunciation, <sect/<sect/ 5, 153, 154.

qa_pairs.question: Whisperer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who whispers.

qa_pairs.question: Whispering
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as (a. & n.) from Whisper. (v. t.)

qa_pairs.question: Whisperingly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a whisper, or low voice; in a whispering manner; with whispers.

qa_pairs.question: Whisperously
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whisperingly.

qa_pairs.question: Whist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Be silent; be still; hush; silence.

qa_pairs.question: Whist
qa_pairs.answer: It means A certain game at cards; -- so called because it requires silence and close attention. It is played by four persons (those who sit opposite each other being partners) with a complete pack of fifty-two cards. Each player has thirteen cards, and when these are played out, the hand is finished, and the cards are again shuffled and distributed.

qa_pairs.question: Whist
qa_pairs.answer: It means To hush or silence.

qa_pairs.question: Whist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To be or become silent or still; to be hushed or mute.

qa_pairs.question: Whist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Not speaking; not making a noise; silent; mute; still; quiet.

qa_pairs.question: Whistle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To make a kind of musical sound, or series of sounds, by forcing the breath through a small orifice formed by contracting the lips; also, to emit a similar sound, or series of notes, from the mouth or beak, as birds.

qa_pairs.question: Whistle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To form, utter, or modulate by whistling; as, to whistle a tune or an air.

qa_pairs.question: Whistle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sharp, shrill, more or less musical sound, made by forcing the breath through a small orifice of the lips, or through or instrument which gives a similar sound; the sound used by a sportsman in calling his dogs; the shrill note of a bird; as, the sharp whistle of a boy, or of a boatswain's pipe; the blackbird's mellow whistle.

qa_pairs.question: Whistlefish
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A gossat, or rockling; -- called also also known as whistler, also known as three-bearded rockling, also known as sea loach, and also known as sorghe.

qa_pairs.question: Whistler
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who, or that which, whistles, or produces or a whistling sound.

qa_pairs.question: Whistlewing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The American golden-eye.

qa_pairs.question: Whistlewood
qa_pairs.answer: It means The moosewood, or striped maple. See Maple.

qa_pairs.question: Whistling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (a. & n.) from Whistle, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Whistlingly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a whistling manner; shrilly.

qa_pairs.question: Whistly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a whist manner; silently.

qa_pairs.question: Whit
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The smallest part or particle imaginable; a bit; a jot; an iota; -- generally used in an adverbial phrase in a negative sentence.

qa_pairs.question: White
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Reflecting to the eye all the rays of the spectrum combined; not tinted with any of the proper colors or their mixtures; having the color of pure snow; snowy; -- the opposite of Antonym: black or dark; as, white paper; a white skin.

qa_pairs.question: White
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The color of pure snow; one of the natural colors of bodies, yet not strictly a color, but a composition of all colors; the opposite of black; whiteness. See the Note under Color, (n.), 1.

qa_pairs.question: White
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make white; to whiten; to whitewash; to bleach.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteback
qa_pairs.answer: It means The canvasback.

qa_pairs.question: Whitebait
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The young of several species of herrings, especially of the common herring, esteemed a great delicacy by epicures in England.

qa_pairs.question: Whitebeam
qa_pairs.answer: It means The common beam tree of England (Pyrus Aria); -- so called from the white, woolly under surface of the leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Whitebeard
qa_pairs.answer: It means An old man; a graybeard.

qa_pairs.question: Whitebelly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The American widgeon, or baldpate.

qa_pairs.question: Whitebill
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The American coot.

qa_pairs.question: White-blaze
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See White-face.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteblow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Whitlow grass, under Whitlow.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteboy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A favorite.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteboyism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The conduct or principle of the Whiteboys.

qa_pairs.question: Whitecap
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The European redstart; -- so called from its white forehead.

qa_pairs.question: Whitecoat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The skin of a newborn seal; also, the seal itself.

qa_pairs.question: White-ear
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The wheatear.

qa_pairs.question: White elephant
qa_pairs.answer: It means Something requiring much care and expense to maintain and yielding little profit, and often difficult to sell; any burdensome possession.

qa_pairs.question: White-eye
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of several species of small Old World singing of the genus *Zosterops*, as Zosterops palpebrosus of India, and Zosterops c<oe/rulescens of Australia. The eyes are encircled by a ring of white feathers, whence the name. Called also also known as bush creeper, and also known as white-eyed tit.

qa_pairs.question: White-face
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A white mark in the forehead of a horse, descending almost to the nose; -- called also also known as white-blaze.

qa_pairs.question: Whitefish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of *Coregonus*, a genus of excellent food fishes allied to the salmons. They inhabit the lakes of the colder parts of North America, Asia, and Europe. The largest and most important American species (Coregonus clupeiformis) is abundant in the Great Lakes, and in other lakes farther north. Called also also known as lake whitefish, and also known as Oswego bass.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteflaw
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A whitlow.

qa_pairs.question: White fly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of numerous small injurious hemipterous insects of the genus *Aleyrodes*, allied to scale insects. They are usually covered with a white or gray powder.

qa_pairs.question: White-foot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A white mark on the foot of a horse, between the fetlock and the coffin.

qa_pairs.question: White friar
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A mendicant monk of the Carmelite order, so called from the white cloaks worn by the order. See Carmelite.

qa_pairs.question: White-fronted
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having a white front; as, the white-fronted lemur.

qa_pairs.question: Whitehead
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The blue-winged snow goose.

qa_pairs.question: Whitehead torpedo
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A form of self-propelling torpedo.

qa_pairs.question: White-heart
qa_pairs.answer: It means A somewhat heart-shaped cherry with a whitish skin.

qa_pairs.question: whitehorse
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a whitecap{2} (the wave).

qa_pairs.question: White horse
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A large mass of tough sinewy substance in the head of sperm whales, just above the upper jaw and extending in streaks into the junk above it. It resembles blubber, but contains no oil. Also, the part of the head in which it occurs.

qa_pairs.question: White-hot
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as White with heat; heated to whiteness, or incandescence.

qa_pairs.question: White-limed
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Whitewashed or plastered with lime.

qa_pairs.question: White list
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A list of business concerns regarded as worthy of patronage by reason of compliance with certain conditions, as in regard to treatment of employees; as, the white list of the Consumers' League.

qa_pairs.question: White-livered
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having a pale look; feeble; hence, cowardly; pusillanimous; dastardly.

qa_pairs.question: Whitely
qa_pairs.answer: It means Like, or coming near to, white.

qa_pairs.question: White mustard
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of mustard (Sinapis alba) with rough-hairy foliage, a long-beaked hispid pod, and pale seeds, which yield mustard and mustard oil. The plant is also grown for forage.

qa_pairs.question: Whiten
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To grow white; to turn or become white or whiter; as, the hair whitens with age; the sea whitens with foam; the trees in spring whiten with blossoms.

qa_pairs.question: Whiten
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To make white; to bleach; to blanch; to whitewash; as, to whiten a wall; to whiten cloth.

qa_pairs.question: Whitener
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who, or that which, whitens; a bleaching agent; a bleach; a bleacher; a blancher; a whitewasher.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being white; white color, or freedom from darkness or obscurity on the surface.

qa_pairs.question: Whitening
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act or process of making or becoming white.

qa_pairs.question: White person
qa_pairs.answer: It means A person of the Caucasian race (6 Fed. Rep. 256).

qa_pairs.question: White noise
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a mixture or random noise sounds extending over the entire audible frequency spectrum with approximately equal intensity at all frequencies. It is used in certain experiments, as in psychology, to prevent subjects from hearing meaningful sounds.

qa_pairs.question: White plague
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Tuberculosis, esp. of the lungs.

qa_pairs.question: White-pot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kind of food made of milk or cream, eggs, sugar, bread, etc., baked in a pot.

qa_pairs.question: Whiterump
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The American black-tailed godwit.

qa_pairs.question: Whites
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Leucorrh<?/a.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteside
qa_pairs.answer: It means The golden-eye.
