qa_pairs.question: White slave
qa_pairs.answer: It means A woman held in involuntary confinement for purposes of prostitution; loosely, any woman forced into unwilling prostitution.

qa_pairs.question: White slaver
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A person engaged in procuring or holding a woman or women for unwilling prostitution.

qa_pairs.question: White slaving
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The action of one who procures or holds a woman or women for unwilling prostitution.

qa_pairs.question: Whitesmith
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who works in tinned or galvanized iron, or white iron; a tinsmith.

qa_pairs.question: Whitester
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A bleacher of linen; a whitener; a whitster.

qa_pairs.question: Whitetail
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The Virginia deer.

qa_pairs.question: Whitethorn
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The hawthorn.

qa_pairs.question: Whitethroat
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of several species of Old World warblers, esp. the common European species (Sylvia cinerea), called also also known as strawsmear, also known as nettlebird, also known as muff, and also known as whitecap, the garden whitethroat, or golden warbler (Sylvia hortensis), and the lesser whitethroat (Sylvia curruca).

qa_pairs.question: White-tie
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as requiring formal evening clothes, usually interpreted as a white bow tie and a tailcoat for men, and a formal evening dress for women; -- as, a white-tie reception at the embassy. Contrasting with black-tie and informal.

qa_pairs.question: Whitetop
qa_pairs.answer: It means Fiorin.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The spotted flycatcher; -- so called from the white color of the under parts.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewash
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any wash or liquid composition for whitening something, as a wash for making the skin fair.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewash
qa_pairs.answer: It means To apply a white liquid composition to; to whiten with whitewash.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewasher
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who whitewashes.

qa_pairs.question: White-water
qa_pairs.answer: It means A dangerous disease of sheep.

qa_pairs.question: Whiteweed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A perennial composite herb (Chrysanthemum Leucanthemum) with conspicuous white rays and a yellow disk, a common weed in grass lands and pastures; -- called also also known as oxeye daisy.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewing
qa_pairs.answer: It means The chaffinch; -- so called from the white bands on the wing.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewood
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The soft and easily-worked wood of the tulip tree (Liriodendron tulipifera). It is much used in cabinetwork, carriage building, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Whitewort
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wild camomile.

qa_pairs.question: Whitflaw
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whitlow.

qa_pairs.question: Whither
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To what place; -- used interrogatively; as, whither goest thou?

qa_pairs.question: Whithersoever
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To whatever place; to what place soever; wheresoever; as, I will go whithersoever you lead.

qa_pairs.question: Whitherward
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In what direction; toward what or which place.

qa_pairs.question: Whitile
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The yaffle.

qa_pairs.question: Whiting
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A common European food fish (Melangus vulgaris) of the Codfish family; -- called also also known as fittin.

qa_pairs.question: Whiting-mop
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A young whiting.

qa_pairs.question: Whitish
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Somewhat white; approaching white; white in a moderate degree.

qa_pairs.question: Whitishness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being whitish or somewhat white.

qa_pairs.question: Whitleather
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Leather dressed or tawed with alum, salt, etc., remarkable for its pliability and toughness; white leather.

qa_pairs.question: Whitling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A young full trout during its second season.

qa_pairs.question: Whitlow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An inflammation of the fingers or toes, generally of the last phalanx, terminating usually in suppuration. The inflammation may occupy any seat between the skin and the bone, but is usually applied to a felon or inflammation of the periosteal structures of the bone.

qa_pairs.question: Whitlow-wort
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Whitlow grass, under Whitlow.

qa_pairs.question: Whitmonday
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The day following Whitsunday; -- called also also known as Whitsun Monday.

qa_pairs.question: Whitneyite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as an arsenide of copper from Lake Superior.

qa_pairs.question: Whitson
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Whitsun.

qa_pairs.question: Whitsour
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sort of apple.

qa_pairs.question: Whitster
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A whitener; a bleacher; a whitester.

qa_pairs.question: Whitsun
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of, pertaining to, or observed at, Whitsuntide; as, Whitsun week; Whitsun Tuesday; Whitsun pastorals.

qa_pairs.question: Whitsunday
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The seventh Sunday, and the fiftieth day, after Easter; a festival of the church in commemoration of the descent of the Holy Spirit on the day of Pentecost; Pentecost; -- so called, it is said, because, in the primitive church, those who had been newly baptized appeared at church between Easter and Pentecost in white garments.

qa_pairs.question: Whitsuntide
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The week commencing with Whitsunday, esp. the first three days -- Whitsunday, Whitsun Monday, and Whitsun Tuesday; the time of Pentecost.

qa_pairs.question: Whitten tree
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Either of two shrubs (Viburnum Lantana, and Viburnum Opulus), so called on account of their whitish branches.

qa_pairs.question: Whitterick
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The curlew.

qa_pairs.question: Whittle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A grayish, coarse double blanket worn by countrywomen, in the west of England, over the shoulders, like a cloak or shawl.

qa_pairs.question: Whittle
qa_pairs.answer: It means A knife; esp., a pocket, sheath, or clasp knife.

qa_pairs.question: Whittle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To pare or cut off the surface of with a small knife; to cut or shape, as a piece of wood held in the hand, with a clasp knife or pocketknife.

qa_pairs.question: Whittle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To cut or shape a piece of wood with am small knife; to cut up a piece of wood with a knife.

qa_pairs.question: Whittlings
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Chips made by one who whittles; shavings cut from a stick with a knife.

qa_pairs.question: Whittret
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A weasel.

qa_pairs.question: Whittuesday
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The day following Whitmonday; -- called also also known as Whitsun Tuesday.

qa_pairs.question: Whitwall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Whetile.

qa_pairs.question: Whitworth ball
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A prejectile used in the Whitworth gun.

qa_pairs.question: Whitworth gun
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A form of rifled cannon and small arms invented by Sir Joseph Whitworth, of Manchester, England.

qa_pairs.question: Whity-brown
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of a color between white and brown.

qa_pairs.question: Whiz
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make a humming or hissing sound, like an arrow or ball flying through the air; to fly or move swiftly with a sharp hissing or whistling sound.

qa_pairs.question: Whiz
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A hissing and humming sound.

qa_pairs.question: Whizzingly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is With a whizzing sound.

qa_pairs.question: Who
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Originally, an interrogative pronoun, later, a relative pronoun also; -- used always substantively, and either as singular or plural. See the Note under What, (pron.), 1. As interrogative pronouns, who and whom ask the question: What or which person or persons? Who and whom, as relative pronouns (in the sense of that), are properly used of persons (corresponding to which, as applied to things), but are sometimes, less properly and now rarely, used of animals, plants, etc. Who and whom, as compound relatives, are also used especially of persons, meaning the person that; the persons that; the one that; whosoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whoa
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Stop; stand; hold. See Ho, 2.

qa_pairs.question: Whobub
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hubbub.

qa_pairs.question: Whoever
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Whatever person; any person who; be or she who; any one who; as, he shall be punished, whoever he may be.

qa_pairs.question: Whole
qa_pairs.answer: It means Containing the total amount, number, etc.; comprising all the parts; free from deficiency; all; total; entire; as, the whole earth; the whole solar system; the whole army; the whole nation.

qa_pairs.question: Whole
qa_pairs.answer: It means The entire thing; the entire assemblage of parts; totality; all of a thing, without defect or exception; a thing complete in itself.

qa_pairs.question: Whole-hoofed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having an undivided hoof, as the horse.

qa_pairs.question: Whole-length
qa_pairs.answer: It means Representing the whole figure; -- said of a picture or statue.

qa_pairs.question: Wholeness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being whole, entire, or sound; entireness; totality; completeness.

qa_pairs.question: Wholesale
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Sale of goods by the piece or large quantity, as distinguished from retail.

qa_pairs.question: Wholesale
qa_pairs.answer: It means Pertaining to, or engaged in, trade by the piece or large quantity; selling to retailers or jobbers rather than to consumers; as, a wholesale merchant; the wholesale price.

qa_pairs.question: Wholesome
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Tending to promote health; favoring health; salubrious; salutary.

qa_pairs.question: Whole-souled
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Thoroughly imbued with a right spirit; noble-minded; devoted.

qa_pairs.question: Wholly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a whole or complete manner; entirely; completely; perfectly.

qa_pairs.question: Whom
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The objective case of who. See Who.

qa_pairs.question: Whomsoever
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The objective of whosoever. See Whosoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whoobub
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hubbub.

qa_pairs.question: Whoop
qa_pairs.answer: It means The hoopoe.

qa_pairs.question: Whoop
qa_pairs.answer: It means To utter a whoop, or loud cry, as eagerness, enthusiasm, or enjoyment; to cry out; to shout; to halloo; to utter a war whoop; to hoot, as an owl.

qa_pairs.question: Whoop
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To insult with shouts; to chase with derision.

qa_pairs.question: Whoop
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A shout of pursuit or of war; a very of eagerness, enthusiasm, enjoyment, vengeance, terror, or the like; an halloo; a hoot, or cry, as of an owl.

qa_pairs.question: Whooper
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, whooops.

qa_pairs.question: Whooping
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as (a. & n.) from Whoop, (v. t.)

qa_pairs.question: Whoot
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To hoot.

qa_pairs.question: Whop
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Whap.

qa_pairs.question: Whop
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Whap.

qa_pairs.question: Whopper
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, whops.

qa_pairs.question: Whore
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A woman who practices unlawful sexual commerce with men, especially one who prostitutes her body for hire; a prostitute; a harlot.

qa_pairs.question: Whore
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To have unlawful sexual intercourse; to practice lewdness.

qa_pairs.question: Whore
qa_pairs.answer: It means To corrupt by lewd intercourse; to make a whore of; to debauch.

qa_pairs.question: Whoredom
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The practice of unlawful intercourse with the other sex; fornication; lewdness.

qa_pairs.question: Whoremaster
qa_pairs.answer: It means A man who practices lewdness; a lecher; a whoremonger.

qa_pairs.question: Whoremasterly
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the character of a whoremaster; lecherous; libidinous.

qa_pairs.question: Whoremonger
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A whoremaster; a lecher; a man who frequents the society of whores.

qa_pairs.question: Whoreson
qa_pairs.answer: It means A bastard; colloquially, a low, scurvy fellow; -- used generally in contempt, or in coarse humor. Also used adjectively.

qa_pairs.question: Whorish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Resembling a whore in character or conduct; addicted to unlawful pleasures; incontinent; lewd; unchaste.

qa_pairs.question: Whorl
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A circle of two or more leaves, flowers, or other organs, about the same part or joint of a stem.

qa_pairs.question: Whorled
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Furnished with whorls; arranged in the form of a whorl or whorls; verticillate; as, whorled leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Whorler
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A potter's wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Whort
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The whortleberry, or bilberry. See Whortleberry (a).

qa_pairs.question: Whortle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The whortleberry, or bilberry.

qa_pairs.question: Whortleberry
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In England, the fruit of Vaccinium Myrtillus; also, the plant itself. See Bilberry, 1.

qa_pairs.question: Whose
qa_pairs.answer: It means The possessive case of who or which. See Who, and Which.

qa_pairs.question: Whosesoever
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The possessive of whosoever. See Whosoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whoso
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whosoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whosoever
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Whatsoever person; any person whatever that; whoever.

qa_pairs.question: Whot
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hot.

qa_pairs.question: Whur
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make a rough, humming sound, like one who pronounces the letter r with too much force; to whir; to birr.

qa_pairs.question: Whur
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A humming or whirring sound, like that of a body moving through the air with velocity; a whir.

qa_pairs.question: Whurry
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To whisk along quickly; to hurry.

qa_pairs.question: Whurt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Whort.

qa_pairs.question: Why
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is For what cause, reason, or purpose; on what account; wherefore; -- used interrogatively. See the Note under What, pron., 1.

qa_pairs.question: Why
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A young heifer.

qa_pairs.question: Whydah bird
qa_pairs.answer: It means The whidah bird.

qa_pairs.question: Why-not
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A violent and peremptory procedure without any assigned reason; a sudden conclusive happening.

qa_pairs.question: Wicca
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A religion derived from pre-Christian times, also called also known as Witchcraft{4}, which practices a benevolent reverence for nature, and recognizes two deities, variously viewed as Mother & Father, Goddess & God, Female & Male, etc.; its practitioners are called Wiccans, Wiccas, or witches. Since there is no central authority to propagate dogma, the beliefs and practices of Wiccans vary significantly.

qa_pairs.question: Wiccan
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of, Wicca or its adherents.

qa_pairs.question: Wiccan
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An adherent or practitioner of Wicca.

qa_pairs.question: wich
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A variant of 1st wick.

qa_pairs.question: Wichitas
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A tribe of Indians native of the region between the Arkansas and Red rivers. They are related to the Pawnees. See Pawnees.

qa_pairs.question: wick
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A street; a village; a castle; a dwelling; a place of work, or exercise of authority; -- now obsolete except in composition; as, bailiwick, Warwick, Greenwick.

qa_pairs.question: wick
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A bundle of fibers, or a loosely twisted or braided cord, tape, or tube, usually made of soft spun cotton threads, which by capillary attraction draws up a steady supply of the oil in lamps, the melted tallow or wax in candles, or other material used for illumination, in small successive portions, to be burned.

qa_pairs.question: wick
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To strike a stone in an oblique direction.

qa_pairs.question: wicke
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Wicked.

qa_pairs.question: Wicked
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having a wick; -- used chiefly in composition; as, a two-wicked lamp.

qa_pairs.question: Wicked
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Evil in principle or practice; deviating from morality; contrary to the moral or divine law; addicted to vice or sin; sinful; immoral; profligate; -- said of persons and things; as, a wicked king; a wicked woman; a wicked deed; wicked designs.

qa_pairs.question: Wickedly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a wicked manner; in a manner, or with motives and designs, contrary to the divine law or the law of morality; viciously; corruptly; immorally.

qa_pairs.question: Wickedness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being wicked; departure from the rules of the divine or the moral law; evil disposition or practices; immorality; depravity; sinfulness.

qa_pairs.question: Wicken tree
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Quicken tree.

qa_pairs.question: Wicker
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A small pliant twig or osier; a rod for making basketwork and the like; a withe.

qa_pairs.question: Wicker
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Made of, or covered with, twigs or osiers, or wickerwork.

qa_pairs.question: Wickered
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Made of, secured by, or covered with, wickers or wickerwork.

qa_pairs.question: Wickerwork
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A texture of osiers, twigs, or rods; articles made of such a texture.

qa_pairs.question: Wicket
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small gate or door, especially one forming part of, or placed near, a larger door or gate; a narrow opening or entrance cut in or beside a door or gate, or the door which is used to close such entrance or aperture. Piers Plowman.

qa_pairs.question: Wicking
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as the material of which wicks are made; esp., a loosely braided or twisted cord or tape of cotton.

qa_pairs.question: Wickiup
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Vars of Wikiup.

qa_pairs.question: Wiclifite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Wyclifite.

qa_pairs.question: Wicopy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Leatherwood.

qa_pairs.question: Widals test
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A test for typhoid fever based on the fact that blood serum of one affected, in a bouillon culture of typhoid bacilli, causes the bacilli to agglutinate and lose their motility.

qa_pairs.question: Widdy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A rope or halter made of flexible twigs, or withes, as of birch.

qa_pairs.question: Wide
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having considerable distance or extent between the sides; spacious across; much extended in a direction at right angles to that of length; not narrow; broad; as, wide cloth; a wide table; a wide highway; a wide bed; a wide hall or entry.

qa_pairs.question: Wide
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To a distance; far; widely; to a great distance or extent; as, his fame was spread wide.

qa_pairs.question: Wide
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as That which is wide; wide space; width; extent.

qa_pairs.question: Wide-angle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having or covering an angle wider than the ordinary; -- applied to certain lenses of relatively short focus. Lenses for ordinary purposes have an angle of 50<deg/ or less. Wide-angle lenses may cover as much as 100<deg/ and are useful for photographing at short range, but the pictures appear distorted.

qa_pairs.question: Wide-awake
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Fully awake; not drowsy or dull; hence, knowing; keen; alert.

qa_pairs.question: Wide-awake
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A broad-brimmed, low-crowned felt hat.

qa_pairs.question: Widegap
qa_pairs.answer: It means The angler; -- called also also known as widegab, and also known as widegut.

qa_pairs.question: Widely
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a wide manner; to a wide degree or extent; far; extensively; as, the gospel was widely disseminated by the apostles.

qa_pairs.question: Widen
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make wide or wider; to extend in breadth; to increase the width of; as, to widen a field; to widen a breach; to widen a stocking.

qa_pairs.question: Widen
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To grow wide or wider; to enlarge; to spread; to extend.

qa_pairs.question: Wideness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being wide; breadth; width; great extent from side to side; as, the wideness of a room.

qa_pairs.question: Widespread
qa_pairs.answer: It means Spread to a great distance; widely extended; extending far and wide; as, widespread wings; a widespread movement.

qa_pairs.question: Widewhere
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Widely; far and wide.

qa_pairs.question: Widgeon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of fresh-water ducks, especially those belonging to the subgenus *Mareca*, of the genus *Anas*. The common European widgeon (Anas penelope) and the American widgeon (Anas Americana) are the most important species. The latter is called also also known as baldhead, also known as baldpate, also known as baldface, also known as baldcrown, also known as smoking duck, also known as wheat, also known as duck, and also known as whitebelly.

qa_pairs.question: Widish
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Moderately wide.

qa_pairs.question: Widmanst<aum/tten figures
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Certain figures appearing on etched meteoric iron; -- so called after A. B. Widmanst, of Vienna, who first described them in 1808. See the Note and Illust. under Meteorite.

qa_pairs.question: Widow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A woman who has lost her husband by death, and has not married again; one living bereaved of a husband.

qa_pairs.question: Widow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Widowed.

qa_pairs.question: Widow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To reduce to the condition of a widow; to bereave of a husband; -- rarely used except in the past participle.

qa_pairs.question: Widow bird
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Whidan bird.

qa_pairs.question: Widower
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A man who has lost his wife by death, and has not married again.

qa_pairs.question: Widowerhood
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The state of being a widower.

qa_pairs.question: Widowhood
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being a widow; the time during which a woman is widow; also, rarely, the state of being a widower.

qa_pairs.question: Widow-hunter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who courts widows, seeking to marry one with a fortune.

qa_pairs.question: Widowly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Becoming or like a widow.

qa_pairs.question: Widow-maker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who makes widows by destroying husbands.

qa_pairs.question: Widow-wail
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A low, narrowleaved evergreen shrub (Cneorum tricoccon) found in Southern Europe.

qa_pairs.question: Width
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality of being wide; extent from side to side; breadth; wideness; as, the width of cloth; the width of a door.

qa_pairs.question: Widual
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to a widow; vidual.

qa_pairs.question: Widwe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A widow.

qa_pairs.question: Wield
qa_pairs.answer: It means To govern; to rule; to keep, or have in charge; also, to possess.

qa_pairs.question: Wieldable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being wielded.

qa_pairs.question: Wieldance
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act or power of wielding.

qa_pairs.question: Wielder
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who wields or employs; a manager; a controller.

qa_pairs.question: Wielding
qa_pairs.answer: It means Power; authority; rule.

qa_pairs.question: Wieldless
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Not to be wielded; unmanageable; unwieldy.

qa_pairs.question: Wieldsome
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Admitting of being easily wielded or managed.

qa_pairs.question: Wieldy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Capable of being wielded; manageable; wieldable; -- opposed to unwieldy.

qa_pairs.question: Wiener Schnitzel
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A veal cutlet variously seasoned garnished, often with lemon, sardines, and capers.

qa_pairs.question: Wier
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Weir.

qa_pairs.question: Wierangle
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Wariangle.

qa_pairs.question: Wiery
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Wet; moist; marshy.

qa_pairs.question: Wiery
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wiry.

qa_pairs.question: Wife
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A woman; an adult female; -- now used in literature only in certain compounds and phrases, as alewife, fishwife, goodwife, and the like.

qa_pairs.question: Wifehood
qa_pairs.answer: It means Womanhood.

qa_pairs.question: Wifeless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Without a wife; unmarried.

qa_pairs.question: Wifelike
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of, pertaining to, or like, a wife or a woman.

qa_pairs.question: Wifely
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Becoming or life; of or pertaining to a wife.

qa_pairs.question: Wig
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A covering for the head, consisting of hair interwoven or united by a kind of network, either in imitation of the natural growth, or in abundant and flowing curls, worn to supply a deficiency of natural hair, or for ornament, or according to traditional usage, as a part of an official or professional dress, the latter especially in England by judges and barristers.

qa_pairs.question: Wig
qa_pairs.answer: It means To censure or rebuke; to hold up to reprobation; to scold.

qa_pairs.question: Wigan
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A kind of canvaslike cotton fabric, used to stiffen and protect the lower part of trousers and of the skirts of women's dresses, etc.; -- so called from Wigan, the name of a town in Lancashire, England.

qa_pairs.question: Wigeon
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A widgeon.

qa_pairs.question: Wigg
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of raised seedcake.

qa_pairs.question: Wigged
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the head covered with a wig; wearing a wig.

qa_pairs.question: Wiggery
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A wig or wigs; false hair.

qa_pairs.question: Wiggle
qa_pairs.answer: It means To move to and fro with a quick, jerking motion; to bend rapidly, or with a wavering motion, from side to side; to wag; to squirm; to wriggle; as, the dog wiggles his tail; the tadpole wiggles in the water.

qa_pairs.question: Wiggle
qa_pairs.answer: It means Act of wiggling; a wriggle.

qa_pairs.question: Wiggler
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The young, either larva or pupa, of the mosquito; -- called also also known as wiggletail.

qa_pairs.question: Wigher
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To neigh; to whinny.

qa_pairs.question: Wight
qa_pairs.answer: It means Weight.

qa_pairs.question: Wight
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A whit; a bit; a jot.

qa_pairs.question: Wight
qa_pairs.answer: It means Swift; nimble; agile; strong and active.

qa_pairs.question: Wightly
qa_pairs.answer: It means Swiftly; nimbly; quickly.

qa_pairs.question: Wigless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having or wearing no wig.

qa_pairs.question: Wigwag
qa_pairs.answer: It means To signal by means of a flag waved from side to side according to a code adopted for the purpose.

qa_pairs.question: Wigwag
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To move to and fro, to wag.

qa_pairs.question: Wigwag
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Act or art of wigwagging; a message wigwagged; -- chiefly attributive; as, the wigwag code.

qa_pairs.question: Wigwam
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An Indian cabin or hut, usually of a conical form, and made of a framework of poles covered with hides, bark, or mats; -- called also also known as tepee.

qa_pairs.question: Wike
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A temporary mark or boundary, as a bough of a tree set up in marking out or dividing anything, as tithes, swaths to be mowed in common ground, etc.; -- called also also known as wicker.

qa_pairs.question: Wike
qa_pairs.answer: It means A home; a dwelling.

qa_pairs.question: Wikiup
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The hut used by the nomadic Indian tribes of the arid regions of the west and southwest United States, typically elliptical in form, with a rough frame covered with reed mats or grass or brushwood.

qa_pairs.question: Wikke
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wicked.

qa_pairs.question: Wild
qa_pairs.answer: It means Living in a state of nature; inhabiting natural haunts, as the forest or open field; not familiar with, or not easily approached by, man; not tamed or domesticated; as, a wild boar; a wild ox; a wild cat.

qa_pairs.question: Wild
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An uninhabited and uncultivated tract or region; a forest or desert; a wilderness; a waste; as, the wilds of America; the wilds of Africa.

qa_pairs.question: Wild
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Wildly; as, to talk wild.

qa_pairs.question: Wild-cat
qa_pairs.answer: It means Unsound; worthless; irresponsible; unsafe; -- said to have been originally applied to the notes of an insolvent bank in Michigan upon which there was the figure of a panther.

qa_pairs.question: Wildebeest
qa_pairs.answer: It means The gnu.

qa_pairs.question: Wilded
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Become wild.

qa_pairs.question: Wilder
qa_pairs.answer: It means To bewilder; to perplex.

qa_pairs.question: Wildering
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A plant growing in a state of nature; especially, one which has run wild, or escaped from cultivation.

qa_pairs.question: Wilderment
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being bewildered; confusion; bewilderment.

qa_pairs.question: Wilderness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A tract of land, or a region, uncultivated and uninhabited by human beings, whether a forest or a wide, barren plain; a wild; a waste; a desert; a pathless waste of any kind.

qa_pairs.question: Wildfire
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A composition of inflammable materials, which, kindled, is very hard to quench; Greek fire.

qa_pairs.question: Wildgrave
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A waldgrave, or head forest keeper. See Waldgrave.

qa_pairs.question: Wilding
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A wild or uncultivated plant; especially, a wild apple tree or crab apple; also, the fruit of such a plant.

qa_pairs.question: Wilding
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Not tame, domesticated, or cultivated; wild.

qa_pairs.question: Wildish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Somewhat wild; rather wild.

qa_pairs.question: Wildly
qa_pairs.answer: It means In a wild manner; without cultivation; with disorder; rudely; distractedly; extravagantly.

qa_pairs.question: Wildness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being wild; an uncultivated or untamed state; disposition to rove or go unrestrained; rudeness; savageness; irregularity; distraction.

qa_pairs.question: Wildwood
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A wild or unfrequented wood. Also used adjectively; as, wildwood flowers; wildwood echoes.

qa_pairs.question: Wile
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A trick or stratagem practiced for insnaring or deception; a sly, insidious; artifice; a beguilement; an allurement.

qa_pairs.question: Wile
qa_pairs.answer: It means To practice artifice upon; to deceive; to beguile; to allure.

qa_pairs.question: Wileful
qa_pairs.answer: It means Full of wiles; trickish; deceitful.

qa_pairs.question: Wilfley table
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An inclined percussion table, usually with longitudinal grooves in its surface, agitated by side blows at right angles to the flow of the pulp; -- so called after the inventor.

qa_pairs.question: Wilful
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Willful, Willfully, and Willfulness.

qa_pairs.question: Wiliness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being wily; craftiness; cunning; guile.

qa_pairs.question: Wilk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Whelk.

qa_pairs.question: Will
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The power of choosing; the faculty or endowment of the soul by which it is capable of choosing; the faculty or power of the mind by which we decide to do or not to do; the power or faculty of preferring or selecting one of two or more objects.

qa_pairs.question: Will
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To wish; to desire; to incline to have.

qa_pairs.question: Will
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To be willing; to be inclined or disposed; to be pleased; to wish; to desire.

qa_pairs.question: Will
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To form a distinct volition of; to determine by an act of choice; to ordain; to decree.

qa_pairs.question: Will
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To exercise an act of volition; to choose; to decide; to determine; to decree.

qa_pairs.question: Willemite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A silicate of zinc, usually occurring massive and of a greenish yellow color, also in reddish crystals (troostite) containing manganese.

qa_pairs.question: Willer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who wills.

qa_pairs.question: Willet
qa_pairs.answer: It means A large North American snipe (Symphemia semipalmata); -- called also also known as pill-willet, also known as will-willet, also known as semipalmated tattler, or also known as snipe, also known as duck snipe, and also known as stone curlew.

qa_pairs.question: Willful
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of set purpose; self-determined; voluntary; as, willful murder.

qa_pairs.question: Willier
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who works at a willying machine.

qa_pairs.question: Willing
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Free to do or to grant; having the mind inclined; not opposed in mind; not choosing to refuse; disposed; not averse; desirous; consenting; complying; ready.

qa_pairs.question: Willingly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a willing manner; with free will; without reluctance; cheerfully.

qa_pairs.question: Willingness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being willing; free choice or consent of the will; freedom from reluctance; readiness of the mind to do or forbear.

qa_pairs.question: Williwaw
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A whirlwind, or whirlwind squall, encountered in the Straits of Magellan.

qa_pairs.question: Willock
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The common guillemot.

qa_pairs.question: Will-o-the-wisp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Ignis fatuus and phosphine.

qa_pairs.question: Willow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any tree or shrub of the genus *Salix*, including many species, most of which are characterized often used as an emblem of sorrow, desolation, or desertion. <ldquo/A wreath of willow to show my forsaken plight.<rdquo/ Sir W. Scott. Hence, a lover forsaken by, or having lost, the person beloved, is said to wear the willow.

qa_pairs.question: Willow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To open and cleanse, as cotton, flax, or wool, by means of a willow. See Willow, (n.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: Willowed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Abounding with willows; containing willows; covered or overgrown with willows.

qa_pairs.question: Willower
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A willow. See Willow, (n.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: Willow-herb
qa_pairs.answer: It means A perennial herb (Epilobium spicatum) with narrow willowlike leaves and showy rose-purple flowers. The name is sometimes made to include other species of the same genus.

qa_pairs.question: Willowish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the color of the willow; resembling the willow; willowy.

qa_pairs.question: Willow-thorn
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A thorny European shrub (Hippophae rhamnoides) resembling a willow.

qa_pairs.question: Willow-weed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A European species of loosestrife (Lysimachia vulgaris).

qa_pairs.question: Willow-wort
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Willow-weed.

qa_pairs.question: Willowy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Abounding with willows.

qa_pairs.question: Willsome
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Willful; obstinate.

qa_pairs.question: Willy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A large wicker basket.

qa_pairs.question: Willying
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The process of cleansing wool, cotton, or the like, with a willy, or willow.

qa_pairs.question: Willy nilly
qa_pairs.answer: It means Whether I (he, she, they) want to or not. See Will I, nill I, etc., under 3d Will.

qa_pairs.question: Wilne
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To wish; to desire.

qa_pairs.question: Wilt
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is (2d pers. sing.) of Will.

qa_pairs.question: Wilt
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To begin to wither; to lose freshness and become flaccid, as a plant when exposed when exposed to drought, or to great heat in a dry day, or when separated from its root; to droop;. to wither.

qa_pairs.question: Wilt
qa_pairs.answer: It means To cause to begin to wither; to make flaccid, as a green plant.

qa_pairs.question: Wilton carpet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A kind of carpet woven with loops like the Brussels, but differing from it in having the loops cut so as to form an elastic velvet pile; -- so called because made originally at Wilton, England.

qa_pairs.question: Wilwe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Willow.

qa_pairs.question: Wily
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Full of wiles, tricks, or stratagems; using craft or stratagem to accomplish a purpose; mischievously artful; subtle.

qa_pairs.question: Wimble
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An instrument for boring holes, turned by a handle.

qa_pairs.question: Wimble
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To bore or pierce, as with a wimble.

qa_pairs.question: Wimble
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Active; nimble.

qa_pairs.question: Wimbrel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The whimbrel.

qa_pairs.question: Wimple
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A covering of silk, linen, or other material, for the neck and chin, formerly worn by women as an outdoor protection, and still retained in the dress of nuns.

qa_pairs.question: Wimple
qa_pairs.answer: It means To clothe with a wimple; to cover, as with a veil; hence, to hoodwink.

qa_pairs.question: Wimple
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To lie in folds; also, to appear as if laid in folds or plaits; to ripple; to undulate.

qa_pairs.question: Win
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To gain by superiority in competition or contest; to obtain by victory over competitors or rivals; as, to win the prize in a gate; to win money; to win a battle, or to win a country.

qa_pairs.question: Win
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To gain the victory; to be successful; to triumph; to prevail.

qa_pairs.question: Wince
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To shrink, as from a blow, or from pain; to flinch; to start back.

qa_pairs.question: Wince
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of one who winces.

qa_pairs.question: Wince
qa_pairs.answer: It means A reel used in dyeing, steeping, or washing cloth; a winch. It is placed over the division wall between two wince pits so as to allow the cloth to descend into either compartment. at will.

qa_pairs.question: Wincer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who, or that which, winces, shrinks, or kicks.

qa_pairs.question: Wincey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Linsey-woolsey.

qa_pairs.question: Winch
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To wince; to shrink; to kick with impatience or uneasiness.

qa_pairs.question: Winch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kick, as of a beast, from impatience or uneasiness.

qa_pairs.question: Winch
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A crank with a handle, for giving motion to a machine, a grindstone, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Wincing
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of washing cloth, dipping it in dye, etc., with a wince.

qa_pairs.question: Wincopipe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A little red flower, no doubt the pimpernel, which, when it opens in the morning, is supposed to bode a fair day. See Pimpernel.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To turn completely, or with repeated turns; especially, to turn about something fixed; to cause to form convolutions about anything; to coil; to twine; to twist; to wreathe; as, to wind thread on a spool or into a ball.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To turn completely or repeatedly; to become coiled about anything; to assume a convolved or spiral form; as, vines wind round a pole.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of winding or turning; a turn; a bend; a twist; a winding.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Air naturally in motion with any degree of velocity; a current of air.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: It means To expose to the wind; to winnow; to ventilate.

qa_pairs.question: Wind
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To blow; to sound by blowing; esp., to sound with prolonged and mutually involved notes.

qa_pairs.question: Windage
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The difference between the diameter of the bore of a gun and that of the shot fired from it.

qa_pairs.question: Windas
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See 3d Windlass.

qa_pairs.question: Windbore
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The lower, or bottom, pipe in a lift of pumps in a mine.

qa_pairs.question: Windbound
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is prevented from sailing, by a contrary wind. See Weatherbound.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-break
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To break the wind of; to cause to lose breath; to exhaust.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-break
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A clump of trees serving for a protection against the force of wind.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-broken
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the power of breathing impaired by the rupture, dilatation, or running together of air cells of the lungs, so that while the inspiration is by one effort, the expiration is by two; affected with pulmonary emphysema or with heaves; -- said of a horse.

qa_pairs.question: Winder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, winds; hence, a creeping or winding plant.

qa_pairs.question: Winder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To fan; to clean grain with a fan.

qa_pairs.question: Winder
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A blow taking away the breath.

qa_pairs.question: Winder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To wither; to fail.

qa_pairs.question: Windfall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Anything blown down or off by the wind, as fruit from a tree, or the tree itself, or a portion of a forest prostrated by a violent wind, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Windfallen
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Blown down by the wind.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-fertilized
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Anemophilous; fertilized by pollen borne by the wind.

qa_pairs.question: Windflower
qa_pairs.answer: It means The anemone; -- so called because formerly supposed to open only when the wind was blowing. See Anemone.

qa_pairs.question: Windgall
qa_pairs.answer: It means A soft tumor or synovial swelling on the fetlock joint of a horse; -- so called from having formerly been supposed to contain air.

qa_pairs.question: Windhover
qa_pairs.answer: It means The kestrel; -- called also also known as windbibber, also known as windcuffer, also known as windfanner.

qa_pairs.question: Windiness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being windy or tempestuous; as, the windiness of the weather or the season.

qa_pairs.question: Winding
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A call by the boatswain's whistle.

qa_pairs.question: Winding
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Twisting from a direct line or an even surface; circuitous.

qa_pairs.question: Winding
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A turn or turning; a bend; a curve; flexure; meander; as, the windings of a road or stream.

qa_pairs.question: Windingly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a winding manner.

qa_pairs.question: Windjammer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A sailing vessel or one of its crew; -- orig. so called contemptuously by sailors on steam vessels.

qa_pairs.question: Windlace
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Windlass.

qa_pairs.question: Windlass
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A winding and circuitous way; a roundabout course; a shift.

qa_pairs.question: Windlass
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To take a roundabout course; to work warily or by indirect means.

qa_pairs.question: Windlass
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A machine for raising weights, consisting of a horizontal cylinder or roller moving on its axis, and turned by a crank, lever, or similar means, so as to wind up a rope or chain attached to the weight. In vessels the windlass is often used instead of the capstan for raising the anchor. It is usually set upon the forecastle, and is worked by hand or steam.

qa_pairs.question: Windlass
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To raise with, or as with, a windlass; to use a windlass.

qa_pairs.question: Windle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A spindle; a kind of reel; a winch.

qa_pairs.question: Windless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having no wind; calm.

qa_pairs.question: Windlestrae
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A grass used for making ropes or for plaiting, esp. Agrostis Spica-ventis.

qa_pairs.question: Windmill
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A mill operated by the power of the wind, usually by the action of the wind upon oblique vanes or sails which radiate from a horizontal shaft.

qa_pairs.question: Windore
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A window.

qa_pairs.question: Window
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An opening in the wall of a building for the admission of light and air, usually closed by casements or sashes containing some transparent material, as glass, and capable of being opened and shut at pleasure.

qa_pairs.question: Window
qa_pairs.answer: It means To furnish with windows.

qa_pairs.question: Windowed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having windows or openings.

qa_pairs.question: Windowless
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Destitute of a window.

qa_pairs.question: Windowpane
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Pane, (n.), (3) b.

qa_pairs.question: Windowy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having little crossings or openings like the sashes of a window.

qa_pairs.question: Windpipe
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The passage for the breath from the larynx to the lungs; the trachea; the weasand. See Illust. under Lung.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-plant
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A windflower.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-rode
qa_pairs.answer: It means Caused to ride or drive by the wind in opposition to the course of the tide; -- said of a vessel lying at anchor, with wind and tide opposed to each other.

qa_pairs.question: Windrow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A row or line of hay raked together for the purpose of being rolled into cocks or heaps.

qa_pairs.question: Windrow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To arrange in lines or windrows, as hay when newly made.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-shaken
qa_pairs.answer: It means Shaken by the wind;

qa_pairs.question: Wind signal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In general, any signal announcing information concerning winds, and esp. the expected approach of winds whose direction and force are dangerous to shipping, etc. The wind-signal system of the United States Weather Bureau consists of storm, information, hurricane, hot wind, and inland storm signals.

qa_pairs.question: Windsor
qa_pairs.answer: It means A town in Berkshire, England.

qa_pairs.question: Windstorm
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A storm characterized by high wind with little or no rain.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-sucker
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A horse given to wind-sucking

qa_pairs.question: Wind-sucking
qa_pairs.answer: It means A vicious habit of a horse, consisting in the swallowing of air; -- usually associated with crib-biting, or cribbing. See Cribbing, 4.

qa_pairs.question: Windtight
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is So tight as to prevent the passing through of wind.

qa_pairs.question: Wind-up
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Act of winding up, or closing; a concluding act or part; the end.

qa_pairs.question: Windward
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The point or side from which the wind blows; as, to ply to the windward; -- opposed to Antonym: leeward.

qa_pairs.question: Windward
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Situated toward the point from which the wind blows; as, the Windward Islands.

qa_pairs.question: Windward
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Toward the wind; in the direction from which the wind blows.

qa_pairs.question: Windy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Consisting of wind; accompanied or characterized by wind; exposed to wind.

qa_pairs.question: Wine
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The expressed juice of grapes, esp. when fermented; a beverage or liquor prepared from grapes by squeezing out their juice, and (usually) allowing it to ferment.

qa_pairs.question: Wineberry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The red currant.

qa_pairs.question: Winebibber
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who drinks much wine.

qa_pairs.question: Wineglass
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small glass from which to drink wine.

qa_pairs.question: Wineglassful
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as As much as a wineglass will hold; enough to fill a wineglass. It is usually reckoned at two fluid ounces, or four tablespoonfuls.

qa_pairs.question: Wineless
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is destitute of wine; as, wineless life.

qa_pairs.question: Winery
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A place where grapes are converted into wine.

qa_pairs.question: Winesap
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A variety of winter apple of medium size, deep red color, and yellowish flesh of a rich, rather subacid flavor.

qa_pairs.question: Wing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of the two anterior limbs of a bird, pterodactyl, or bat. They correspond to the arms of man, and are usually modified for flight, but in the case of a few species of birds, as the ostrich, auk, etc., the wings are used only as an assistance in running or swimming.

qa_pairs.question: Wing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To furnish with wings; to enable to fly, or to move with celerity.

qa_pairs.question: Winged
qa_pairs.answer: It means Furnished with wings; transported by flying; having winglike expansions.

qa_pairs.question: Winger
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the casks stowed in the wings of a vessel's hold, being smaller than such as are stowed more amidships.

qa_pairs.question: Wingfish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sea robin having large, winglike pectoral fins. See Sea robin, under Robin.

qa_pairs.question: Wing-footed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having wings attached to the feet; as, wing-footed Mercury; hence, swift; moving with rapidity; fleet.

qa_pairs.question: Wing-handed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the anterior limbs or hands adapted for flight, as the bats and pterodactyls.

qa_pairs.question: Wing it
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To perform an act, such as to give a speech, without the usual preparation. To improvise or ad-lib.

qa_pairs.question: Wing-leaved
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having pinnate or pinnately divided leaves.

qa_pairs.question: Wingless
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having no wings; not able to ascend or fly.

qa_pairs.question: Winglet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A little wing; a very small wing.

qa_pairs.question: Wingmanship
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Power or skill in flying.

qa_pairs.question: Wing-shell
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of various species of marine bivalve shells belonging to the genus *Avicula*, in which the hinge border projects like a wing.

qa_pairs.question: Wingy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having wings; rapid.

qa_pairs.question: Wink
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To nod; to sleep; to nap.

qa_pairs.question: Wink
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cause (the eyes) to wink.

qa_pairs.question: Wink
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of closing, or closing and opening, the eyelids quickly; hence, the time necessary for such an act; a moment.

qa_pairs.question: Winker
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who winks.

qa_pairs.question: Winkingly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a winking manner; with the eye almost closed.

qa_pairs.question: Winkle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any periwinkle.

qa_pairs.question: Winkle-hawk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A rectangular rent made in cloth; -- called also also known as winkle-hole.

qa_pairs.question: Winnard 2
qa_pairs.answer: It means The redwing.

qa_pairs.question: Winnebagoes
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A tribe of North American Indians who originally occupied the region about Green Bay, Lake Michigan, but were driven back from the lake and nearly exterminated in 1640 by the IIlinnois.

qa_pairs.question: Winner
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who wins, or gains by success in competition, contest, or gaming.

qa_pairs.question: Winning
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Attracting; adapted to gain favor; charming; as, a winning address.

qa_pairs.question: Winning
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of obtaining something, as in a contest or by competition.

qa_pairs.question: Winningly
qa_pairs.answer: It means In a winning manner.

qa_pairs.question: Winningness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being winning.

qa_pairs.question: Winninish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The land-locked variety of the common salmon.

qa_pairs.question: Winnow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To separate, and drive off, the chaff from by means of wind; to fan; as, to winnow grain.

qa_pairs.question: Winnow
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To separate chaff from grain.

qa_pairs.question: Winnower
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who, or that which, winnows; specifically, a winnowing machine.

qa_pairs.question: Winnowing
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of one who, or that which, winnows.

qa_pairs.question: Winrow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A windrow.

qa_pairs.question: Winsing
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Winsome.

qa_pairs.question: Winsome
qa_pairs.answer: It means Cheerful; merry; gay; light-hearted.

qa_pairs.question: Winsomeness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The characteristic of being winsome; attractiveness of manner.

qa_pairs.question: Winter
qa_pairs.answer: It means The season of the year in which the sun shines most obliquely upon any region; the coldest season of the year.

qa_pairs.question: Winter
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To pass the winter; to hibernate; as, to winter in Florida.

qa_pairs.question: Winter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To keep, feed or manage, during the winter; as, to winter young cattle on straw.

qa_pairs.question: Winter-beaten
qa_pairs.answer: It means Beaten or harassed by the severe weather of winter.

qa_pairs.question: Wintergreen
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A plant which keeps its leaves green through the winter.

qa_pairs.question: Winter-ground
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To coved over in the season of winter, as for protection or shelter; as, to winter-ground the roods of a plant.

qa_pairs.question: Winterkill
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To kill by the cold, or exposure to the inclemency of winter; as, the wheat was winterkilled.

qa_pairs.question: Winterkill
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To die as the result of exposure to the cold of winter; as, the tree winterkills easily.

qa_pairs.question: Winterly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Like winter; wintry; cold; hence, disagreeable, cheerless; as, winterly news.

qa_pairs.question: Winter-proud
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having too rank or forward a growth for winter.

qa_pairs.question: Winter-rig
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To fallow or till in winter.

qa_pairs.question: Winters bark
qa_pairs.answer: It means The aromatic bark of tree (Drimys Winteri syn. Drymis Winteri) of the Magnolia family, which is found in Southern Chile. It was first used as a cure for scurvy by its discoverer, Captain John Winter, vice admiral to sir Francis Drake, in 1577.

qa_pairs.question: Wintertide
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Winter time.

qa_pairs.question: Winterweed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A kind of speedwell (Veronica hederifolia) which spreads chiefly in winter.

qa_pairs.question: Wintery
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wintry.

qa_pairs.question: Wintry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Suitable to winter; resembling winter, or what belongs to winter; brumal; hyemal; cold; stormy; wintery.

qa_pairs.question: Winy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the taste or qualities of wine; vinous; as, grapes of a winy taste.

qa_pairs.question: Winze

qa_pairs.question: Wisdom literature
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The class of ancient Hebrew writings which deal reflectively with general ethical and religious topics, as distinguished from the prophetic and liturgical literature, and from the law. It is comprised chiefly in the books of Job, Proverbs, Ecclesiasticus, Ecclesiastes, and Wisdom of Solomon. The <ldquo/wisdom<rdquo/ (Hokhmah) of these writings consists in detached sage utterances on concrete issues of life, without the effort at philosophical system that appeared in the later Hellenistic reflective writing beginning with Philo Judaeus.

qa_pairs.answer: It means (imp.) of Will. See Would.

qa_pairs.question: Wolf
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of several species of carnivorous mammal belonging to the genus *Canis* (family Canidae) and closely allied to the common dog. The best-known and most destructive species are the European wolf (Canis lupus), the American gray, or timber, wolf (Canis occidentalis), and the prairie wolf, more commonly called coyote. Wolves often hunt in packs, and may thus attack large animals and, rarely, even man.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfberry
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An American shrub (Symphoricarpus occidentalis) which bears soft white berries.

qa_pairs.question: Wolffian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Discovered, or first described, by Caspar Friedrich Wolff (1733-1794), the founder of modern embryology.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfhound
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Originally, a large hound used in hunting wolves; now, any one of certain breeds of large dogs, some of which are nearly identical with the great Danes.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Like a wolf; having the qualities or form of a wolf; as, a wolfish visage; wolfish designs.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfkin
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A little or young wolf.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A young wolf.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfram
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Wolframite.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfram steel
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Tungsten steel.

qa_pairs.question: Wolframate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A salt of wolframic acid; a tungstate.

qa_pairs.question: Wolframic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to wolframium. See Tungstic.

qa_pairs.question: Wolframite
qa_pairs.answer: It means Tungstate of iron and manganese, generally of a brownish or grayish black color, submetallic luster, and high specific gravity. It occurs in cleavable masses, and also crystallized. Called also also known as wolfram.

qa_pairs.question: Wolframium
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The technical name of the element tungsten. See Tungsten.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfsbane
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A poisonous plant (Aconitum Lycoctonum), a kind of monkshood; also, by extension, any plant or species of the genus *Aconitum*. See Aconite.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfs-claw
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of club moss. See Lycopodium.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfs-foot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Club moss. See Lycopodium.

qa_pairs.question: Wolfs-milk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any kind of spurge (*Euphorbia*); -- so called from its acrid milky juice.

qa_pairs.question: Woll
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See 2d Will.

qa_pairs.question: Wollastonite
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A silicate of lime of a white to gray, red, or yellow color, occurring generally in cleavable masses, rarely in tabular crystals; tabular spar.

qa_pairs.question: Wollastons doublet
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A magnifying glass consisting of two plano-convex lenses. It is designed to correct spherical aberration and chromatic dispersion.

qa_pairs.question: Wolle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Wool.

qa_pairs.question: Wolverene
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A carnivorous mammal (Gulo gulo formerly Gulo luscus), of the weasel family Mustelidae, about the size of a large badger; called also also known as glutton and also known as carcajou. It is a native of the northern parts of America, Europe, and Asia.

qa_pairs.question: Wolverine State
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Michigan; -- a nickname.

qa_pairs.question: Wolves
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as (pl.) of Wolf.

qa_pairs.question: Wolvish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wolfish.

qa_pairs.question: Woman
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An adult female person; a grown-up female person, as distinguished from a man or a child; sometimes, any female person.

qa_pairs.question: Woman
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To act the part of a woman in; -- with indefinite it.

qa_pairs.question: Womanhead
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Womanhood.

qa_pairs.question: Womanhood
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being a woman; the distinguishing character or qualities of a woman, or of womankind.

qa_pairs.question: womanise
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as womanize.

qa_pairs.question: Womanish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Suitable to a woman, having the qualities of a woman; effeminate; not becoming a man; -- usually in a reproachful sense. See the Note under Effeminate.

qa_pairs.question: Womanize
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make like a woman; to make effeminate.

qa_pairs.question: womanize
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To seek the company of women with unusual frequency, especially for purposes of sexual intimacy.

qa_pairs.question: womanizer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who womanizes; a philanderer.

qa_pairs.question: Womankind

qa_pairs.question: Womanless

qa_pairs.question: Womanlike

qa_pairs.question: Womanliness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being womanly.

qa_pairs.question: Womanly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Becoming a woman; feminine; as, womanly behavior.

qa_pairs.question: Womanly
qa_pairs.answer: It means In the manner of a woman; with the grace, tenderness, or affection of a woman.

qa_pairs.question: Womans Christian Temperance Union
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An association of women formed in the United States in 1874, for the advancement of temperance by organizing preventive, educational, evangelistic, social, and legal work. It is also known as the also known as Women's Christian Temperance Union and by its acronym also known as WCTU or also known as W.C.T.U.. It was one of the political forces leading to passage of the constitutional amendment, later repealed, which prohibited the sale of alcoholic beverages.

qa_pairs.question: Womb
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The belly; the abdomen.

qa_pairs.question: Womb
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To inclose in a womb, or as in a womb; to breed or hold in secret.

qa_pairs.question: Wombat
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of three species of Australian burrowing marsupials of the genus *Phascolomys*, especially the common species (Phascolomys ursinus). They are nocturnal in their habits, and feed mostly on roots.

qa_pairs.question: Womby
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Capacious.

qa_pairs.question: Women
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is (pl.) of Woman.

qa_pairs.question: Wonder

qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wonderfully.

qa_pairs.question: Wonderstruck
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Struck with wonder, admiration, or surprise.

qa_pairs.question: Wonderwork
qa_pairs.answer: It means A wonderful work or act; a prodigy; a miracle.

qa_pairs.question: Wonder-worker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who performs wonders, or miracles.

qa_pairs.question: Wonder-working
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Doing wonders or surprising things.

qa_pairs.question: Wondrous

qa_pairs.question: Wondrous

qa_pairs.question: Wone
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To dwell; to abide.

qa_pairs.question: Wone
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Dwelling; habitation; abode.

qa_pairs.question: Wong
qa_pairs.answer: It means A field.

qa_pairs.question: Wonger
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Wanger.

qa_pairs.question: Woning
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Dwelling.

qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A colloquial contraction of woll not. Will not. See Will.

qa_pairs.question: Wont
qa_pairs.answer: It means Using or doing customarily; accustomed; habituated; used.

qa_pairs.question: Wont

qa_pairs.question: Wont
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To be accustomed or habituated; to be used.

qa_pairs.question: Wood
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To supply with wood, or get supplies of wood for; as, to wood a steamboat or a locomotive.

qa_pairs.question: Wood
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To take or get a supply of wood.

qa_pairs.question: Woodbind
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Woodbine.

qa_pairs.question: Woodbine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A climbing plant having flowers of great fragrance (Lonicera Periclymenum); the honeysuckle.

qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A process in photographic printing, in which a relief pattern in gelatin, which has been hardened after certain operations, is pressed upon a plate of lead or other soft metal. An intaglio impression in thus produced, from which pictures may be directly printed, but by a slower process than in common printing.

qa_pairs.question: Woodchat
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of Asiatic singing birds belonging to the genera *Ianthia* and *Larvivora*. They are closely allied to the European robin. The males are usually bright blue above, and more or less red or rufous beneath.

qa_pairs.question: Woodchuck
qa_pairs.answer: It means A common large North American marmot (Arctomys monax). It is usually reddish brown, more or less grizzled with gray. It makes extensive burrows, and is often injurious to growing crops. Called also also known as ground hog.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcock
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of several species of long-billed limicoline birds belonging to the genera *Scolopax* and *Philohela*. They are mostly nocturnal in their habits, and are highly esteemed as game birds.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcracker
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The nuthatch.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcraft
qa_pairs.answer: It means Skill and practice in anything pertaining to the woods, especially in shooting, and other sports in the woods.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcut
qa_pairs.answer: It means An engraving on wood; also, a print from it. Same as Wood cut, under Wood.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcutter
qa_pairs.answer: It means A person who cuts wood.

qa_pairs.question: Woodcutting

qa_pairs.question: Wooded

qa_pairs.question: Wooden
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Made or consisting of wood; pertaining to, or resembling, wood; as, a wooden box; a wooden leg; a wooden wedding.

qa_pairs.question: Woodenly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Clumsily; stupidly; blockishly.

qa_pairs.question: Woodenness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Quality of being wooden; clumsiness; stupidity; blockishness.

qa_pairs.question: Wood gum
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Xylan.

qa_pairs.question: Woodhack
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The yaffle.

qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A woodpecker.

qa_pairs.question: Woodhouse

qa_pairs.question: Woodiness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being woody.

qa_pairs.question: Woodknacker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The yaffle.

qa_pairs.question: Wood-layer

qa_pairs.question: Woodpeck
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A woodpecker.

qa_pairs.question: Woodpecker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of numerous species of scansorial birds belonging to *Picus* and many allied genera of the family Picidae.

qa_pairs.question: Woodrock
qa_pairs.answer: It means A compact woodlike variety of asbestus.

qa_pairs.question: Woodruff
qa_pairs.answer: It means A little European herb (Asperula odorata) having a pleasant taste. It is sometimes used for flavoring wine. See Illust. of Whorl.

qa_pairs.question: Wood-sare

qa_pairs.question: Wood-sere

qa_pairs.question: Woodsman

qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of several species of ticks of the genus *Ixodes* whose young cling to bushes, but quickly fasten themselves upon the bodies of any animal with which they come in contact. When they attach themselves to the human body they often produce troublesome sores. The common species of the Northern United States is Ixodes unipunctata.

qa_pairs.question: Woodwall
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The yaffle.

qa_pairs.question: Woodwardia

qa_pairs.question: Wood-wash

qa_pairs.question: Woolgathering

qa_pairs.question: Woolgathering

qa_pairs.question: Woolgrower

qa_pairs.question: Wool-hall

qa_pairs.question: Woolhead
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The buffel duck.

qa_pairs.question: Woolliness

qa_pairs.question: Woolly

qa_pairs.question: Wopen
