qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who is fond of forest or forest scenery; a haunter of the woods.

qa_pairs.question: Nemophily
qa_pairs.answer: It means Fondness for forest scenery; love of the woods.

qa_pairs.question: Nemoral
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to a wood or grove.

qa_pairs.question: Nemorous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Woody.

qa_pairs.question: Nempne
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To name or call.

qa_pairs.question: Nempt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Called; named.

qa_pairs.question: Nems
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The ichneumon.

qa_pairs.question: Nenia
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A funeral song; an elegy.

qa_pairs.question: Nenuphar
qa_pairs.answer: It means The great white water lily of Europe; the Nymphaea alba.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-
qa_pairs.answer: It means A prefix meaning new, recent, late; and in chemistry designating specifically that variety of metameric hydrocarbons which, when the name was applied, had been recently classified, and in which at least one carbon atom is connected directly with four other carbon atoms; -- contrasted with normal and iso-; as, neopentane; the neoparaffins. Also used adjectively.

qa_pairs.question: Neocarida
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The modern, or true, Crustacea, as distinguished from the Merostomata.

qa_pairs.question: Neocene
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is More recent than the Eocene, that is, including both the Miocene and Pliocene divisions of the Tertiary.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Christianity
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Rationalism.

qa_pairs.question: Neoclassic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Belonging to, or designating, the modern revival or adaptation of classical, esp. Greco-Roman, style, taste and manner of work in architecture, arts, literature, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Neoclassic architecture
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is All that architecture which, since the beginning of the Italian Renaissance, about 1420, has been designed with deliberate imitation of Greco-Roman buildings.

qa_pairs.question: neoclassicism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a revival of the classical Greek and Roman style in art or literature.

qa_pairs.question: neoclassicist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as an advocate of neoclassicism.

qa_pairs.question: neocolonialism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Control by a powerful country of its former colonies (or other less developed countries) by economic pressures. In contrast to colonialism, in which one country controls another territory by military force.

qa_pairs.question: Neocomian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A term applied to the lowest deposits of the Cretaceous or chalk formation of Europe, being the lower greensand.

qa_pairs.question: Neocomian
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the lower greensand.

qa_pairs.question: neocortex
qa_pairs.answer: It means The cortical part of the neencephalon; the most recently evolved part of the cerebral cortex of the brain of higher animals, and the site of most of the higher brain functions; called also also known as neopallium.

qa_pairs.question: neocortical
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the neocortex.

qa_pairs.question: Neocosmic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the universe in its present state; specifically, pertaining to the races of men known to history.

qa_pairs.question: Neocracy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Government by new or inexperienced hands; upstart rule; raw or untried officials.

qa_pairs.question: Neocriticism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The form of Neo-Kantianism developed by French idealists, following C. Renouvier. It rejects the noumena of Kant, restricting knowledge to phenomena as constituted by a priori categories.

qa_pairs.question: Neodamode
qa_pairs.answer: It means In ancient Sparta, one of those Helots who were freed by the state in reward for military service.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Darwinism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The theory which holds natural selection, as explained by Darwin, to be the chief factor in the evolution of plants and animals, and denies the inheritance of acquired characters; -- esp. opposed to Neo-Lamarckism. Weismannism is an example of extreme Neo-Darwinism.

qa_pairs.question: Neodymium
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The chemical element of atomic number 60, one of the rare earth elements. Symbol _Nd_. Atomic weight 144.27.

qa_pairs.question: Neogaean
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the New World, or Western Hemisphere.

qa_pairs.question: Neogamist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A person recently married.

qa_pairs.question: Neogen
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An alloy resembling silver, and consisting chiefly of copper, zinc, and nickel, with small proportions of tin, aluminium, and bismuth.

qa_pairs.question: Neogrammarian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of a group of philologists who apply phonetic laws more widely and strictly than was formerly done, and who maintain that these laws admit of no real exceptions.

qa_pairs.question: Neography
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A new method or system of writing.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Greek
qa_pairs.answer: It means A member of a body of French painters (F. les n) of the middle 19th century. The term is rather one applied by outsiders to certain artists of grave and refined style, such as Hamon and Aubert, than a name adopted by the artists themselves.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hebraic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of, pert. to, or designating, modern Hebrew, or Hebrew of later date than the Biblical.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hebraic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The modern Hebrew language.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hegelian
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to Neo-Hegelianism.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hegelian
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An adherent of Neo-Hegelianism.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hegelianism
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The philosophy of a school of British and American idealists who follow Hegel in dialectical or logical method and in the general outcome of their doctrine. The founders and leaders of Neo-Hegelianism include: in England, T. H. Green (1836-1882); in Scotland, J. Caird (1820-98) and E. Caird (1835-1908); in the United States, W. T. Harris (1835-1909) and Josiah Royce (1855- -).

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hellenic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Romaic.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Hellenism
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hellenism as surviving or revival in modern times; the practice or pursuit of ancient Greek ideals in modern life, art, or literature, as in the Renaissance.

qa_pairs.question: Neoimpressionism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A theory or practice which is a further development, on more rigorously scientific lines, of the theory and practice of Impressionism, originated by George Seurat (1859-91), and carried on by Paul Signac (1863- -) and others. Its method is marked by the laying of pure primary colors in minute dots upon a white ground, any given line being produced by a variation in the proportionate quantity of the primary colors employed. This method is also known as also known as Pointillism (stippling).

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Kantian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to Neo-Kantianism.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Kantian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An adherent of Neo-Kantianism.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Kantianism
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The philosophy of modern thinkers who follow Kant in his general theory of knowledge, esp. of a group of German philosophers including F. A. Lange, H. Cohen, Paul Natorp, and others.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Lamarckism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Lamarckism as revived, modified, and expounded by recent biologists, esp. as maintaining that the offspring inherits characters acquired by the parent from change of environment, use or disuse of parts, etc.; -- opposed of Neo-Darwinism (which see, above).

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Latin
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Applied to the Romance languages, as being mostly of Latin origin.

qa_pairs.question: neoliberalism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A political orientation originating in the 1960s, blending liberal political views with an emphasis on economic growth.

qa_pairs.question: Neolithic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to, or designating, an era characterized by late remains in stone; the late stone age. Estimated as beginning around 9000 b. c. in the Middle East, this period is characterized by the beginnings of farming, the domestication of animals, and the manufacture of textiles and pottery.

qa_pairs.question: Neologian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Neologic; neological.

qa_pairs.question: Neologian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A neologist.

qa_pairs.question: Neologianism
qa_pairs.answer: It means Neologism.

qa_pairs.question: Neologic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to neology; employing new words; of the nature of, or containing, new words or new doctrines.

qa_pairs.question: Neologically
qa_pairs.answer: It means In a neological manner.

qa_pairs.question: Neologism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The introduction of new words, or the use of old words in a new sense.

qa_pairs.question: Neologist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who introduces new words or new senses of old words into a language.

qa_pairs.question: Neologistic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to neology; neological.

qa_pairs.question: Neologization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of neologizing.

qa_pairs.question: Neologize
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To introduce or use new words or terms or new uses of old words.

qa_pairs.question: Neology
qa_pairs.answer: It means The introduction of a new word, or of words or significations, into a language; as, the present nomenclature of chemistry is a remarkable instance of neology.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Malthusian
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Designating, or pertaining to, a group of modern economists who hold to the Malthusianism doctrine that permanent betterment of the general standard of living is impossible without decrease of competition by limitation of the number of births.

qa_pairs.question: Neomenia
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The time of the new moon; the beginning of the month in the lunar calendar.

qa_pairs.question: Neomenoidea
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A division of vermiform gastropod mollusks, without a shell, belonging to the Isopleura.

qa_pairs.question: Neomorph
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A structure, part, or organ developed independently, that is, not derived from a similar structure, part, or organ, in a preexisting form.

qa_pairs.question: neonatal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as of or pertaining to a neonate; as, neonatal care; a neonatal unit at a hospital.

qa_pairs.question: neonate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A newborn child, especially one less than one month old.

qa_pairs.question: Neonism
qa_pairs.answer: It means Neologism.

qa_pairs.question: Neonomian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who advocates adheres to new laws; esp. one who holds or believes that the gospel is a new law.

qa_pairs.question: Neonomian
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the Neonomians, or in accordance with their doctrines.

qa_pairs.question: Neonomianism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The doctrines or belief of the neonomians.

qa_pairs.question: Neopaganism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Revived or new paganism.

qa_pairs.question: neopallium
qa_pairs.answer: It means The neocortex.

qa_pairs.question: Neophyte
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A new convert or proselyte; -- a name given by the early Christians, and still given by the Roman Catholics, to such as have recently embraced the Christian faith, and been admitted to baptism, esp. to converts from heathenism or Judaism.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplasia
qa_pairs.answer: It means Growth or development of new material; neoplasty.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplasm
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A new formation or tissue, the product of morbid action.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplastic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to neoplasty, or neoplasia.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplasty
qa_pairs.answer: It means Restoration of a part by granulation, adhesive inflammation, or autoplasty.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplatonic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of, pertaining to, or resembling, Neoplatonism or the Neoplatonists.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplatonician
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Neoplatonist.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplatonism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A pantheistic eclectic school of philosophy, of which Plotinus was the chief (a. d. 205-270), and which sought to reconcile the Platonic and Aristotelian systems with Oriental theosophy. It tended to mysticism and theurgy, and was the last product of Greek philosophy.

qa_pairs.question: Neoplatonist
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who held to Neoplatonism; a member of the Neoplatonic school.

qa_pairs.question: Neorama
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A panorama of the interior of a building, seen from within.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Scholastic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pert. to Neo-Scholasticism.

qa_pairs.question: Neo-Scholasticism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The modern revival of the Scholastic philosophy, esp. of that of Thomas Aquinas, with critical revision to suit the exigencies of the general advance in learning. The Neo-Scholastic movement received a great impetus from Leo XIII.'s interest in it.

qa_pairs.question: Neossine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The substance constituting the edible bird's nest.

qa_pairs.question: Neossology
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The study of young birds.

qa_pairs.question: Neoteric
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Recent in origin; modern; new.

qa_pairs.question: Neoteric
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of modern times; a modern.

qa_pairs.question: Neoterically
qa_pairs.answer: It means Recently; newly.

qa_pairs.question: Neoterism
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An innovation or novelty; a neoteric word or phrase.

qa_pairs.question: Neoterist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who introduces new words or phrases; a neologist.

qa_pairs.question: Neoterize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To innovate; to coin or introduce new words.

qa_pairs.question: Neotropical
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Belonging to, or designating, a region of the earth's surface which comprises most of South America, the Antilles, and tropical North America.

qa_pairs.question: Neozoic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is More recent than the Paleozoic, -- that is, including the Mesozoic and Cenozoic.

qa_pairs.question: Nep
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Catnip.

qa_pairs.question: Nepa
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus of aquatic hemipterous insects. The species feed upon other insects and are noted for their voracity; -- called also also known as scorpion bug and also known as water scorpion.

qa_pairs.question: Nepalese
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to Nepal, a kingdom North of India; as, Nepalese troops massed at the border.

qa_pairs.question: Nepalese
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A native or natives of Nepal, or an inhabitant of Nepal.

qa_pairs.question: Nepali
qa_pairs.answer: It means same as Nepalese.

qa_pairs.question: Nepaulese
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to Nepal (formerly written Nepaul), a kingdom North of India; same as also known as Nepalese.

qa_pairs.question: Nepenthaceae
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A natural family coextensive with the genus *Nepenthes*.

qa_pairs.question: Nepenthe
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A drug used by the ancients to give relief from pain and sorrow; -- by some supposed to have been opium or hasheesh. Hence, anything soothing and comforting.

qa_pairs.question: Nepenthes
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Nepenthe.

qa_pairs.question: Nepeta
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A genus of labiate plants, including the catnip and ground ivy.

qa_pairs.question: Nephalism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Total abstinence from spirituous liquor.

qa_pairs.question: Nephalist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who advocates or practices nephalism.

qa_pairs.question: Nepheline
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mineral occuring at Vesuvius, in glassy hexagonal crystals; also elsewhere, in grayish or greenish masses having a greasy luster, as the variety elaeolite. It is a silicate of aluminia, soda, and potash.

qa_pairs.question: Nephelodometer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for reckoning the distances or velocities of clouds.

qa_pairs.question: Nephelometer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for measuring or registering the amount of cloudiness.

qa_pairs.question: Nephew
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A grandson or grandchild, or remoter lineal descendant.

qa_pairs.question: Nephilim
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Giants.

qa_pairs.question: Nephoscope
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An instrument for observing the clouds and their velocity.

qa_pairs.question: Nephralgia
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Neuralgia of the kidneys; a disease characterized by pain in the region of the kidneys without any structural lesion of the latter.

qa_pairs.question: Nephridial
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to a nephridium.

qa_pairs.question: Nephridium
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A segmental tubule; one of the tubules of the primitive urinogenital organs; a segmental organ. See Illust. under Loeven's larva.

qa_pairs.question: nephrite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A hard compact mineral, of a dark green color, formerly worn as a remedy for diseases of the kidneys, whence its name; kidney stone; a kind of jade. It varies in color from white to dark green. It is the more common and less valuable variety of jade, the other being jadeite. Large deposits are found in Australia. Called also also known as nephritic stone. See also Jade.

qa_pairs.question: Nephritic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the kidneys or urinary organs; renal; as, a nephritic disease.

qa_pairs.question: Nephritic
qa_pairs.answer: It means A medicine adapted to relieve or cure disease of the kidneys.

qa_pairs.question: Nephritis
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An inflammation of the kidneys.

qa_pairs.question: nephrolithic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to kidney stones, or renal calculi.

qa_pairs.question: Nephrology
qa_pairs.answer: It means A treatise on, or the science which treats of, the kidneys, and their structure and functions.

qa_pairs.question: Nephropsidae
qa_pairs.answer: It means A natural family in some classifications coextensive with the Homaridae.

qa_pairs.question: Nephrostome
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The funnel-shaped opening of a nephridium into the body cavity.

qa_pairs.question: Nephrotomy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Extraction of stone from the kidney by cutting.

qa_pairs.question: Nephthys
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The goddess associated with ritual of the dead; sister of Geb and Nut; wife of Set.

qa_pairs.question: nephthytis
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any plant of the genus *Nephthytis*.

qa_pairs.question: Nepidae
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A natural family of water scorpions.

qa_pairs.question: Ne plus ultra
qa_pairs.answer: It means The uttermost point to which one can go or attain; hence, the summit of achievement; the highest point or degree; the acme.

qa_pairs.question: Nepotal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or relating to a nephew.

qa_pairs.question: Nepotic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to nepotism.

qa_pairs.question: Nepotism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Undue attachment to relations; favoritism shown to members of one's family; bestowal of patronage in consideration of relationship, rather than of merit or of legal claim.

qa_pairs.question: Nepotist
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who practices nepotism.

qa_pairs.question: Neptune
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The son of Saturn and Ops, the god of the waters, especially of the sea. He is represented as bearing a trident for a scepter.

qa_pairs.question: Neptunian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the ocean or sea.

qa_pairs.question: Neptunian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who adopts the Neptunian theory.

qa_pairs.question: Neptunicentric
qa_pairs.answer: It means As seen from Neptune, or having Neptune as a center; as, Neptunicentric longitude or force.

qa_pairs.question: Neptunium
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A radioactive metallic element of atomic number 93, produced in nuclear reactors from Plutonium or Uranium. Symbol Np; The atomic weight of the most stable isotope is 237.0482.

qa_pairs.question: Ner
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nearer.

qa_pairs.question: Nere
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Were not.

qa_pairs.question: Nereid
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A sea nymph, one of the daughters of Nereus, who were attendants upon Neptune, and were represented as riding on sea horses, sometimes with the human form entire, and sometimes with the tail of a fish.

qa_pairs.question: Nereidian
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any annelid resembling *Nereis*, or of the family Lycoridae or allied families.

qa_pairs.question: Nereis
qa_pairs.answer: It means A Nereid. See Nereid.

qa_pairs.question: Nereites
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Fossil tracks of annelids.

qa_pairs.question: Nereocystis
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of gigantic seaweeds.

qa_pairs.question: Nerfling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The id.

qa_pairs.question: Nerita
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of marine gastropods, mostly natives of warm climates.

qa_pairs.question: Nerite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any mollusk of the genus *Nerita*.

qa_pairs.question: neritic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Relating to the belt or region of shallow water adjoining the seacost; as, neritic fauna.

qa_pairs.question: neritid
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An operculate seasnail of coastal waters with a short spiral shell.

qa_pairs.question: Neritidae
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A natural family comprising the neritids.

qa_pairs.question: Neritina
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus including numerous species of shells resembling *Nerita* in form. They mostly inhabit brackish water, and are often delicately tinted.

qa_pairs.question: Nerka
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The most important salmon of Alaska (Oncorhinchus nerka), ascending in spring most rivers and lakes from Alaska to Oregon, Washington, and Idaho; -- called also also known as red salmon, also known as redfish, also known as blueback, and also known as sawqui.

qa_pairs.question: Nero
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A Roman emperor notorious for debauchery and barbarous cruelty; hence, any profligate and cruel ruler or merciless tyrant.

qa_pairs.question: Nero-antico
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A beautiful black marble found in fragments among Roman ruins, and usually thought to have come from ancient Laconia.

qa_pairs.question: Neroli
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An essential oil obtained by distillation from the flowers of the orange. It has a strong odor, and is used in perfumery, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Nerre
qa_pairs.answer: It means Nearer.

qa_pairs.question: Nerthus
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The Teutonic goddess of fertility; later identified with Norse Njord.

qa_pairs.question: Nervate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nerved.

qa_pairs.question: Nervation
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The arrangement of nerves and veins, especially those of leaves; neuration.

qa_pairs.question: nerve
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of the whitish and elastic bundles of fibers, with the accompanying tissues, which transmit nervous impulses between nerve centers and various parts of the animal body.

qa_pairs.question: Nerve
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To give strength or vigor to; to supply with force; as, fear nerved his arm.

qa_pairs.question: Nerved
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having nerves of a special character; as, weak-nerved.

qa_pairs.question: nerveless
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Destitute of nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Nervelessness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being nerveless.

qa_pairs.question: nerve-racking
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Extremely irritating to the nerves; stressful; trying; as, nerve-wracking noise.

qa_pairs.question: Nerve-shaken
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Affected by a tremor, or by a nervous disease; weakened; overcome by some violent influence or sensation; shocked.

qa_pairs.question: nerve-wracking
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as nerve-racking.

qa_pairs.question: Nervimotion
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The movement caused in the sensory organs by external agents and transmitted to the muscles by the nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Nervimotor
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any agent capable of causing nervimotion.

qa_pairs.question: nervine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the quality of acting upon or affecting the nerves; quieting nervous excitement.

qa_pairs.question: nervomuscular
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to both nerves and muscles; of the nature of nerves and muscles; as, nervomuscular energy.

qa_pairs.question: nervose
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Nerved.

qa_pairs.question: nervosity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Nervousness.

qa_pairs.question: Nervous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Possessing nerve; sinewy; strong; vigorous.

qa_pairs.question: Nervously
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a nervous manner.

qa_pairs.question: Nervousness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as State or quality of being nervous.

qa_pairs.question: Nervure
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the nerves of leaves.

qa_pairs.question: nervus
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any bundle of nerve fibers running to various organs and tissues of the body.

qa_pairs.question: nervy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Strong; sinewy.

qa_pairs.question: Nescience
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Want of knowledge; ignorance; agnosticism.

qa_pairs.question: Nese
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nose.

qa_pairs.question: Nesh
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Soft; tender; delicate.

qa_pairs.question: Ness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A promontory; a cape; a headland.

qa_pairs.question: -ness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A suffix used to form abstract nouns expressive of quality or state; as, goodness, greatness.

qa_pairs.question: Nesslerize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To treat or test, as a liquid, with a solution of mercuric iodide in potassium iodide and potassium hydroxide, which is called Nessler's solution or Nessler's test, and is used to detect the presence of ammonia.

qa_pairs.question: Nest
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The bed or receptacle prepared by a fowl for holding her eggs and for hatching and rearing her young.

qa_pairs.question: Nest
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To build and occupy a nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nest
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To put into a nest; to form a nest for.

qa_pairs.question: nest egg
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An egg left in the nest to prevent the hen from forsaking it, and to induce her to lay more in the same place.

qa_pairs.question: Nestful
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as As much or many as will fill a nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nestle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make and occupy a nest; to nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nestle
qa_pairs.answer: It means To house, as in a nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nestling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A young bird which has not abandoned the nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nestling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Newly hatched; being yet in the nest.

qa_pairs.question: Nestor
qa_pairs.answer: It means A genus of parrots with gray heads, of New Zealand and Papua, allied to the cockatoos. See Kaka.

qa_pairs.question: Nestorian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An adherent of Nestorius, patriarch of Constantinople in the fifth century, who was condemned as a heretic for maintaining that the divine and the human natures were not merged into one nature in Christ (who was God in man), and, hence, that it was improper to call Mary the mother of God though she might be called the mother of Christ; also, one of the sect established by the followers of Nestorius in Persia, India, and other Oriental countries, and still in existence. Opposed to Antonym: Eutychian.

qa_pairs.question: Nestorian
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or relating to the Nestorians.

qa_pairs.question: Nestorianism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The doctrines of the Nestorian Christians, or of Nestorius.

qa_pairs.question: Net
qa_pairs.answer: It means A fabric of twine, thread, or the like, wrought or woven into meshes, and used for catching fish, birds, butterflies, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Net
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make into a net; to make in the style of network; as, to net silk.

qa_pairs.question: Net
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To form network or netting; to knit.

qa_pairs.question: Net
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Without spot; pure; shining.

qa_pairs.question: Net
qa_pairs.answer: It means To produce or gain as clear profit; as, he netted a thousand dollars by the operation.

qa_pairs.question: Netball
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A team game that resembles basketball; a soccer ball is to be thrown so that it passes through a ring on the top of a post.

qa_pairs.question: Ne Temere
qa_pairs.answer: It means A decree of the Congregation of the Council declaring invalid [so far as the laws of the Roman Catholic Church are concerned] any marriage of a Roman Catholic, or of a person who has ever been a Roman Catholic, if not contracted before a duty qualified priest (or the bishop of the diocese) and at least two witnesses. The decree was issued Aug. 2, 1907, and took effect on Easter Apr. 19, 1908. The decree by its terms does not affect mixed marriages (those between Roman Catholics and persons of another faith) in Germany.

qa_pairs.question: Netfish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An astrophyton.

qa_pairs.question: Nether
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Situated down or below; lying beneath, or in the lower part; having a lower position; belonging to the region below; lower; under; -- opposed to Antonym: upper.

qa_pairs.question: Nethermore
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Lower, nether.

qa_pairs.question: Nethermost
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Lowest; as, the nethermost abyss.

qa_pairs.question: Nethinim
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Servants of the priests and Levites in the menial services about the tabernacle and temple.

qa_pairs.question: Netify
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To render neat; to clean; to put in order.

qa_pairs.question: Netsuke
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In Japanese costume and decorative art, a small object carved in wood, ivory, bone, or horn, or wrought in metal, and pierced with holes for cords by which it is connected, for convenience, with the inro, the smoking pouch (tabako-ire), and similar objects carried in the girdle. It is now much used on purses sold in Europe and America.

qa_pairs.question: nett
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as remaining after all deductions; same as net (a.), 3. Contrasted to Antonym: gross.

qa_pairs.question: netted
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is resembing a net or a web.

qa_pairs.question: Netting
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of making nets or network, or of forming meshes, as for fancywork, fishing nets, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Netting
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Urine.

qa_pairs.question: Nettle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A plant of the genus *Urtica*, covered with minute sharp hairs containing a poison that produces a stinging sensation. Urtica gracilis is common in the Northern, and Urtica chamaedryoides in the Southern, United States. The common European species, Urtica urens and Urtica dioica, are also found in the Eastern united States. Urtica pilulifera is the Roman nettle of England.

qa_pairs.question: Nettle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To fret or sting; to irritate or vex; to cause to experience sensations of displeasure or uneasiness not amounting to violent anger.

qa_pairs.question: Nettlebird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is the European whitethroat.

qa_pairs.question: Nettler
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who nettles.

qa_pairs.question: Nettles
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The halves of yarns in the unlaid end of a rope twisted for pointing or grafting.

qa_pairs.question: nettlesome
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as same as irritating, 1.

qa_pairs.question: Nettling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A process (resembling splicing) by which two ropes are joined end to end so as to form one rope.

qa_pairs.question: Nettling
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Stinging; irritating.

qa_pairs.question: Netty
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Like a net, or network; netted.

qa_pairs.question: Net-veined
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having veins, or nerves, reticulated or netted; as, a net-veined wing or leaf.

qa_pairs.question: Network
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A fabric of threads, cords, or wires crossing each other at certain intervals, and knotted or secured at the crossings, thus leaving spaces or meshes between them.

qa_pairs.question: network
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To take steps to make and cultivate the acquaintance of people who can be helpful to oneself, especially in finding new employment, advancing to a higher position in one's occupation, or exchanging information.

qa_pairs.question: network
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To connect together into a network; as, to network computers; to network the printer with computers.

qa_pairs.question: networking
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Interchanging information or services, among a group; -- of persons or organizations.

qa_pairs.question: networklike
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is having a network of veins or ribs.

qa_pairs.question: Neufch<acir/tel
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of soft sweet-milk cheese; -- so called from Neufch-en-Bray in France.

qa_pairs.question: Neurad
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Toward the neural side; -- opposed to haemad.

qa_pairs.question: Neural
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as relating to the nerves or nervous system; taining to, situated in the region of, or on the side with, the neural, or cerebro-spinal, axis; -- opposed to hemal. As applied to vertebrates, neural is the same as also known as dorsal; as applied to invertebrates it is usually the same as ventral. Cf. Hemal.

qa_pairs.question: Neuralgia
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A disease, the chief symptom of which is a very acute pain, exacerbating or intermitting, which follows the course of a nervous branch, extends to its ramifications, and seems therefore to be seated in the nerve. It seems to be independent of any structural lesion.

qa_pairs.question: Neuralgic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to, or having the character of, neuralgia; as, a neuralgic headache.

qa_pairs.question: Neuralgy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Neuralgia.

qa_pairs.question: Neurapophysial
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to a neurapophysis.

qa_pairs.question: Neurapophysis
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of the two lateral processes or elements which form the neural arch.

qa_pairs.question: Neurasthenia
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A condition of nervous debility supposed to be dependent upon impairment in the functions of the spinal cord.

qa_pairs.question: Neuration
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The arrangement or distribution of nerves, as in the leaves of a plant or the wings of an insect; nervation; venation.

qa_pairs.question: Neuraxis
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Axis cylinder, under Axis.

qa_pairs.question: Neurenteric
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to both the neuron and the enteron; as, the neurenteric canal, which, in embroys of many vertebrates, connects the medullary tube and the primitive intestine. See Illust. of Ectoderm.

qa_pairs.question: neurergic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as same as neuropharmacologic.

qa_pairs.question: Neuridin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A nontoxic base, C5H14N2, found in the putrescent matters of flesh, fish, decaying cheese, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Neurilemma
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The delicate outer sheath of a nerve fiber; the primitive sheath.

qa_pairs.question: Neurility
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The special properties and functions of the nerves; that capacity for transmitting a stimulus which belongs to nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Neurine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A poisonous organic base (a ptomaine) formed in the decomposition of protagon with boiling baryta water, and in the putrefaction of proteid matter. It was for a long time considered identical with choline, a crystalline body originally obtained from bile. Chemically, however, choline is oxyethyl-trimethyl-ammonium hydroxide, while neurine is vinyl-trimethyl-ammonium hydroxide.

qa_pairs.question: Neurism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nerve force. See Vital force, under Vital.

qa_pairs.question: Neuritis
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Inflammation of a nerve.

qa_pairs.question: Neuro-
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A combining denoting a nerve, of the nervous system.

qa_pairs.question: Neuro-central
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Between the neural arch and the centrum of a vertebra; as, the neurocentral suture.

qa_pairs.question: Neurochord
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Neurocord.

qa_pairs.question: Neurocity
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nerve force.

qa_pairs.question: Neurocoele
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The central canal and ventricles of the spinal cord and brain; the myelencephalic cavity.

qa_pairs.question: Neurocord
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A cordlike organ composed of elastic fibers situated above the ventral nervous cord of annelids, like the earthworm.

qa_pairs.question: Neuro-epidermal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Pertaining to, or giving rise to, the central nervous system and epidermis; as, the neuroepidermal, or epiblastic, layer of the blastoderm.

qa_pairs.question: Neuroglia
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The delicate connective tissue framework which supports the nervous matter and blood vessels of the brain and spinal cord; called also also known as Kastrocytes, ependymal cells, oligodendroglia cells, and microglia cells.

qa_pairs.question: Neurography
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A description of the nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Neurokeratin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A substance, resembling keratin, present in nerve tissue, as in the sheath of the axis cylinder of medullated nerve fibers. Like keratin it resists the action of most chemical agents, and by decomposition with sulphuric acid yields leucin and tyrosin.

qa_pairs.question: Neurologic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to neurology.

qa_pairs.question: Neurologist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who is versed in neurology; also, one skilled in the treatment of nervous diseases.

qa_pairs.question: Neurology
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The branch of science which treats of the nervous system.

qa_pairs.question: Neuroma
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A tumor developed on, or connected with, a nerve, esp. one consisting of new-formed nerve fibers.

qa_pairs.question: Neuromere
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A metameric segment of the cerebro-spinal nervous system.

qa_pairs.question: Neuromuscular
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nervomuscular.

qa_pairs.question: Neuron
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The brain and spinal cord; the cerebro-spinal axis; myelencephalon.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropathic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to neuropathy; of the nature of, or suffering from, nervous disease.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropathy
qa_pairs.answer: It means An affection of the nervous system or of a nerve.

qa_pairs.question: neuropharmacologic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as acting upon or influencing nervous functions; -- of chemical substances.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropod
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A neuropodous animal.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropodium
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The ventral lobe or branch of a parapodium.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropodous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having the limbs on, or directed toward, the neural side, as in most invertebrates; -- opposed to Antonym: haemapodous.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropore
qa_pairs.answer: It means An opening at either end of the embryonic neural canal.

qa_pairs.question: neuropsychology
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is the branch of psychology that is concerned with the physiological bases of psychological processes.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of the Neuroptera.

qa_pairs.question: Neuroptera
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An order of hexapod insects having two pairs of large, membranous, net-veined wings. The mouth organs are adapted for chewing. They feed upon other insects, and undergo a complete metamorphosis. The ant-lion, hellgamite, and lacewing fly are examples. Formerly, the name was given to a much more extensive group, including the true Neuroptera and the Pseudoneuroptera.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropteral
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the Neuroptera.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropteran
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A neuropter.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropteris
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An extensive genus of fossil ferns, of which species have been found from the Devonian to the Triassic formation.

qa_pairs.question: Neuropterous
qa_pairs.answer: It means Neuropteral.

qa_pairs.question: Neurosensiferous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Pertaining to, or forming, both nerves and sense organs.

qa_pairs.question: Neurosis
qa_pairs.answer: It means A functional nervous affection or disease, that is, a disease of the nerves without any appreciable change of nerve structure.

qa_pairs.question: Neuroskeletal
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the neuroskeleton.

qa_pairs.question: Neuroskeleton
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The deep-seated parts of the vertebrate skeleton which are in relation with the nervous axis and locomotion.

qa_pairs.question: Neurospast
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A puppet.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the nerves; seated in the nerves; nervous; as, a neurotic disease.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotic
qa_pairs.answer: It means A disease seated in the nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotome
qa_pairs.answer: It means An instrument for cutting or dissecting nerves.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotomical
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to neurotomy.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotomist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who skilled in or practices neurotomy.

qa_pairs.question: Neurotomy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The dissection, or anatomy, of the nervous system.

qa_pairs.question: neurotropism
qa_pairs.answer: It means An affinity for neural tissues.

qa_pairs.question: Neurula
qa_pairs.answer: It means An embryo of certain invertebrates in the stage when the primitive band is first developed.

qa_pairs.question: Neuter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Neither the one thing nor the other; on neither side; impartial; neutral.

qa_pairs.question: Neuter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A person who takes no part in a contest; one who is either indifferent to a cause or forbears to interfere; a neutral.

qa_pairs.question: neuter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To render incapable of sexual reproduction; to remove or alter the sexual organs so as to make infertile; to alter; to fix; to desex; -- in male animals, to castrate; in female animals, to spay.

qa_pairs.question: neutered
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Deprived of sexual capacity or sexual attributes.

qa_pairs.question: neutering
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The sterilization of an animal.

qa_pairs.question: Neutral
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Not engaged on either side; not taking part with or assisting either of two or more contending parties; neuter; indifferent.

qa_pairs.question: Neutral
qa_pairs.answer: It means A person or a nation that takes no part in a contest between others; one who is neutral.

qa_pairs.question: neutralisation
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as neutralization.

qa_pairs.question: neutralism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a policy of neutrality or nonalignment in international affairs.

qa_pairs.question: Neutralist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A neutral; one who professes or practices neutrality.

qa_pairs.question: Neutrality
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The state or quality of being neutral; the condition of being unengaged in contests between others; state of taking no part on either side; indifference.

qa_pairs.question: Neutralization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of neutralizing, or the state of being neutralized.

qa_pairs.question: Neutralize
qa_pairs.answer: It means To render neutral; to reduce to a state of neutrality.

qa_pairs.question: Neutralizer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, neutralizes; that which destroys, disguises, or renders inert the peculiar properties of a body.

qa_pairs.question: Neutrally
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a neutral manner; without taking part with either side; indifferently.

qa_pairs.question: Neutrophil
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of a group of leukocytes whose granules stain only with neutral dyes; it is the chief phagocytic leukocyte in the circulating blood, comprising from 54% to 65% of the total number of leukocytes.

qa_pairs.question: neutrosophy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A branch of philosophy, introduced by Florentin Smarandache in 1980, which studies the origin, nature, and scope of neutralities, as well as their interactions with different ideational spectra. Neutrosophy considers a proposition, theory, event, concept, or entity, <ldquo/A<rdquo/ in relation to its opposite, <ldquo/Anti-A<rdquo/ and that which is not A, <ldquo/Non-A<rdquo/, and that which is neither <ldquo/A<rdquo/ nor <ldquo/Anti-A<rdquo/, denoted by <ldquo/Neut-A<rdquo/. Neutrosophy is the basis of neutrosophic logic, neutrosophic probability, neutrosophic set, and neutrosophic statistics.

qa_pairs.question: Neuvaines
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Prayers offered up for nine successive days.

qa_pairs.question: Nevadan
qa_pairs.answer: It means A resident of Nevada.

qa_pairs.question: Nevadite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A granitoid variety of rhyolite, common in Nevada.

qa_pairs.question: N<eacute/v<eacute/
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The upper part of a glacier, above the limit of perpetual snow. See Glacier.

qa_pairs.question: Neven
qa_pairs.answer: It means To name; to mention; to utter.

qa_pairs.question: Never
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Not ever; not at any time; at no time, whether past, present, or future.

qa_pairs.question: never-ending
qa_pairs.answer: It means endless or seemingly endless; as, the never-ending search for happiness.

qa_pairs.question: Nevermore
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Never again; at no time hereafter.

qa_pairs.question: never-say-die
qa_pairs.answer: It means Incapable of being subdued.

qa_pairs.question: Neverthelater
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nevertheless.

qa_pairs.question: Nevertheless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Not the less; notwithstanding; in spite of that; yet.

qa_pairs.question: Nevew
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Nephew.

qa_pairs.question: New
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Having existed, or having been made, but a short time; having originated or occured lately; having recently come into existence, or into one's possession; not early or long in being; of late origin; recent; fresh; modern; -- opposed to Antonym: old, as, a new coat; a new house; a new book; a new fashion.

qa_pairs.question: New
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Newly; recently.

qa_pairs.question: New
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make new; to renew.

qa_pairs.question: Newari
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A language spoken in the Kathmandu Valley of Nepal.

qa_pairs.question: newborn
qa_pairs.answer: It means Recently born.

qa_pairs.question: newborn
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A baby recently born, usually less than one month old; a neonate.

qa_pairs.question: Newcastle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A town in England.

qa_pairs.question: Newcome
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Recently come.

qa_pairs.question: Newcomer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who has lately come.

qa_pairs.question: Newel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A novelty; a new thing.

qa_pairs.question: Newel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The upright post about which the steps of a circular staircase wind; hence, in stairs having straight flights, the principal post at the foot of a staircase, or the secondary ones at the landings. Also called newel post. See Hollow newel, under Hollow.

qa_pairs.question: newest
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Most recent.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Eager for novelties; desirous of changing.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To change by introducing novelties.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangled
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Newly made; of a new type or fashion; formed with the affectation of novelty; -- sometimes used to express disapproval or disdain.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangledness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Affectation of, or fondness for, novelty; vain or affected fashion or form.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangleness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Newfangledness.

qa_pairs.question: Newfanglist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who is eager for novelties or desirous of change.

qa_pairs.question: Newfangly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a newfangled manner; with eagerness for novelty.

qa_pairs.question: Newfashioned
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Made in a new form, or lately come into fashion.

qa_pairs.question: Newfoundland
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An island on the coast of British North America, famed for the fishing grounds in its vicinity.

qa_pairs.question: Newing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Yeast; barm.

qa_pairs.question: Newish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Somewhat new; nearly new.

qa_pairs.question: Newly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Lately; recently.

qa_pairs.question: new-made
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Fresh. Opposite of Antonym: stale.

qa_pairs.question: Newmarket
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A long, closely fitting cloak.

qa_pairs.question: New-model
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To remodel.

qa_pairs.question: Newness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being new; as, the newness of a system; the newness of a scene; newness of life.

qa_pairs.question: News
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A report of recent occurrences; information of something that has lately taken place, or of something before unknown; fresh tidings; recent intelligence.

qa_pairs.question: news-book
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A newspaper.

qa_pairs.question: newsboy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A boy who distributes or sells newspapers.

qa_pairs.question: newscaster
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Someone who broadcasts the news.

qa_pairs.question: newsless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as not having or receiving news or information.

qa_pairs.question: newsletter
qa_pairs.answer: It means A circular letter, written or printed for the purpose of disseminating news. This was the name given to the earliest English newspapers.

qa_pairs.question: Newsman
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who brings news.

qa_pairs.question: Newsmonger
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who deals in news; one who is active in hearing and telling news.

qa_pairs.question: Newspaper
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sheet of paper printed and distributed, at stated intervals, for conveying intelligence of passing events, advocating opinions, etc.; a public print that circulates news, advertisements, proceedings of legislative bodies, public announcements, etc.

qa_pairs.question: newsprint
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Cheap paper made from wood pulp and used for printing newspapers.

qa_pairs.question: new-sprung
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as having just or recently arisen or come into existence.

qa_pairs.question: newsroom
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A room where news is collected and disseminated, located in the offices of a newspaper, magazine, or news broadcast organization; as, the CBS newsroom.

qa_pairs.question: News-vender
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A seller of newspapers.

qa_pairs.question: newsworthy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Sufficiently interesting to be reported in a newspaper; as, a dog biting a man is not a newsworthy item.

qa_pairs.question: News-writer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who gathers news for, and writes, news-letters, articles in news periodicals, or items for broadcast on news programs.

qa_pairs.question: Newsy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Full of news; abounding in information as to current events.

qa_pairs.question: Newt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of several species of small aquatic salamanders. The common British species are the crested newt (Triton cristatus) and the smooth newt (Lophinus punctatus). In America, Diemictylus viridescens is one of the most abundant species.

qa_pairs.question: New Thought
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any form of belief in mental healing, other than (1) Christian Science and (2) hypnotism or psychotherapy. It was practised in the 19th century, and its central principle was affirmative thought, or suggestion, employed with the conviction that man produces changes in his health, his finances, and his life by the adoption of a favorable mental attitude. As a therapeutic doctrine it stands for silent and absent mental treatment, and the theory that all diseases are mental in origin. As a cult it has its unifying idea the inculcation of workable optimism in contrast with the <ldquo/old thought<rdquo/ of sin, evil, predestination, and pessimistic resignation. The term is essentially synonymous with the term also known as High Thought, used in England.

qa_pairs.question: newton
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A unit of force of the Systeme Internationale system of units of measure, equal to the force that produces an acceleration of one meter per second per second when applied to a mass of one kilogram. Abbreviated also known as N.

qa_pairs.question: Newton
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to Sir Isaac Newton, or his discoveries.

qa_pairs.question: Newtonian
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A follower of Newton.

qa_pairs.question: New-year
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to, or suitable for, the commencement of the year; as, New-year gifts or odes.

qa_pairs.question: New Years Day
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is the first day of a calendar year; the first day of January. Often colloquially abbreviated to also known as New year's or also known as new year.

qa_pairs.question: New Zealand
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A group of islands in the South Pacific Ocean.

qa_pairs.question: Nexible
qa_pairs.answer: It means That may be knit together.

qa_pairs.question: Next
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nearest in place; having no similar object intervening.

qa_pairs.question: Next
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In the time, place, or order nearest or immediately succeeding; as, this man follows next.

qa_pairs.question: Nexus
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Connection; tie.

qa_pairs.question: next-to-last
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as next preceding the last; as, the figures in the next-to-last column.

qa_pairs.question: Nez Perc<eacute/s
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A tribe of Indians, in the late 1800's mostly inhabiting Idaho. They were involved under Chief Joseph, in the last major battle of the Indian wars, attempting to resist being moved to a reservation.

qa_pairs.question: Ngina
qa_pairs.answer: It means The gorilla.

qa_pairs.question: niacin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A B vitamin (vitamin B5) essential for the normal function of the nervous system and the gastrointestinal tract. Called also also known as nicotinic acid and also known as antipellagra vitamin. Chemical formula C6H5NO2, chemically it is 3-pyridinecarboxylic acid.

qa_pairs.question: niacinamide
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The amide of niacin (nicotinic acid), called also also known as nicotinamide. It was at one time called also known as vitamin B3, and can function to relieve nicotinic acid deficiency. Chemical formula C6H6N2O, chemically it is 3-pyridinecarboxamide.

qa_pairs.question: niagara
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large flow, used figuratively.

qa_pairs.question: Niagara
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A large waterfall on the Niagara River near Buffalo remarkable for the volume and constancy of the water flowing over it. That part of the waterfall in Canada is the Horseshoe Falls; the U. S. portion is called the American Falls.

qa_pairs.question: Niagara
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A river flowing from Lake Erie into Lake Ontario, which forms the boundary between Ontario and New York.

qa_pairs.question: Niagara period
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A subdivision or the American Upper Silurian system, embracing the Medina, Clinton, and Niagara epoch. The rocks of the Niagara epoch, mostly limestones, are extensively distributed, and at Niagara Falls consist of about eighty feet of shale supporting a greater thickness of limestone, which is gradually undermined by the removal of the shale. See Chart of Geology.

qa_pairs.question: Niamey
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The capital city of Niger.

qa_pairs.question: Nias
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A young hawk; an eyas; hence, an unsophisticated person.

qa_pairs.question: Nib
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A small and pointed thing or part; a point; a prong.

qa_pairs.question: Nib

qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An alkaloid which is the active principle of tobacco (C10H14N2). It occurs in tobacco plants (Nicotiana tabacum and Nicotiana rusticum) to the extent of 2 to 8%, in combination with malic acid or citric acid. It is a colorless, transparent, oily liquid, having an acrid odor, and an acrid burning taste. It is intensely poisonous. The apparently addictive effects of tobacco smoking have been ascribed largely to the effect of nicotine, and the controlled administration of nicotine on various forms has been used as a technique for assisting efforts to stop the smoking habit.

qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Shining sparks thrown off from melted brass.

qa_pairs.question: Nilometer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for measuring the rise of water in the Nile during its periodical flood.

qa_pairs.question: Niloscope
qa_pairs.answer: It means A Nilometer.

qa_pairs.question: Nilotic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the river Nile; as, the Nilotic crocodile.

qa_pairs.question: Nilt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Wilt not.

qa_pairs.question: Nim
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To take; to steal; to filch.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbiferous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Serving to bring clouds or stormy weather.

qa_pairs.question: Nimble
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Light and quick in motion; moving with ease and celerity; lively; swift.

qa_pairs.question: nimble-fingered
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as same as light-fingered; thievish; pilfering.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbleness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality of being nimble; lightness and quickness in motion; agility; swiftness.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Nimbleness.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a nimble manner; with agility; with light, quick motion.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbose
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Cloudy; stormy; tempestuous.

qa_pairs.question: Nimbus
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A circle, or disk, or any indication of radiant light around the heads of divinities, saints, and sovereigns, upon medals, pictures, etc.; a halo. See Aureola, and Glory, (n.), 5.

qa_pairs.question: Nimiety
qa_pairs.answer: It means State of being in excess.

qa_pairs.question: Nimious
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Excessive; extravagant; inordinate.

qa_pairs.question: Nimmer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A thief.

qa_pairs.question: nin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Not in.

qa_pairs.question: Nina
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A goddess of the watery deep and daughter of Ea.

qa_pairs.question: nincompoop
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A fool; a silly or stupid person.

qa_pairs.question: nine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Eight and one more; one less than ten; as, nine miles.

qa_pairs.question: Nine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The number greater than eight by a unit; nine units or objects.

qa_pairs.question: Nine-bark
qa_pairs.answer: It means A white-flowered rosaceous shrub (Neillia opulifolia, or Spiraea opulifolia), common in the Northern United States. The bark separates into many thin layers, whence the name.

qa_pairs.question: Nine-eyes
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The lamprey.

qa_pairs.question: Ninefold
qa_pairs.answer: It means Nine times repeated.

qa_pairs.question: Nineholes
qa_pairs.answer: It means A game in which nine holes are made in the ground, into which a ball is bowled.

qa_pairs.question: Nine-killer
qa_pairs.answer: It means The northern butcher bird.

qa_pairs.question: Ninepence
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An old English silver coin, worth nine pence.

qa_pairs.question: ninepenny
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is 2-3/4 in or 7 cm long; -- used of nail size; as, a ninepenny nail.

qa_pairs.question: ninepin
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a bowling pin of the type used in ninepins (or (in England) skittles).

qa_pairs.question: Ninepins
qa_pairs.answer: It means A game played with nine pins, or pieces of wood, set on end, at which a wooden ball is bowled to knock them down; bowling.

qa_pairs.question: Ninescore
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nine times twenty, or one hundred and eighty.

qa_pairs.question: Nineteen
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nine and ten; eighteen and one more; one less than twenty; as, nineteen months.

qa_pairs.question: Nineteen
qa_pairs.answer: It means The number greater than eighteen by a unit; the sum of ten and nine; nineteen units or objects.

qa_pairs.question: Nineteenth
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Following the eighteenth and preceding the twentieth; coming after eighteen others.

qa_pairs.question: Nineteenth
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quotient of a unit divided by nineteen; one of nineteen equal parts of anything.

qa_pairs.question: nineties
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The decade from 1890 to 1899; as, the gay nineties.

qa_pairs.question: Ninetieth
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Next in order after the eighty-ninth.

qa_pairs.question: Ninetieth
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quotient of a unit divided by ninety; one of ninety equal parts of anything.

qa_pairs.question: Ninety
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Nine times ten; eighty-nine and one more; as, ninety men.

qa_pairs.question: Ninety
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The sum of nine times ten; the number greater by a unit than eighty-nine; ninety units or objects.

qa_pairs.question: Nineveh
qa_pairs.answer: It means An ancient Assyrian city.

qa_pairs.question: Ningal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An Akkadian goddess, wife of the moon god Sin.

qa_pairs.question: Ningirsu
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The Babylonian god of war and agriculture, in an older pantheon.

qa_pairs.question: Ningishzida
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A Babylonian underworld deity, the patron of medicine.

qa_pairs.question: Ninhursag
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The great mother goddess in Sumerian mythology, worshipped also as also known as Aruru and also known as Mama and also known as Nintu.

qa_pairs.question: Ninib
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A solar deity, first-born of Bel and consort was Gula; god of war and the chase and agriculture; sometimes identifed with Biblical Nimrod.

qa_pairs.question: Ninigi
qa_pairs.answer: It means The grandson of Amaterasu and first ruler of Japan.

qa_pairs.question: Ninkharsag
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Ninhursag.

qa_pairs.question: Ninny
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A fool; a simpleton.

qa_pairs.question: Ninnyhammer
qa_pairs.answer: It means A simpleton; a silly person.

qa_pairs.question: ninon
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A sturdy cloth material of chiffon or voile, used for the manufacture of dresses and other women's garments, and for curtains, and drapery. The material may be constructed by either a plain or a novelty weaving technique.

qa_pairs.question: Ninth
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Following the eight and preceding the tenth; coming after eight others.

qa_pairs.question: Ninth
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quotient of one divided by nine; one of nine equal parts of a thing; the next after the eighth.

qa_pairs.question: Ninthly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In the ninth place.

qa_pairs.question: Ninut
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The magpie.

qa_pairs.question: Niobate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Columbate.

qa_pairs.question: Niobe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The daughter of Tantalus, and wife of Amphion, king of Thebes. Her pride in her children provoked Apollo and Diana, who slew them all. Niobe herself was changed by the gods into stone.

qa_pairs.question: niobic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Columbic.

qa_pairs.question: niobite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Columbite.

qa_pairs.question: niobium
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The chemical element of atomic number 41. Chemical symbol Nb. Atomic weight 92.91. Previously called also known as columbium. See also Columbium.

qa_pairs.question: Niopo
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A kind of snuff prepared by the natives of Venezuela from the roasted seeds of a leguminous tree (Piptadenia peregrina), thence called also known as niopo tree.

qa_pairs.question: Nip
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sip or small draught; esp., a draught of intoxicating liquor; a dram.

qa_pairs.question: Nip
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To catch and inclose or compress tightly between two surfaces, or points which are brought together or closed; to pinch; to close in upon.

qa_pairs.question: Nip
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A seizing or closing in upon; a pinching; as, in the northern seas, the nip of masses of ice.

qa_pairs.question: Nipa
qa_pairs.answer: It means A monotypic genus of palms of Australasia.

qa_pairs.question: Nipper
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who, or that which, nips.

qa_pairs.question: Nipperkin
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small cup.

qa_pairs.question: Nippers
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Small pinchers for holding, breaking, or cutting.

qa_pairs.question: Nipping
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Biting; pinching; painful; destructive; as, a nipping frost; a nipping wind.

qa_pairs.question: Nippingly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a nipping manner.

qa_pairs.question: Nippitate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Peculiarly strong and good; -- said of ale or liquor.

qa_pairs.question: Nippitato
qa_pairs.answer: It means Strong liquor.

qa_pairs.question: Nipple
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The protuberance through which milk is drawn from the breast or mamma; the mammilla; a teat; a pap.

qa_pairs.question: Nipplewort
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A yellow-flowered composite herb (Lampsana communis), formerly used as an external application to the nipples of women; -- called also also known as dock-cress.

qa_pairs.question: Nipponese
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a native or inhabitant of Japan.

qa_pairs.question: Nipponese
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language; Japanese.

qa_pairs.question: nippy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Pleasantly cold and invigorating; -- of weather conditions.

qa_pairs.question: Ni-resist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Cast iron consisting of graphite in a matrix of austenite.

qa_pairs.question: Nirvana
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In the Buddhist system of religion, the final emancipation of the soul from transmigration, and consequently a beatific enfrachisement from the evils of worldly existence, as by annihilation or absorption into the divine. See Buddhism.

qa_pairs.question: Nis
qa_pairs.answer: It means Is not.

qa_pairs.question: Nisan
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The first month of the Jewish ecclesiastical year, formerly answering nearly to the month of April, now to March, of the Christian calendar. See Abib.

qa_pairs.question: Nisey
qa_pairs.answer: It means A simpleton.

qa_pairs.question: Nisi
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Unless; if not; -- used mostly in law.

qa_pairs.question: Niste
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wist not; knew not.

qa_pairs.question: Nisus
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A striving; an effort; a conatus.

qa_pairs.question: Nit
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The egg of a louse or other small insect.

qa_pairs.question: Nitency
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Brightness; luster.

qa_pairs.question: Nitency
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Endeavor; effort; tendency.

qa_pairs.question: Niter
qa_pairs.answer: It means A white crystalline semitransparent salt; potassium nitrate; saltpeter. See Saltpeter.

qa_pairs.question: Nithing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Niding.

qa_pairs.question: Nitid
qa_pairs.answer: It means Bright; lustrous; shining.

qa_pairs.question: Nitranilic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of, pertaining to, or designating, a complex organic acid produced as a white crystalline substance by the action of nitrous acid on hydroquinone.

qa_pairs.question: Nitraniline
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any one of a series of nitro derivatives of aniline; nitroaniline. In general they are yellow crystalline substances.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A salt of nitric acid.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrated
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Combined, or impregnated, with nitric acid, or some of its compounds.

qa_pairs.question: Nitratine
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mineral occurring in transparent crystals, usually of a white, sometimes of a reddish gray, or lemon-yellow, color; native sodium nitrate. It is used in making nitric acid and for manure. Called also also known as soda niter.

qa_pairs.question: Nitre
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Niter.

qa_pairs.question: Nitriary
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An artificial bed of animal matter for the manufacture of niter by nitrification. See Nitrification, 2.

qa_pairs.question: Nitric
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of, pertaining to, or containing, nitrogen; specifically, designating any one of those compounds in which, as contrasted with nitrous compounds, the element has a higher valence; as, nitric oxide; nitric acid.

qa_pairs.question: Nitride
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A binary compound of nitrogen with a more metallic element or radical; as, boric nitride.

qa_pairs.question: Nitriferous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Bearing niter; yielding, or containing, niter.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrification
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act, process, or result of combining with nitrogen or some of its compounds.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrifier
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An agent employed in nitrification.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrify
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To combine or impregnate with nitrogen; to convert, by oxidation, into nitrous or nitric acid; to subject to, or produce by, nitrification.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrile
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of a series of compounds bearing the cyanide radical (-CN); particularly, one of those cyanides of alcohol radicals which, by boiling with acids or alkalies, produce a carboxyl acid, with the elimination of the nitrogen as ammonia.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A salt or ester of nitrous acid; a compound bearing the -NO2 radical.

qa_pairs.question: nitro
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Nitroglycerin.

qa_pairs.question: nitro-
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A combining form or an adjective denoting the presence of niter.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrobacter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus of rod-shaped soil bacteria.

qa_pairs.question: nitrobacteria
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Soil bacteria that convert nitrites to nitrates.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrobacteriaceae
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A natural family of usually rod-shaped bacteria that oxidize ammonia or nitrites: nitrobacteria.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrobenzene
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A yellow aromatic liquid (C6H5.NO2), produced by the action of nitric acid on benzene, and called from its odor also known as imitation oil of bitter almonds, or also known as essence of mirbane. It is used in perfumery, and is manufactured in large quantities in the preparation of aniline. Fornerly called also also known as nitrobenzol.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrobenzol
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Nitrobenzene.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrocalcite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nitrate of calcium, a substance having a grayish white color, occuring in efflorescences on old walls, and in limestone caves, especially where there exists decaying animal matter.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrocarbol
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Nitromethane.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrocellulose
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Gun cotton, under Gun.

qa_pairs.question: Nitro-chloroform
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Chlorpicrin.

qa_pairs.question: Nitroform
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A nitro derivative of methane, analogous to chloroform, obtained as a colorless oily or crystalline substance, CH.(NO2)3, quite explosive, and having well-defined acid properties.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrogelatin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An explosive consisting of gun cotton and camphor dissolved in nitroglycerin.

qa_pairs.question: Nitrogen
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A colorless nonmetallic element of atomic number 7, tasteless and odorless, comprising four fifths of the atmosphere by volume in the form of molecular nitrogen (N2).
