qa_pairs.answer: It means not woody; not consisting of or resembling wood; as, nonwoody plants. Opposite of Antonym: woody.

qa_pairs.question: nonworker
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A person who does not work as s/he should.

qa_pairs.question: Nonyl
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The hydrocarbon radical, C9H19-, derived from nonane and forming many compounds. Used also adjectively; as, nonyl alcohol.

qa_pairs.question: Nonylene
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of a series of metameric, unsaturated hydrocarbons C9H18 of the ethylene series.

qa_pairs.question: Nonylenic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of, pertaining to, related to, or designating, nonylene or its compounds; as, nonylenic acid.

qa_pairs.question: Nonylic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of, pertaining to, or designating, nonyl or its compounds; as, nonylic acid.

qa_pairs.question: Noodle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A simpleton; a blockhead; a stupid person; a ninny.

qa_pairs.question: Noodle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A thin strip of dough, made with eggs, rolled up, cut into small pieces, and used in soup.

qa_pairs.question: Nook
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A narrow place formed by an angle in bodies or between bodies; a corner; a recess; a secluded retreat.

qa_pairs.question: Nook-shotten
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Full of nooks, angles, or corners.

qa_pairs.question: Noological
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to noology.

qa_pairs.question: Noologist
qa_pairs.answer: It means One versed in no0logy.

qa_pairs.question: Noology
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The science of intellectual phenomena.

qa_pairs.question: Noon
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as No. See the Note under No.

qa_pairs.question: Noon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The middle of the day; midday; the time when the sun is in the meridian; twelve o'clock in the daytime.

qa_pairs.question: Noon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Belonging to midday; occurring at midday; meridional.

qa_pairs.question: Noon
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To take rest and refreshment at noon.

qa_pairs.question: Noonday
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Midday; twelve o'clock in the day; noon.

qa_pairs.question: Noonday
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to midday; meridional; as, the noonday heat; only mad dogs and Englishmen go out in the noonday sun.

qa_pairs.question: Noon-flower
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The goat's beard, whose flowers close at midday.

qa_pairs.question: Nooning
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A rest at noon; a repast at noon.

qa_pairs.question: Noonshun
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Nunchion.

qa_pairs.question: Noonstead
qa_pairs.answer: It means The position of the sun at noon.

qa_pairs.question: Noontide
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The time of noon; midday.

qa_pairs.question: Noose
qa_pairs.answer: It means A running knot, or loop, which binds the closer the more it is drawn.

qa_pairs.question: Noose
qa_pairs.answer: It means To tie in a noose; to catch in a noose; to entrap; to insnare.

qa_pairs.question: Noot
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See 1st Not.

qa_pairs.question: Nopal
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A cactaceous plant (Nopalea cochinellifera), originally Mexican, on which the cochineal insect feeds, and from which it is collected. The name is sometimes given to other species of *Cactaceae*.

qa_pairs.question: Nopalry
qa_pairs.answer: It means A plantation of the nopal for raising the cochineal insect.

qa_pairs.question: nope
qa_pairs.answer: It means A bullfinch.

qa_pairs.question: nope
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as No.

qa_pairs.question: Nor
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A negative connective or particle, introducing the second member or clause of a negative proposition, following neither, or not, in the first member or clause (as or in affirmative propositions follows either). Nor is also used sometimes in the first member for neither, and sometimes the neither is omitted and implied by the use of nor.

qa_pairs.question: noradrenaline
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as norepinephrine.

qa_pairs.question: Norbertine
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Premonstrant.

qa_pairs.question: Nordic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is of or pertaining to the inhabitants of Scandinavia; as, Nordic languages have a gender system.

qa_pairs.question: noreaster
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a storm blowing from the northeast; -- a term used especially in the northeastern region of the United States.

qa_pairs.question: norepinephrine
qa_pairs.answer: It means A hormone (C8H11NO3) secreted by the adrenal medulla; it also serves as a neurotransmitter, released at synapses; called also also known as noradrenaline. Chemically it is 2-amino-1-(3,4-dihydroxyphenyl)ethanol. It is a precursor of epinephrine in the body.

qa_pairs.question: norethandrolone
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a progestin compound used in oral contraceptives and to treat endometriosis.

qa_pairs.question: Norfolk
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Short for Norfolk Jacket.

qa_pairs.question: Norfolk dumpling
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of boiled dumpling made in Norfolk.

qa_pairs.question: Norfolk jacket
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of loose-fitting plaited jacket, having a loose belt.

qa_pairs.question: Norfolk plover
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The stone curlew.

qa_pairs.question: Norfolk spaniel
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of a breed of field spaniels similar to the clumbers, but shorter in body and of a liver-and-white or black-and-white color.

qa_pairs.question: nori
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A type of dried seaweed, pressed into sheets and used as a seasoning or as a wrapper for sushi.

qa_pairs.question: Noria
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A large water wheel, turned by the action of a stream against its floats, and carrying at its circumference buckets, by which water is raised and discharged into a trough; used in Arabia, China, and elsewhere for irrigating land; a Persian wheel.

qa_pairs.question: Norian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Pertaining to the upper portion of the Laurentian rocks.

qa_pairs.question: Norice
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nurse.

qa_pairs.question: Norie
qa_pairs.answer: It means The cormorant.

qa_pairs.question: Norimon
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A Japanese covered litter, carried by men.

qa_pairs.question: Norite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A granular crystalline rock consisting essentially of a triclinic feldspar (as labradorite) and hypersthene.

qa_pairs.question: norium
qa_pairs.answer: It means A supposed metal alleged to have been discovered in 1845 by the Swedish chemist Swanberg in zircon. After many unsuccessful attempts to verify this new element, the element named Hafnium (atomic number 72) was discoverd in 1923 by D. Coster and G. von Hevesey in the zirconium-containing mineral zircon. Hafnium, present at 1 to 5% in many zirconium-bearing minerals, but difficult to separate from zirconium, is probably the element that gave rise to the properties attributed to the hypothetical norium.

qa_pairs.question: Norland
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The land in the north; north country.

qa_pairs.question: Norlander
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A northener; a person from the north country.

qa_pairs.question: Norm
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A rule or authoritative standard; a model; a type; as, deviations from the norm are not tolerated.

qa_pairs.question: Norma
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A norm; a principle or rule; a model; a standard.

qa_pairs.question: Normal
qa_pairs.answer: It means According to an established norm, rule, or principle; conformed to a type, standard, or regular form; performing the proper functions; not abnormal; regular; natural; analogical.

qa_pairs.question: Normal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any perpendicular.

qa_pairs.question: normalcy
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality, state, or fact of being normal; the normal situation or condition; as, the point of normalcy.

qa_pairs.question: normality
qa_pairs.answer: It means Conformity with the norm; the state of being normal; the normal condition.

qa_pairs.question: Normalization
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Reduction to a standard or normal state.

qa_pairs.question: normalize
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make normal; as, to normalize relations with China.

qa_pairs.question: normally
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a normal manner.

qa_pairs.question: norman
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A wooden bar, or iron pin.

qa_pairs.question: Norman
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to Normandy or to the Normans; as, the Norman language; the Norman conquest.

qa_pairs.question: Norman
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A native or inhabitant of Normandy; originally, one of the Northmen or Scandinavians who conquered Normandy in the 10th century; afterwards, one of the mixed (Norman-French) race which conquered England, under William the Conqueror.

qa_pairs.question: Normandy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A region of France divided into Haute-Normandie and Basse-Normandie.

qa_pairs.question: Normanism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A Norman idiom; a custom or expression peculiar to the Normans.

qa_pairs.question: normative
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is relating to or dealing with norms; as, normative discipline; normative samples.

qa_pairs.question: normotensive
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Pertaining to or having normal blood pressure.

qa_pairs.question: normothermia
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as normal body temperature.

qa_pairs.question: Norn
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of the three Fates, Past, Present, and Future. Their names were Urd, Verdandi, and Skuld. They are identified with the Anglo-Saxon Wyrd, and are similar to the Greek Moirae and Roman Parcae.

qa_pairs.question: Noropianic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of, pertaining to, or designating, an acid of the aromatic series obtained from opianic acid.

qa_pairs.question: Norroy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The most northern of the English Kings-at-arms. See King-at-arms, under King.

qa_pairs.question: Norse
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to ancient Scandinavia, or to the language spoken by its inhabitants.

qa_pairs.question: Norse
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The Norse language.

qa_pairs.question: Norseman

qa_pairs.question: Nousel

qa_pairs.question: Nouthe
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Just now; at present.

qa_pairs.question: Nouveau riche
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A person newly rich. Contrasted with old money.

qa_pairs.question: Nova
qa_pairs.answer: It means A star which suddenly increases in brightness thousands of times, then fades back to near its original intensity. It may appear as a <ldquo/new<rdquo/ star if its original brightness was too low for routine observation. A star which suddenly increases in brightness to many millions of times its original intensity is a supernova, and the postulated mechanisms for the increases of brightness of novae and supernovae are different.

qa_pairs.question: Novaculite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A variety of siliceous slate, of which hones are made; razor stone; Turkey stone; hone stone; whet slate.

qa_pairs.question: Novatian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of the sect of Novatius, or Novatianus, who held that the lapsed might not be received again into communion with the church, and that second marriages are unlawful.

qa_pairs.question: Novatianism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The doctrines or principles of the Novatians.

qa_pairs.question: Novation
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Innovation.

qa_pairs.question: Novator
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An innovator.

qa_pairs.question: Novel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of recent origin or introduction; not ancient; new; hence, out of the ordinary course; unusual; strange; surprising.

qa_pairs.question: Novel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is That which is new or unusual; a novelty.

qa_pairs.question: Novelette
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A short novel; a novella.

qa_pairs.question: Novelism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Innovation.

qa_pairs.question: Novelist
qa_pairs.answer: It means An innovator; an asserter of novelty.

qa_pairs.question: Novelize
qa_pairs.answer: It means To innovate.

qa_pairs.question: Novelize
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To innovate.

qa_pairs.question: Novelry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Novelty; new things.

qa_pairs.question: Novelty
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being novel; newness; freshness; recentness of origin or introduction.

qa_pairs.question: November
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The eleventh month of the year, containing thirty days.

qa_pairs.question: Novenary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the number nine.

qa_pairs.question: Novenary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The number of nine units; nine, collectively.

qa_pairs.question: Novene
qa_pairs.answer: It means Relating to, or dependent on, the number nine; novenary.

qa_pairs.question: Novennial
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Done or recurring every ninth year.

qa_pairs.question: Novercal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Done or recurring every ninth year.

qa_pairs.question: Novercal
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to a stepmother; suitable to, or in the manner of, a stepmother.

qa_pairs.question: Novice
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who is new in any business, profession, or calling; one unacquainted or unskilled; one yet in the rudiments; a beginner; a tyro.

qa_pairs.question: Novice
qa_pairs.answer: It means Like a novice; becoming a novice.

qa_pairs.question: Noviceship
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being a novice; novitiate.

qa_pairs.question: Novilunar
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the new moon.

qa_pairs.question: Novitiate
qa_pairs.answer: It means The state of being a novice; time of initiation or instruction in rudiments.

qa_pairs.question: Novitious
qa_pairs.answer: It means Newly invented; recent; new.

qa_pairs.question: Novity
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Newness; novelty.

qa_pairs.question: Novosibirsk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A city in the Asian part of Russia. Much Soviet military research was performed there, and until the 1990's it was restricted from entry by foreigners.

qa_pairs.question: Novum
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A game at dice, properly called also known as novem quinque (L., nine five), the two principal throws being nine and five.

qa_pairs.question: Now
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is At the present time; at this moment; at the time of speaking; instantly; as, I will write now.

qa_pairs.question: Now
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Existing at the present time; present.

qa_pairs.question: Now
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The present time or moment; the present.

qa_pairs.question: Nowadays
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In these days; at the present time.

qa_pairs.question: Noway
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In no manner or degree; not at all; nowise.

qa_pairs.question: Nowch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Nouch.

qa_pairs.question: Nowd
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The European gray gurnard (Trigla gurnardus).

qa_pairs.question: Nowed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Knotted; tied in a knot, as a serpent.

qa_pairs.question: Nowel
qa_pairs.answer: It means Christmas; also, a shout of joy at Christmas for the birth of the Savior.

qa_pairs.question: Nowel
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The core, or the inner part, of a mold for casting a large hollow object.

qa_pairs.question: Nowes
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The marriage knot.

qa_pairs.question: Nowhere
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Not anywhere; not in any place or state; as, the book is nowhere to be found.

qa_pairs.question: Nowhither
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Not anywhither; in no direction; nowhere.

qa_pairs.question: Nowise
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Not in any manner or degree; in no way; noways.

qa_pairs.question: Nowt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Neat cattle.

qa_pairs.question: Nowthe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Nouthe.

qa_pairs.question: Noxious
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hurtful; harmful; baneful; pernicious; injurious; destructive; unwholesome; insalubrious; as, noxious air, food, or climate; pernicious; corrupting to morals; as, noxious practices or examples.

qa_pairs.question: Noy
qa_pairs.answer: It means To annoy; to vex.

qa_pairs.question: Noy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That which annoys.

qa_pairs.question: Noyade
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A drowning of many persons at once, -- a method of execution practiced at Nantes in France during the Reign of Terror, by Jean Baptiste Carrier.

qa_pairs.question: Noyance
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Annoyance.

qa_pairs.question: Noyau
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A cordial of brandy, etc., flavored with the kernel of the bitter almond, or of the peach stone, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Noyer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An annoyer.

qa_pairs.question: Noyful
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Full of annoyance.

qa_pairs.question: Noyls
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Noils.

qa_pairs.question: Noyous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Annoying; disagreeable.

qa_pairs.question: Nozle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nozzle.

qa_pairs.question: Nozzle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The nose; the snout; hence, the projecting vent of anything; as, the nozzle of a bellows.

qa_pairs.question: Np
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The chemical symbol for Neptunium, a transuranic element having atomic number 93.

qa_pairs.question: nth
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Last or greatest in an indefinitely large series; as, to the nth degree.

qa_pairs.question: nu
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The 13th letter of the Greek alphabet (<nu/).

qa_pairs.question: Nuance
qa_pairs.answer: It means A shade of difference; a delicate gradation.

qa_pairs.question: Nub
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To push; to nudge; also, to beckon.

qa_pairs.question: Nub
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A jag, or snag; a knob; a protuberance; also, the point or gist, as of a story.

qa_pairs.question: Nubbin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A small or imperfect ear of maize.

qa_pairs.question: Nubble
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To beat or bruise with the fist.

qa_pairs.question: Nubecula
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A nebula.

qa_pairs.question: nubia
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A light fabric of wool, worn on the head by women; a cloud.

qa_pairs.question: Nubian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to Nubia in Eastern Africa.

qa_pairs.question: nubiferous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Bringing, or producing, clouds.

qa_pairs.question: Nubigenous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Born of, or produced from, clouds.

qa_pairs.question: Nubilate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cloud.

qa_pairs.question: Nubile
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of an age suitable for marriage; marriageable.

qa_pairs.question: Nubility
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The state of being marriageable.

qa_pairs.question: Nubilose
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Cloudy.

qa_pairs.question: Nucament
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A catkin or ament; the flower cluster of the hazel, pine, willow, and the like.

qa_pairs.question: Nucamentaceous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Like a nut either in structure or in being indehiscent; bearing one-seeded nutlike fruits.

qa_pairs.question: Nucellus
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Nucleus, 3 (a).

qa_pairs.question: Nucha
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The back or upper part of the neck; the nape.

qa_pairs.question: Nuchal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of, pertaining to, or in the region of, the back, or nape, of the neck; -- applied especially to the anterior median plate in the carapace of turtles.

qa_pairs.question: Nuciferous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Bearing, or producing, nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nuciform
qa_pairs.answer: It means Shaped like a nut; nut-shaped.

qa_pairs.question: Nucin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Juglone.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to a nucleus; as, the nuclear spindle (see Illust. of Karyokinesis) or the nuclear fibrils of a cell; the nuclear part of a comet, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Nuclear
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is of, pertaining to, or using nuclear weapons; a nuclear exchange, i.e. a reciprocal bombardment by nuclear weapons..

qa_pairs.question: Nuclear device
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as an explosive device, whether used as a weapon or for other purposes, which depends for most of its explosive power on the release of energy from within atomic nuclei. A fission device or a fusion device.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear energy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Energy derived from nuclear reactions; -- used at present especially of electrical power generated in atomic reactors, but encompassing also fusion energy.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear engineering
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The branch of engineering concerned with the design and construction and operation of nuclear reactors.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear explosion
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The explosion of an atomic bomb or atomic device; -- sometimes also used of fusion-powered explosions.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear family
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A family consisting of parents and their children and grandparents of a marital partner.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear fission
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A nuclear reaction in which a heavy atomic nucleus splits into smaller nuclei with the simultaneous release of energy.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear fusion
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A type of nuclear reaction in which atomic nuclei combine to form more massive nuclei with the simultaneous release of energy.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear fusion reaction
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A nuclear reaction in which nuclei combine to form more massive nuclei with the simultaneous release of energy.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear magnetic resonance
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The specific absorption and re-emission of electromagnetic radiation at characteristic wavelengths by atomic nuclei in a magnetic field. It is abbreviated also known as NMR. The wavelength of the radiation absorbed depends on the type of nucleus, the intensity of the magnetic field, and the local chemical environment in which the nucleus resides. It is the latter effect (called the chemical shift), by which atoms of specific elements in different chemical compounds show a different resonance frequency, which gives rise to the greatest utility of this phenomenon in analyzing the chemical structure of substances. Similar effects of the chemical environment permit the discrimination of different types of living tissue by virtue of their different chemical composition, thus permitting utilization of the phenomenon in medical diagnostic instruments, especially for magnetic resonance imaging.

qa_pairs.question: Nuclear physics
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as That branch of physics which studies the structure of and phenomena observed in atomic nuclei.

qa_pairs.question: Nuclear physicist
qa_pairs.answer: It means A scientist specializing in nuclear physics.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear power
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Power derived from nuclear reactions; -- used at present especially of electrical power generated in atomic reactors, but encompassing also fusion power.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear-powered ship
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A ship for which the motive power comes from the energy generated by a nuclear reactor.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear-powered submarine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A submarine for which the motive power comes from the energy generated by a nuclear reactor. Same as nuclear submarine.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear reaction
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A process that alters the energy or structure or composition of an atomic nucleus.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear reactor
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any of several devices that maintain and control a sustained nuclear fission chain reaction, for the production of energy, heat, or artificial elements, or for research purposes. The main fuel sustaining the reaction and consumed by the process is typically uranium or plutonium.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear resonance
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The resonance absorption of a gamma ray by a nucleus identical to the nucleus that emitted the gamma ray.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear war
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A war in which nuclear weapons are used by both sides. As generally used, the term assumes major use of nuclear weapons by at least two opposing warring states. As of 1999, no nuclear war has occurred.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear warhead
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The warhead of a missile containing an atom bomb or hydrogen bomb.

qa_pairs.question: Nuclear weapon
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A weapon of great explosive power, such as an atomic bomb or a hydrogen bomb, which depends for most of its explosive power on the release of energy from within atomic nuclei by a nuclear reaction. A fission weapon or a fusion weapon. The term includes atomic shells for cannon.

qa_pairs.question: nuclear winter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a hypothetical lowering of global temperature postulated as the aftermath of a full nuclear war. The mechanism of such an effect depends primarily on the injection into the atmosphere of small solid particles, as soot from burning forests, which reflect sunlight and cause a reduction in solar energy retained by the earth.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having a nucleus; nucleated.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To gather, as about a nucleus or center.

qa_pairs.question: nucleate
qa_pairs.answer: It means To form into a nucleus or multiple nuclei; as, raindrops may nucleate around silver iodide crystals.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleated
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having a nucleus; nucleate; as, nucleated cells.

qa_pairs.question: nucleic acid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A natural or synthetic polymer consisting of chains of ribonucleotide or deoxyribonucleotide units.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleiform
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Formed like a nucleus or kernel.

qa_pairs.question: Nuclein
qa_pairs.answer: It means A constituent of the nuclei of all cells, containing protein and nucleic acid. It is a colorless amorphous substance, readily soluble in alkaline fluids and especially characterized by its comparatively large content of phosphorus. It also contains nitrogen and sulphur.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleobranch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Belonging to the Nucleobranchiata.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleobranchiata
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Heteropoda.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleoidioplasma
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Hyaline plasma contained in the nucleus of vegetable cells.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleolar
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the nucleolus of a cell.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleolated
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having a nucleole, or second inner nucleus.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleole
qa_pairs.answer: It means The nucleus within a nucleus; nucleolus.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleolus
qa_pairs.answer: It means A little nucleus.

qa_pairs.question: nucleon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A neutron or proton, when contained within an atomic nucleus.

qa_pairs.question: nucleon number
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The sum of the number of neutrons and protons in an atomic nucleus.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleoplasm
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The matter composing the nucleus of a cell; the protoplasm of the nucleus; karyoplasma.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleoplasmic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to nucleoplasm; -- esp. applied to a body formed in the developing ovum from the plasma of the nucleus of the germinal vesicle.

qa_pairs.question: nucleoside
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A type of molecule found in all living organisms, present mostly in chemically combined form as a component of nucleic acids, and also in smaller amounts in free form, consisting of a pentose sugar bound to a purine or pyrimidine base; two types of nucleoside, ribonucleoside and deoxyribonucleoside, are present. The most common bases present in nucleosides are adenine, cytosine, uracil, guanine, and thymine, and to a lesser extent hypoxanthine and other bases are found. The most commmon ribonucleosides composed from these bases are called adenosine, cytidine, uridine, and guanosine. The forms esterified with orthophosphoric at the 5-position of the pentose are called nucleotides. The nucleotides form the monomer units which are combined into DNA and RNA, which carry the genetic information required for reproduction in all known organisms.

qa_pairs.question: nucleotide
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a phosphate ester of a nucleoside; one of the monomeric components of DNA or RNA.

qa_pairs.question: Nucleus
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A kernel; hence, a central mass or point about which matter is gathered, or to which accretion is made; the central or material portion; -- used both literally and figuratively.

qa_pairs.question: Nucula
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of small marine bivalve shells, having a pearly interior.

qa_pairs.question: Nucule
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Nutlet.

qa_pairs.question: Nucumentaceous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Nucamentaceous.

qa_pairs.question: Nudation
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of stripping, or making bare or naked.

qa_pairs.question: Nuddle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To walk quickly with the head bent forward; -- often with along.

qa_pairs.question: Nude
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Bare; naked; unclothed; undraped; as, a nude statue.

qa_pairs.question: Nudge
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To touch gently, as with the elbow, in order to call attention or convey intimation.

qa_pairs.question: Nudge
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A gentle push, or jog, as with the elbow.

qa_pairs.question: Nudibrachiate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having tentacles without vibratile cilia.

qa_pairs.question: Nudibranch
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the Nudibranchiata.

qa_pairs.question: Nudibranchiata
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A division of opisthobranchiate mollusks, having no shell except while very young. The gills are naked and situated upon the back or sides. See Ceratobranchia.

qa_pairs.question: Nudibranchiate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Nudibranch.

qa_pairs.question: Nudicaul
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the stems leafless.

qa_pairs.question: Nudification
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of making nude.

qa_pairs.question: Nudity
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being nude; nakedness.

qa_pairs.question: nudnik
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a pestiferous boring and dull person.

qa_pairs.question: Nudum pactum
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A bare, naked contract, without any consideration and therefore unenforceable in a court of law.

qa_pairs.question: Nugacity
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Futility; trifling talk or behavior; drollery.

qa_pairs.question: Nugae
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Trifles; jests.

qa_pairs.question: Nugation
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act or practice of trifling.

qa_pairs.question: Nugatory
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Trifling; vain; futile; insignificant.

qa_pairs.question: Nugget
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A lump; a mass, esp. a native lump of a precious metal; as, a nugget of gold.

qa_pairs.question: Nugify
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To render trifling or futile; to make silly.

qa_pairs.question: Nuisance
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is That which annoys or gives trouble and vexation; that which is offensive or noxious.

qa_pairs.question: Nuisancer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who makes or causes a nuisance.

qa_pairs.question: Nul
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as No; not any; as, nul disseizin; nul tort.

qa_pairs.question: Null
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of no legal or binding force or validity; of no efficacy; invalid; void; nugatory; useless.

qa_pairs.question: Null
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Something that has no force or meaning.

qa_pairs.question: Null
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To annul.

qa_pairs.question: Null
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the beads in nulled work.

qa_pairs.question: Nullah
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A water course, esp. a dry one; a gully; a gorge; -- orig. an East Indian term.

qa_pairs.question: Nulled
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Turned so as to resemble nulls.

qa_pairs.question: Nullibiety
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state or condition of being nowhere.

qa_pairs.question: Nullification
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of nullifying; a rendering void and of no effect, or of no legal effect.

qa_pairs.question: Nullifidian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of no faith; also, not trusting to faith for salvation; -- opposed to Antonym: solifidian.

qa_pairs.question: Nullifidian
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An unbeliever.

qa_pairs.question: Nullifier
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who nullifies or makes void; one who maintains the right to nullify a contract by one of the parties.

qa_pairs.question: Nullify
qa_pairs.answer: It means To make void; to render invalid; to deprive of legal force or efficacy.

qa_pairs.question: Nullipore
qa_pairs.answer: It means A name for certain crustaceous marine algae which secrete carbonate of lime on their surface, and were formerly thought to be of animal nature. They are now considered corallines of the genera *Melobesia* and *Lithothamnion*.

qa_pairs.question: Nullity
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being null; nothingness; want of efficacy or force.

qa_pairs.question: Numb
qa_pairs.answer: It means Enfeebled in, or destitute of, the power of sensation and motion; rendered torpid; benumbed; insensible; as, the fingers or limbs are numb with cold.

qa_pairs.question: Numb
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make numb; to deprive of the power of sensation or motion; to render senseless or inert; to deaden; to benumb; to stupefy.

qa_pairs.question: Numbedness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Numbness.

qa_pairs.question: Number
qa_pairs.answer: It means That which admits of being counted or reckoned; a unit, or an aggregate of units; a numerable aggregate or collection of individuals; an assemblage made up of distinct things expressible by figures.

qa_pairs.question: Number
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To count; to reckon; to ascertain the units of; to enumerate.

qa_pairs.question: Numberer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who numbers.

qa_pairs.question: Numberful
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Numerous.

qa_pairs.question: Numberless
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Innumerable; countless.

qa_pairs.question: Numberous
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Numerous.

qa_pairs.question: Numbers
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as (pl.) of Number. The fourth book of the Pentateuch, containing the census of the Hebrews.

qa_pairs.question: Numbfish
qa_pairs.answer: It means The torpedo, which numbs by the electric shocks which it gives.

qa_pairs.question: Numbless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Nombles.

qa_pairs.question: Numbness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The condition of being numb; that state of a living body in which it loses, wholly or in part, the power of feeling or motion.

qa_pairs.question: numdah
qa_pairs.answer: It means an embroidered rug made from a coarse Indian felt.

qa_pairs.question: Numenius
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of birds comprising certain of the curlews.

qa_pairs.question: numeracy
qa_pairs.answer: It means skill with numbers and mathematics; -- the skill with numbers analogous to literacy, the skill of reading.

qa_pairs.question: Numerable
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Capable of being numbered or counted.

qa_pairs.question: Numeral
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to number; consisting of number or numerals.

qa_pairs.question: Numeral
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A figure or character used to express a number; as, the Arabic numerals, 1, 2, 3, etc.; the Roman numerals, I, V, X, L, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Numerally
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as According to number; in number; numerically.

qa_pairs.question: Numerary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Belonging to a certain number; counting as one of a collection or body.

qa_pairs.question: Numerate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To divide off and read according to the rules of numeration; as, to numerate a row of figures.

qa_pairs.question: Numeration
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or art of numbering.

qa_pairs.question: Numerative
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to numeration; as, a numerative system.

qa_pairs.question: Numerator
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who numbers.

qa_pairs.question: Numeric
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Belonging to number; denoting number; consisting in numbers; expressed by numbers, and not letters; as, numerical characters; a numerical equation; a numerical statement.

qa_pairs.question: Numeric
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any number, proper or improper fraction, or incommensurable ratio. The term also includes any imaginary expression like m + n, where _m_ and _n_ are real numerics.

qa_pairs.question: Numerically
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a numerical manner; in numbers; with respect to number, or sameness in number; as, a thing is numerically the same, or numerically different.

qa_pairs.question: Numerist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who deals in numbers.

qa_pairs.question: Numero
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Number; -- often abbrev. No.

qa_pairs.question: Numerosity
qa_pairs.answer: It means The state of being numerous; numerousness.

qa_pairs.question: Numerous
qa_pairs.answer: It means Consisting of a great number of units or individual objects; being many; as, a numerous army; numerous objections.

qa_pairs.question: Numidian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to ancient Numidia in Northern Africa.

qa_pairs.question: Numididae
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A subfamily of birds including the guinea fowl and related birds of Africa and Madagascar.

qa_pairs.question: numinous
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Evincing the presence of a deity; as, a numinous wood; the most numinous moment in the Mass.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to coins; relating to the science of coins or medals.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatics
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The science of coins and medals.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatist
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One skilled in numismatics; a numismatologist.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatography
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A treatise on, or description of, coins and medals.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatologist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One versed in numismatology; usually called a also known as numismatist.

qa_pairs.question: Numismatology
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The science which treats of coins and medals, in their relation to history; numismatics.

qa_pairs.question: Nummary
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or relating to coins or money.

qa_pairs.question: Nummular
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to coin or money; pecuniary; as, the nummulary talent.

qa_pairs.question: Nummulation
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The arrangement of the red blood corpuscles in rouleaux, like piles of coins, as when a drop of human blood is examined under the microscope.

qa_pairs.question: Nummulite
qa_pairs.answer: It means A fossil of the genus *Nummulites* and allied genera.

qa_pairs.question: Nummulites
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A genus of extinct Tertiary Foraminifera, having a thin, flat, round shell, containing a large number of small chambers arranged spirally.

qa_pairs.question: Nummulitic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of, like, composed of, containing, nummulites; as, nummulitic beds.

qa_pairs.question: Numps
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A dolt; a blockhead.

qa_pairs.question: Numskull
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A dunce; a dolt; a stupid fellow.

qa_pairs.question: Numskulled
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Stupid; doltish.

qa_pairs.question: nun
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A woman devoted to a religious life, who lives in a convent, under the three vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience.

qa_pairs.question: nun
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The 14th letter of the Hebrew alphabet, corresponding in pronunciation to _n_.

qa_pairs.question: nun
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The 25th letter of the Arabic alphabet, corresponding in pronunciation to _n_.

qa_pairs.question: Nunatak
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In Greenland, an insular hill or mountain surrounded by an ice sheet.

qa_pairs.question: Nunc dimittis
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The also known as song of Simeon (Luke ii. 29-32), used in the ritual of many churches. It begins with these words in the Vulgate.

qa_pairs.question: Nunchion
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A portion of food taken at or after noon, usually between full meals; a luncheon.

qa_pairs.question: Nunciate
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who announces; a messenger; a nuncio.

qa_pairs.question: Nunciature
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The office of a nuncio.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncio
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A messenger.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncius
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A messenger.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncupate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To declare publicly or solemnly; to proclaim formally.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncupation
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of nuncupating.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncupative
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Publicly or solemnly declaratory.

qa_pairs.question: Nuncupatory
qa_pairs.answer: It means Nuncupative; oral.

qa_pairs.question: Nundinal
qa_pairs.answer: It means A nundinal letter.

qa_pairs.question: Nundinal
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to a fair, or to a market day.

qa_pairs.question: Nundinate
qa_pairs.answer: It means To buy and sell at fairs or markets.

qa_pairs.question: Nundination
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Traffic at fairs; marketing; buying and selling.

qa_pairs.question: Nunnation
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The pronunciation of _n_ at the end of words.

qa_pairs.question: Nunnery
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A house in which nuns reside; a cloister or convent in which women reside for life, under religious vows. See Cloister, and Convent.

qa_pairs.question: Nunnish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of, pertaining to, or resembling a nun; characteristic of a nun.

qa_pairs.question: Nup
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Nupson.

qa_pairs.question: Nuphar
qa_pairs.answer: It means A genus of plants found in the fresh-water ponds or lakes of Europe, Asia, and North America; the yellow water lily. Cf. Nymphaea.

qa_pairs.question: Nuprin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medicine used to relieve the pain of arthritis and as an analgesic and antipyretic; Advil and Motrin and Nuprin are trademarks of brands of also known as ibuprofen tablets.

qa_pairs.question: Nupson
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A simpleton; a fool.

qa_pairs.question: Nuptial
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to marriage; done or used at a wedding; as, nuptial rites and ceremonies.

qa_pairs.question: Nuptial
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Marriage; wedding; nuptial ceremony; -- now only in the plural.

qa_pairs.question: Nur
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A hard knot in wood; also, a hard knob of wood used by boys in playing hockey.

qa_pairs.question: Nuraghe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of the prehistoric towerlike structures found in Sardinia.

qa_pairs.question: Nurl
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cut with reeding or fluting on the edge of, as coins, the heads of screws, etc.; to knurl.

qa_pairs.question: Nurse
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who nourishes; a person who supplies food, tends, or brings up; as: (a) A woman who has the care of young children; especially, one who suckles an infant not her own. (b) A person, especially a woman, who has the care of the sick or infirm.

qa_pairs.question: Nurse
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To nourish; to cherish; to foster

qa_pairs.question: nursed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as fed mother's milk from the breast; -- of an infant.

qa_pairs.question: Nursehound
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Houndfish.

qa_pairs.question: nurseling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An infant considered in relation to its nurse.

qa_pairs.question: Nursemaid
qa_pairs.answer: It means A girl or woman employed to attend and care for children.

qa_pairs.question: Nursepond
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A pond where fish are fed.

qa_pairs.question: Nurser
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who nurses; a nurse; one who cherishes or encourages growth.

qa_pairs.question: Nursery
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of nursing.

qa_pairs.question: Nurseryman
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who cultivates or keeps a nursery, or place for rearing trees, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Nursing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Supplying or taking nourishment from, or as from, the breast; as, a nursing mother; a nursing infant.

qa_pairs.question: Nursling
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, is nursed; an infant; a fondling.

qa_pairs.question: Nurstle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To nurse. See Noursle.

qa_pairs.question: Nurture
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of nourishing or nursing; tender care; education; training.

qa_pairs.question: Nurture
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To feed; to nourish.

qa_pairs.question: Nusku
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The god of fire and light; corresponds to the Babylonian Girru.

qa_pairs.question: Nustle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To fondle; to cherish.

qa_pairs.question: Nut
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The fruit of certain trees and shrubs (as of the almond, walnut, hickory, beech, filbert, etc.), consisting of a hard and indehiscent shell inclosing a kernel.

qa_pairs.question: Nut
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To gather nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nutant
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nodding; having the top bent downward.

qa_pairs.question: nutate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is to rock, sway, or nod; usually involuntarily.

qa_pairs.question: Nutation
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of nodding.

qa_pairs.question: Nutbreaker
qa_pairs.answer: It means The European nuthatch.

qa_pairs.question: Nut-brown
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Brown as a nut long kept and dried.

qa_pairs.question: Nutcracker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An instrument for cracking nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nutgall
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A more or less round gall resembling a nut, esp. one of those produced on the oak and used in the arts. See Gall, Gallnut.

qa_pairs.question: nutgrass
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A widely distributed perennial plant of the Sedge family (Cyperus rotundus, var. Hydra), which has slender rootstocks bearing small, edible, nutlike tubers, by which the plant multiplies exceedingly, especially in cotton fields.

qa_pairs.question: Nuthatch
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of several species of birds of the genus *Sitta*, as the European species (Sitta Europaea). The white-breasted nuthatch (Sitta Carolinensis), the red-breasted nuthatch (Sitta Canadensis), the pygmy nuthatch (Sitta pygmaea), and others, are American.

qa_pairs.question: Nuthook
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A hook at the end of a pole to pull down boughs for gathering the nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nutjobber
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The nuthatch.

qa_pairs.question: Nutlet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A small nut; also, the stone of a drupe.

qa_pairs.question: Nutmeg
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The kernel of the fruit of the nutmeg tree (Myristica fragrans), a native of the Molucca Islands, but cultivated elsewhere in the tropics.

qa_pairs.question: Nutmegged
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Seasoned with nutmeg.

qa_pairs.question: Nutpecker
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The nuthatch.

qa_pairs.question: Nutria
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The fur of the coypu. See Coypu.

qa_pairs.question: Nutrication
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act or manner of feeding.

qa_pairs.question: Nutrient
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Nutritious; nourishing; promoting growth.

qa_pairs.question: Nutrient
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any substance which has nutritious qualities, _i. e._, which nourishes or promotes growth; a nutriment.

qa_pairs.question: nutrify
qa_pairs.answer: It means To give nutrients to.

qa_pairs.question: Nutriment
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as That which nourishes; a nutrient; anything which promotes growth and repairs the natural waste of animal or vegetable life; food; aliment.

qa_pairs.question: Nutrimental
qa_pairs.answer: It means Nutritious.

qa_pairs.question: Nutritial
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Pertaining to, or connected with, nutrition; nutritious.

qa_pairs.question: Nutrition
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In the broadest sense, a process or series of processes by which a living organism as a whole (or its component parts or organs) is maintained in its normal condition of life and growth.

qa_pairs.question: Nutritional
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to nutrition; as, nutritional changes.

qa_pairs.question: nutritionist
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a specialist in the study of nutrition.

qa_pairs.question: Nutritious
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Nourishing; promoting growth, or preventing decay; alimental.

qa_pairs.question: Nutritive
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to nutrition; as, the nutritive functions; having the quality of nourishing; nutritious; nutrimental; alimental; as, nutritive food or berries.

qa_pairs.question: Nutriture
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Nutrition; nourishment.

qa_pairs.question: nuts
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Crazy; loony; insane; batty; -- used in a predicate position, ususually in phrases such as to go nuts, went nuts, are you nuts?

qa_pairs.question: nuts
qa_pairs.answer: It means An expression of disapproval, defiance, or displeasure, as in: <ldquo/Ah, nuts! My knife just broke.<rdquo/

qa_pairs.question: nutsedge
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a widely distributed perennial sedge (Cyperus rotundus) having small edible nutlike tubers; also called also known as nut grass.

qa_pairs.question: Nutshell
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The shell or hard external covering in which the kernel of a nut is inclosed.

qa_pairs.question: Nutter
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A gatherer of nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nutting
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of gathering nuts.

qa_pairs.question: nutty
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Abounding in nuts.

qa_pairs.question: Nux vomica
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The seed of Strychnos Nuxvomica, a tree which abounds on the Malabar and Coromandel coasts of the East Indies. From this seed the deadly poisons known as strychnine and brucine are obtained. The seeds are sometimes called Quaker buttons.

qa_pairs.question: Nuytsia
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A genus consisting of only one species.

qa_pairs.question: Nuzzle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To noursle or nurse; to foster; to bring up.

qa_pairs.question: Nuzzle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To work with the nose, like a swine in the mud.

qa_pairs.question: Ny
qa_pairs.answer: It means Not I; nor I.

qa_pairs.question: Ny
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Nigh.

qa_pairs.question: nyala
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A spiral-horned South African antelope (Tragelaphus angasi) with a fringe of white hairs along back and neck.

qa_pairs.question: Nyas
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Nias.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctaginia
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A genus consisting of only one species.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctalopia
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A disease of the eye, in consequence of which the patient can see well in a faint light or at twilight, but is unable to see during the day or in a strong light; day blindness.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctalops
qa_pairs.answer: It means One afflicted with nyctalopia.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctalopy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Nyctalopia.

qa_pairs.question: Nycthemeron
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The natural day and night, or space of twenty-four hours.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctibune
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A South American bird of the genus *Nyctibius*, allied to the goatsuckers.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctimene
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of East Indian fruit bats.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctitropic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Turning or bending at night into special positions.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctitropism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The tendency of certain plant organs, as leaves, to assume special <ldquo/sleeping<rdquo/ positions or make curvatures under the influence of darkness. It is well illustrated in the leaflets of clover and other leguminous plants.

qa_pairs.question: Nyctophile
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any Australian bat of the genus *Nyctophilus*, having a very simple nasal appendage.

qa_pairs.question: Nye
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A brood or flock of pheasants.

qa_pairs.question: Nyentek
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A carnivorous mammal (Helictis moscatus, or Helictis orientalis), native of Eastern Asia and the Indies. It has a dorsal white stripe, and another one across the shoulders. It has a strong musky odor.

qa_pairs.question: nylghai
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as nylghau.

qa_pairs.question: Nylghau
qa_pairs.answer: It means A large Asiatic antelope (Boselaphus tragocamelus, syn. Portax tragocamelus), found in Northern India; called also the also known as blue bull. It has short horns, a black mane, and a bunch of long hair on the throat. The general color is grayish brown; the male is blue-grey with white markings, and the female is brownish with no horns.

qa_pairs.question: nylon
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any of several thermoplastic polyamide plastics, comprising a family of high-strength resilient synthetic materials, used mostly in fibers.

qa_pairs.question: nymph
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A goddess of the mountains, forests, meadows, or waters.

qa_pairs.question: nympha
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Nymph, 3.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphaea
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus of aquatic plants having showy flowers (white, blue, pink, or yellow, often fragrant), including the white water lily and the Egyptia lotus.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphaeaceae
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A natural family of dicot aquatic plants.

qa_pairs.question: nymphal
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to a nymph or nymphs; nymphean.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphales
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Nymphalidae, an extensive family of butterflies including the nymphs, the satyrs, the monarchs, the heliconias, and others; -- called also also known as brush-footed butterflies.

qa_pairs.question: nymphalid
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any butterfly of the family Nymphalidae, consisting of medium to large butterflies found worldwide, typically having brightly colored wings and much-reduced nonfunctional forelegs carried folded on the breast.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphalidae
qa_pairs.answer: It means A natural family of large beautifully colored butterflies, called also the also known as brush-footed butterflies; formerly called Nymphales.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphalis
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The type genus of the Nymphalidae, including the mourning cloak butterfly (Nymphalis antiopa).

qa_pairs.question: Nymphean
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of, pertaining to, or appropriate to, nymphs; inhabited by nymphs; as, a nymphean cave.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A little or young nymph.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to nymphs.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphiparous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Producing pupas or nymphs.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Relating to nymphs; ladylike.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphlike
qa_pairs.answer: It means Resembling, or characteristic of, a nymph.

qa_pairs.question: nympho
qa_pairs.answer: It means A nymphomaniac.

qa_pairs.question: Nympholepsy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A species of demoniac enthusiasm or possession coming upon one who had accidentally looked upon a nymph; ecstasy.

qa_pairs.question: Nympholeptic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Under the influence of nympholepsy; ecstatic; frenzied.

qa_pairs.question: nymphomania
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An uncontrollable excessive sexual desire in women, constituting a true disease.

qa_pairs.question: nymphomaniac
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A woman afflicted with nymphomania.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphomany
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Nymphomania.

qa_pairs.question: Nymphotomy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Excision of the nymphae.

qa_pairs.question: Nys
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Is not. See Nis.

qa_pairs.question: Nystagmus
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A rapid involuntary oscillation of the eyeballs.

qa_pairs.question: nystatin
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An antifungal antibiotic, extracted from fermentation broths of the soil actinomycete Streptomyces noursei and other actinomycetes; called also also known as fungicidin. It is a polyene macrolide antibiotic, and consists of several related components. Component nystatin A1 has formula C47H75NO17.

qa_pairs.question: Nyula
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A species of ichneumon (Herpestes nyula). Its fur is beautifully variegated by closely set zigzag markings.

qa_pairs.question: J
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is J is the tenth letter of the English alphabet. It is a later variant form of the Roman letter I, used to express a consonantal sound, that is, originally, the sound of English y in yet. The forms J and I have, until a recent time, been classed together, and they have been used interchangeably.

qa_pairs.question: Jaal goat
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A species of wild goat (Capra Nubiana) found in the mountains of Abyssinia, Upper Egypt, and Arabia; -- called also also known as beden, and also known as jaela.

qa_pairs.question: Jab
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To thrust; to stab; to punch. See Job, (v. t.)

qa_pairs.question: Jab
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A thrust or stab.

qa_pairs.question: Jabber
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To talk rapidly, indistinctly, or unintelligibly; to utter gibberish or nonsense; to chatter.

qa_pairs.question: Jabber
qa_pairs.answer: It means To utter rapidly or indistinctly; to gabble; as, to jabber French.

qa_pairs.question: Jabber
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Rapid or incoherent talk, with indistinct utterance; gibberish.

qa_pairs.question: Jabberer
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who jabbers.

qa_pairs.question: Jabberingly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In a jabbering manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jabberment
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Jabber.

qa_pairs.question: Jabbernowl
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Jobbernowl.

qa_pairs.question: Jabiru
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One of several large wading birds of the genera *Mycteria* and *Xenorhynchus*, allied to the storks in form and habits.

qa_pairs.question: Jaborandi
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The native name of a South American rutaceous shrub (Pilocarpus pennatifolius). The leaves are used in medicine as an diaphoretic and sialogogue.

qa_pairs.question: Jaborine
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An alkaloid found in jaborandi leaves, from which it is extracted as a white amorphous substance. In its action it resembles atropine.

qa_pairs.question: Jabot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Originally, a kind of ruffle worn by men on the bosom of the shirt.

qa_pairs.question: jaboticaba
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A small evergreen tropical tree (Myrciaria cauliflora) native to Brazil and West Indies but introduced into southern U. S.; it is grown in Brazil for its edible tough-skinned purple grapelike fruit that grows all along the branches.

qa_pairs.question: Jacal
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In Mexico and the southwestern United States, a kind of plastered house or hut, usually made by planting poles or timber in the ground, filling in between them with screen work or wickerwork, and daubing one or both sides with mud or adobe mortar; also, this method of construction.

qa_pairs.question: Jacamar
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of numerous species of tropical American birds of the genus *Galbula* and allied genera. They are allied to the kingfishers, but climb on tree trunks like nuthatches, and feed upon insects. Their colors are often brilliant.

qa_pairs.question: Jacana
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any of several wading birds belonging to the genus *Jacana* and several allied genera, all of which have spurs on the wings. They are able to run about over floating water weeds by means of their very long, spreading toes. Called also also known as surgeon bird.

qa_pairs.question: Jacaranda
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The native Brazilian name for certain leguminous trees, which produce the beautiful woods called king wood, tiger wood, and violet wood.

qa_pairs.question: Jacare
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A cayman. See Yacare.

qa_pairs.question: Jacchus
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The common marmoset (Hapale vulgaris). Formerly, the name was also applied to other species of the same genus.

qa_pairs.question: Jacconet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jaconet.

qa_pairs.question: Jacent
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Lying at length; as, the jacent posture.

qa_pairs.question: Jacinth
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Hyacinth.

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large tree, the Artocarpus integrifolia, common in the East Indies, closely allied to the breadfruit, from which it differs in having its leaves entire. The fruit is of great size, weighing from thirty to forty pounds, and through its soft fibrous matter are scattered the seeds, which are roasted and eaten. The wood is of a yellow color, fine grain, and rather heavy, and is much used in cabinetwork. It is also used for dyeing a brilliant yellow.

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A familiar nickname of, or substitute for, John.

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A coarse and cheap medi<ae/val coat of defense, esp. one made of leather.

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A pitcher or can of waxed leather; -- called also also known as black jack.

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: It means To hunt game at night by means of a jack. See 2d Jack, (n.), 4, (n.)

qa_pairs.question: Jack
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To move or lift, as a house, by means of a jack or jacks. See 2d Jack, (n.), 5.

qa_pairs.question: Jack-a-dandy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A little dandy; a little, foppish, impertinent fellow.

qa_pairs.question: Jackal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Any one of several species of carnivorous animals inhabiting Africa and Asia, related to the dog and wolf. They are cowardly, nocturnal, and gregarious. They feed largely on carrion, and are noted for their piercing and dismal howling.

qa_pairs.question: Jack-a-lent
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small stuffed puppet to be pelted in Lent; hence, a simple fellow.

qa_pairs.question: Jackanapes
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A monkey; an ape.

qa_pairs.question: Jackaroo
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A young man living as an apprentice on a sheep station, or otherwise engaged in acquainting himself with colonial life.

qa_pairs.question: Jackaroo
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To be a jackaroo; to pass one's time as a jackaroo.

qa_pairs.question: Jackass
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The male ass; a donkey.

qa_pairs.question: jackboot
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a man's high tasseled boot.

qa_pairs.question: jackbooted
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wearing jackboots; -- used especially as a metaphor for harshly repressive and militaristic; as, jackbooted government agents.

qa_pairs.question: jackboot tactics
qa_pairs.answer: It means Harsh strongarm tactics; repressive, bullying and militaristic tactics like those used in authoritarian or totalitarian countries; -- used opprobriously, and often in hyperbolic exaggeration of police tactics in democratic countries.

qa_pairs.question: Jackdaw
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Daw, (n.)

qa_pairs.question: Jackeen
qa_pairs.answer: It means A drunken, dissolute fellow.

qa_pairs.question: Jacket
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A short upper garment, extending downward to the hips; a short coat without skirts.

qa_pairs.question: Jacket
qa_pairs.answer: It means To put a jacket on; to furnish, as a boiler, with a jacket.

qa_pairs.question: Jacketed
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Wearing, or furnished with, a jacket.

qa_pairs.question: Jacketing
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The material of a jacket; as, nonconducting jacketing.

qa_pairs.question: jackhammer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a hammer having a strong steel cutting blade, driven by compressed air in multiple rapid strokes, and used for cutting through pavement, concrete, or other hard substances.

qa_pairs.question: Jack-in-a-box
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A tropical tree (Hernandia sonora), which bears a drupe that rattles when dry in the inflated calyx.

qa_pairs.question: jack-in-the-pulpit
qa_pairs.answer: It means A common American spring-flowering woodland herb (Aris<ae/ma triphyllum) having sheathing leaves and an upright club-shaped spadix with overarching green and purple spathe producing scarlet berries; also called also known as Indian turnip.

qa_pairs.question: Jack Ketch
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A public executioner, or hangman.

qa_pairs.question: Jackknife
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A large, strong clasp knife for the pocket; a pocket knife.

qa_pairs.question: jacklight
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A portable source of light, as an oil lantern or electric light, used as a lure for hunting at night.

qa_pairs.question: jacklight
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is to fish for or hunt with a jacklight.

qa_pairs.question: Jackman
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One wearing a jack; a horse soldier; a retainer. See 3d Jack, (n.)

qa_pairs.question: Jack-o-lantern
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large orange-colored luminescent mushroom, Clitocybe illudens, also classified as Omphalotus olearius. It is poisonous and is sometimes found on hardwood tree stumps.

qa_pairs.question: Jackpot
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as jack pot. See under jack.

qa_pairs.question: Jackpudding
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A merry-andrew; a buffoon.

qa_pairs.question: Jacksaw
qa_pairs.answer: It means The merganser.

qa_pairs.question: Jackscrew
qa_pairs.answer: It means A jack in which a screw is used for lifting, or exerting pressure. See Illust. of 2d Jack, (n.), 5.

qa_pairs.question: Jackslave
qa_pairs.answer: It means A low servant; a mean fellow.

qa_pairs.question: Jacksmith
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A smith who makes jacks. See 2d Jack, 4, c.

qa_pairs.question: Jacksnipe
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A small European snipe (Limnocryptes gallinula); -- called also also known as judcock, also known as jedcock, also known as juddock, also known as jed, and also known as half snipe.

qa_pairs.question: Jackstay
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A rail of wood or iron stretching along a yard of a vessel, to which the sails are fastened.

qa_pairs.question: Jackstone
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of the pebbles or pieces used in the game of jackstones.

qa_pairs.question: Jackstraw
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An effigy stuffed with straw; a scarecrow; hence, a man without property or influence.

qa_pairs.question: jackstraws
qa_pairs.answer: It means The game played with jackstraws{2}, which resembles pick-up-sticks.

qa_pairs.question: Jackwood
qa_pairs.answer: It means Wood of the jack (Artocarpus integrifolia), used in cabinetwork.

qa_pairs.question: Jacky
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Dim. or pet from Jack

qa_pairs.question: Jacob
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Hebrew patriarch (son of Isaac, and ancestor of the Jews), who in a vision saw a ladder reaching up to heaven (Gen. xxviii. 12); -- also called also known as Israel.

qa_pairs.question: Jacob<ae/an lily
qa_pairs.answer: It means A bulbous plant (Amaryllis formosissima syn. Sprekelia formosissima) from Mexico. It bears a single, large, deep, red, lilylike flower.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobean
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to James the First, of England, or of his reign or times; (especially), pertaining to a style of architecture and decoration popular in the time of James I.; as, Jacobean writers.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobean
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as any distinguished personage during the reign of James I of England.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Dominican friar; -- so named because, before the French Revolution, that order had a convent in the Rue St. Jacques, Paris.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobin
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Jacobinic.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobine
qa_pairs.answer: It means A Jacobin.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobinic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the Jacobins of France; revolutionary; of the nature of, or characterized by, Jacobinism.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobinism
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The principles of the Jacobins; violent and factious opposition to legitimate government.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobinize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To taint with, or convert to, Jacobinism.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobite
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A partisan or adherent of James the Second, after his abdication, or of his descendants, an opposer of the revolution in 1688 in favor of William and Mary.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the Jacobites.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobitic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the Jacobites; characterized by Jacobitism.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobitism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The principles of the Jacobites.

qa_pairs.question: Jacobus
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An English gold coin, of the value of twenty-five shillings sterling, struck in the reign of James I.

qa_pairs.question: Jaconet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A thin cotton fabric, between cambric and muslin, used for dresses, neckcloths, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Jacquard
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Pertaining to, or invented by, Jacquard, a French mechanician, who died in 1834.

qa_pairs.question: Jacqueminot
qa_pairs.answer: It means A half-hardy, deep crimson rose of the remontant class; -- so named after General Jacqueminot, of France.

qa_pairs.question: Jacquerie
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The name given to a revolt of French peasants against the nobles in 1358, the leader assuming the contemptuous title, Jacques Bonhomme, given by the nobles to the peasantry. Hence, any revolt of peasants.

qa_pairs.question: Jactancy
qa_pairs.answer: It means A boasting; a bragging.

qa_pairs.question: Jactation
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A throwing or tossing of the body; a shaking or agitation.

qa_pairs.question: Jactitation
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Vain boasting or assertions repeated to the prejudice of another's right; false claim.

qa_pairs.question: Jaculable
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Fit for throwing.

qa_pairs.question: Jaculate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To throw or cast, as a dart; to throw out; to emit.

qa_pairs.question: Jaculation
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of tossing, throwing, or hurling, as spears.

qa_pairs.question: Jaculator
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who throws or casts.

qa_pairs.question: Jaculatory
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Darting or throwing out suddenly; also, suddenly thrown out; uttered in short sentences; ejaculatory; as, jaculatory prayers.

qa_pairs.question: Jadding
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Holing.

qa_pairs.question: Jade
qa_pairs.answer: It means A stone, commonly of a pale to dark green color but sometimes whitish. It is very hard and compact, capable of fine polish, and is used for ornamental purposes and for implements, esp. in Eastern countries and among many early peoples.

qa_pairs.question: Jade
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A mean or tired horse; a worthless nag.

qa_pairs.question: Jade
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To treat like a jade; to spurn.

qa_pairs.question: Jade
qa_pairs.answer: It means To become weary; to lose spirit.

qa_pairs.question: jaded
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as dulled by surfeit; as, the amoral, jaded, bored upper classes.

qa_pairs.question: Jadeite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Jade, the stone.

qa_pairs.question: Jadery
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The tricks of a jade.

qa_pairs.question: Jadish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Vicious; ill-tempered; resembling a jade; -- applied to a horse.

qa_pairs.question: Jaeger
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jager.

qa_pairs.question: Jag
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A notch; a cleft; a barb; a ragged or sharp protuberance; a denticulation.

qa_pairs.question: Jag
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cut into notches or teeth like those of a saw; to notch.

qa_pairs.question: Jag
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A small load, as of hay or grain in the straw, or of ore.

qa_pairs.question: Jag
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To carry, as a load; as, to jag hay, etc.

qa_pairs.question: JAG
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Judge-Advocate General.

qa_pairs.question: Jagannath
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A particular form of Vishnu, or of Krishna, whose chief idol and worship are at Puri, in Orissa. The idol is considered to contain the bones of Krishna and to possess a soul.
