The principal festivals are the Snanayatra, when the idol is bathed, and the Rathayatra, when the image is drawn upon a car adorned with obscene paintings. Formerly it was erroneously supposed that devotees allowed themselves to be crushed beneath the wheels of this car. It is now known that any death within the temple of Jagannath is considered to render the place unclean, and any spilling of blood in the presence of the idol is a pollution.

qa_pairs.question: Jager
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sharpshooter. See Yager.

qa_pairs.question: jagg
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jag.

qa_pairs.question: jaggary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as unrefined brown sugar made from palm sap. See jaggery.

qa_pairs.question: jagged
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having jags; having rough, sharp notches, protuberances, or teeth; cleft; laciniate; divided; as, jagged rocks.

qa_pairs.question: jaggedness
qa_pairs.answer: It means something irregular like a bump on or crack in a smooth surface.

qa_pairs.question: Jagger
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who carries about a small load; a peddler. See 2d Jag.

qa_pairs.question: Jagger
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who, or that which, jags;

qa_pairs.question: Jaggery
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Raw palm sugar, made in the East Indies by evaporating the fresh juice of several kinds of palm trees, but specifically those of the palmyra (Borassus flabelliformis) and jaggery palm (Caryota urens).

qa_pairs.question: Jaggery palm
qa_pairs.answer: It means An East Indian palm (Caryota urens) having leaves pinnate with wedge-shaped divisions, the petiole very stout. It is the principal source of jaggery, and is often cultivated for ornament.

qa_pairs.question: jagghery
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as jaggery.

qa_pairs.question: Jaggy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having jags; set with teeth; notched; uneven; as, jaggy teeth.

qa_pairs.question: Jaghir
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A village or district the government and revenues of which are assigned to some person, usually in consideration of some service to be rendered, esp. the maintenance of troops.

qa_pairs.question: Jaghirdar
qa_pairs.answer: It means The holder of a jaghir.

qa_pairs.question: Jagua palm
qa_pairs.answer: It means A great Brazilian palm (Maximiliana regia), having immense spathes which are used for baskets and tubs.

qa_pairs.question: Jaguar
qa_pairs.answer: It means A large and powerful feline animal (Panthera onca, formerly Felis onca), ranging from Texas and Mexico to Patagonia. It is usually brownish yellow, with large, dark, somewhat angular rings, each generally inclosing one or two dark spots. It is chiefly arboreal in its habits. It is also called the also known as panther and the also known as American tiger.

qa_pairs.question: Jaguarondi
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A South American wild cat (Felis jaguarondi), having a long, slim body and very short legs. Its color is grayish brown, varied with a blackish hue. It is arboreal in its habits and feeds mostly on birds.

qa_pairs.question: Jah
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Jehovah.

qa_pairs.question: Jahvist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jehovist, Jehovistic.

qa_pairs.question: Jahweh
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a name for the Old Testament God as transliterated from the Hebrew YHVH. See Jehovah.

qa_pairs.question: Jail
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of prison; a building for the confinement of persons held in lawful custody, especially for minor offenses or with reference to some future judicial proceeding.

qa_pairs.question: Jail
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To imprison.

qa_pairs.question: jailbird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A prisoner; one is in prison or who has been confined in prison.

qa_pairs.question: jailbreak
qa_pairs.answer: It means an escape from jail; as, five prisoners escaped in a coordinated jailbreak.

qa_pairs.question: jailed
qa_pairs.answer: It means placed in a prison; -- of people.

qa_pairs.question: Jailer
qa_pairs.answer: It means The keeper of a jail or prison.

qa_pairs.question: jailing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act or process of putting someone in prison or in jail as a lawful punishment.

qa_pairs.question: Jain
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of a numerous sect in British India, holding the tenets of Jainism.

qa_pairs.question: Jain
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as of or pertaining to Jainism; as, Jain gods.

qa_pairs.question: Jainism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The heterodox Hindu religion, founded in the 6th century as a revolt against Hinduism; its most striking features are the exaltation of saints or holy mortals, called jins, above the ordinary Hindu gods, and the denial of a supreme being and of the divine origin and infallibility of the Vedas. Also, the sect comprising those adhering to Jainism. Jainism believes in immortality and the transmigration of the soul. It is intermediate between Brahmanism and Buddhism, having some things in common with each.

qa_pairs.question: Jairou
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The ahu or Asiatic gazelle.

qa_pairs.question: Jak
qa_pairs.answer: It means see 1st Jack.

qa_pairs.question: Jakes
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A privy.

qa_pairs.question: Jakie
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A South American striped frog (Pseudis paradoxa), remarkable for having a tadpole larger than the adult, and hence called also also known as paradoxical frog.

qa_pairs.question: Jako
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An African parrot (Psittacus erithacus), very commonly kept as a cage bird; -- called also also known as gray parrot.

qa_pairs.question: Jakwood
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jackwood.

qa_pairs.question: Jalap
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The tubers of the Mexican plant IpomConvolvulaceae, a climber much like the morning-glory. The abstract, extract, and powder, prepared from the tubers, are well known purgative (cathartic) medicines, and are also called jalap. Other species of *Ipom<oe/a* yield several inferior kinds of jalap, as the Ipom<oe/a Orizabensis, and Ipom<oe/a tuberosa.

qa_pairs.question: Jalapic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to jalap.

qa_pairs.question: Jalapin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A glucoside found in the stems of the jalap plant and scammony. It is a strong purgative.

qa_pairs.question: Jalons
qa_pairs.answer: It means Long poles, topped with wisps of straw, used as landmarks and signals.

qa_pairs.question: Jalousie
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A Venetian or slatted inside window blind.

qa_pairs.question: Jalousied
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Furnished with jalousies; as, jalousied porches.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of frock for children.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Jamb.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To press into a close or tight position; to crowd; to squeeze; to wedge in; to cram; as, rock fans jammed the theater for the concert.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To become stuck so as not to function; as, the copier jammed again.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A mass of people or objects crowded together; also, the pressure from a crowd; a crush; as, a jam in a street; a jam of logs in a river.

qa_pairs.question: Jam
qa_pairs.answer: It means A preserve of fruit boiled with sugar and water; also called also known as jelly; as, raspberry jam; currant jam; grape jam.

qa_pairs.question: Jamacina
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Jamaicine.

qa_pairs.question: Jamadar
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Jemidar.

qa_pairs.question: Jamaica
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the West Indian islands.

qa_pairs.question: Jamaican
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to Jamaica.

qa_pairs.question: Jamaicine
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An alkaloid said to be contained in the bark of Geoffroya inermis, a leguminous tree growing in Jamaica and Surinam; -- called also also known as jamacina.

qa_pairs.question: Jamb
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The vertical side of any opening, as a door or fireplace; hence, less properly, any narrow vertical surface of wall, as the of a chimney-breast or of a pier, as distinguished from its face.

qa_pairs.question: Jamb
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Jam, (v. t. & i.)

qa_pairs.question: Jamb
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jambes.

qa_pairs.question: jambalaya
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A spicy Creole dish of rice with ham, sausage, chicken, or shellfish, plus tomatoes, and seasoned with peppers, onions, herbs, and celery.

qa_pairs.question: jambeau
qa_pairs.answer: It means See jambes.

qa_pairs.question: Jambee
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A fashionable cane.

qa_pairs.question: Jambes
qa_pairs.answer: It means In the Middle Ages, armor for the legs below the knees, usually having front and back pieces; called also also known as greaves.

qa_pairs.question: Jambolana
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A myrtaceous tree of the West Indies and tropical America (Calyptranthes Jambolana), with astringent bark, used for dyeing. It bears an edible fruit.

qa_pairs.question: Jambool
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The Java plum; also, a drug obtained from its bark and seeds, formerly used as a remedy for diabetes.

qa_pairs.question: Jamboree
qa_pairs.answer: It means A noisy or unrestrained carousal or frolic; a spree.

qa_pairs.question: Jamdani
qa_pairs.answer: It means A silk fabric, with a woven pattern of sprigs of flowers.

qa_pairs.question: James
qa_pairs.answer: It means William James, an American psychologist and philosopher (1842-1910). He was the brother of Henry James.

qa_pairs.question: Jamesonia
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A genus of xerophytic ferns of South America.

qa_pairs.question: Jamesonite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A steel-gray mineral, of metallic luster, commonly fibrous massive. It is a sulphide of antimony and lead, with a little iron.

qa_pairs.question: Jamess powder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Antimonial powder, first prepared by Dr. James, an English physician; -- called also also known as fever powder.

qa_pairs.question: Jamestown weed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The poisonous thorn apple or stramonium (Datura stramonium), a rank weed early noticed at Jamestown, Virginia. See Datura.

qa_pairs.question: jamjar
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a jar for holding jellies or preserves.

qa_pairs.question: jammed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is filled to capacity or overfilled; as, the auditorium was jammed to the rafters.

qa_pairs.question: jampack
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as to stuff; to fill completely and tightly; to jam{1}.

qa_pairs.question: jampan
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a kind of sedan chair used in India.

qa_pairs.question: jampot
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a jar for holding jellies or preserves; a jamjar.

qa_pairs.question: Jan
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of an intermediate order between angels and men.

qa_pairs.question: Jane
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A coin of Genoa; any small coin.

qa_pairs.question: Jane-of-apes
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A silly, pert girl; -- corresponding to jackanapes.

qa_pairs.question: Jangle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To sound harshly or discordantly, as bells out of tune.

qa_pairs.question: Jangle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To cause to sound harshly or inharmoniously; to produce discordant sounds with.

qa_pairs.question: Jangle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Idle talk; prate; chatter; babble.

qa_pairs.question: Jangler
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An idle talker; a babbler; a prater.

qa_pairs.question: Jangleress
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A female prater or babbler.

qa_pairs.question: Janglery
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Jangling.

qa_pairs.question: Jangling
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Producing discordant sounds.

qa_pairs.question: Jangling
qa_pairs.answer: It means Idle babbling; vain disputation.

qa_pairs.question: jangly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is like the discordant ringing of nonmusical metallic objects striking together; sounding with a jangle{3}; as, a custodian with a jangly set of keys.

qa_pairs.question: Janissary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Janizary.

qa_pairs.question: Janitor
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A door-keeper; a porter.

qa_pairs.question: Janitress
qa_pairs.answer: It means A female janitor.

qa_pairs.question: Janizar
qa_pairs.answer: It means A janizary.

qa_pairs.question: Janizarian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the janizaries, or their government.

qa_pairs.question: Janizary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A soldier of a privileged military class, which formed the nucleus of the Turkish infantry, but was suppressed in 1826.

qa_pairs.question: Janker
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A long pole on two wheels, used in hauling logs.

qa_pairs.question: Jansenism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The doctrine of Jansen regarding free will and divine grace.

qa_pairs.question: Jansenist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A follower of Cornelius Jansen, a Roman Catholic bishop of Ypres, in Flanders, in the 17th century, who taught certain doctrines denying free will and the possibility of resisting divine grace.

qa_pairs.question: Jant
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jaunt.

qa_pairs.question: Janthina
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Ianthina.

qa_pairs.question: Jantily
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jauntily.

qa_pairs.question: Jantiness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jauntiness.

qa_pairs.question: Jantu
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A machine of great antiquity, used in Bengal for raising water to irrigate land.

qa_pairs.question: Janty
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jaunty.

qa_pairs.question: January
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The first month of the year, containing thirty-one days.

qa_pairs.question: Janus
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A Latin deity represented with two faces looking in opposite directions. Numa is said to have dedicated to Janus the covered passage at Rome, near the Forum, which is usually called the Temple of Janus. This passage was open in war and closed in peace.

qa_pairs.question: Janus-faced
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Double-faced; deceitful.

qa_pairs.question: Janus-headed
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Double-headed.

qa_pairs.question: Japan
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Work varnished and figured in the Japanese manner; also, the varnish or lacquer used in japanning.

qa_pairs.question: Japan
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to Japan, or to the lacquered work of that country; as, Japan ware.

qa_pairs.question: Japan
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To cover with a coat of hard, brilliant varnish, in the manner of the Japanese; to lacquer.

qa_pairs.question: Japan current
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A branch of the equatorial current of the Pacific, washing the eastern coast of Formosa and thence flowing northeastward past Japan and merging into the easterly drift of the North Pacific; -- called also also known as Kuro-Siwo, or also known as Black Stream, in allusion to the deep blue of its water. It is similar in may ways to the Gulf Stream.

qa_pairs.question: Japanese
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to Japan, or its inhabitants.

qa_pairs.question: Japanese
qa_pairs.answer: It means A native or inhabitant of Japan; collectively, the people of Japan.

qa_pairs.question: Japanned
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Treated, or coated, with varnish in the Japanese manner.

qa_pairs.question: Japanner
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who varnishes in the manner of the Japanese, or one skilled in the art.

qa_pairs.question: Japanning
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The art or act of varnishing in the Japanese manner.

qa_pairs.question: Japannish
qa_pairs.answer: It means After the manner of the Japanese; resembling japanned articles.

qa_pairs.question: Jape
qa_pairs.answer: It means To jest; to play tricks; to jeer.

qa_pairs.question: Jape
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To mock; to trick.

qa_pairs.question: Japer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A jester; a buffoon.

qa_pairs.question: Japery
qa_pairs.answer: It means Jesting; buffoonery.

qa_pairs.question: Japhethite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Japhetite.

qa_pairs.question: Japhetic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Pertaining to, or derived from, Japheth, one of the sons of Noah; as, Japhetic nations, the nations of Europe and Northern Asia; Japhetic languages.

qa_pairs.question: Japhetite
qa_pairs.answer: It means A descendant of Japheth.

qa_pairs.question: Japonica
qa_pairs.answer: It means A species of Camellia (Camellia Japonica), a native of Japan, bearing beautiful red or white flowers. Many other genera have species of the same name.

qa_pairs.question: Japonism
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A quality, idiom, or peculiarity characteristic of the Japanese or their products, esp. in art.

qa_pairs.question: Jar
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A turn.

qa_pairs.question: Jar
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A deep, broad-mouthed vessel of earthenware or glass, for holding fruit, preserves, etc., or for ornamental purposes; as, a jar of honey; a rose jar.

qa_pairs.question: Jar
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To give forth a rudely quivering or tremulous sound; to sound harshly or discordantly; as, the notes jarred on my ears.

qa_pairs.question: Jar
qa_pairs.answer: It means To cause a short, tremulous motion of, to cause to tremble, as by a sudden shock or blow; to shake; to shock; as, to jar the earth; to jar one's faith.

qa_pairs.question: Jar
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A rattling, tremulous vibration or shock; a shake; a harsh sound; a discord; as, the jar of a train; the jar of harsh sounds.

qa_pairs.question: Jararaca
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A poisonous serpent of Brazil (Bothrops jararaca), about eighteen inches long, and of a dusky, brownish color, variegated with red and black spots.

qa_pairs.question: Jarble
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To wet; to bemire.

qa_pairs.question: Jardini<egrave/re
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An ornamental stand or receptacle for plants, flowers, etc., used as a piece of decorative furniture in room.

qa_pairs.question: Jards
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A callous tumor on the leg of a horse, below the hock.

qa_pairs.question: Jargle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To emit a harsh or discordant sound.

qa_pairs.question: Jargon
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Confused, unintelligible language; gibberish.

qa_pairs.question: Jargon
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To utter jargon; to emit confused or unintelligible sounds; to talk unintelligibly, or in a harsh and noisy manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jargon
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A variety of zircon. See Zircon.

qa_pairs.question: Jargonelle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A variety of pear which ripens early.

qa_pairs.question: Jargonic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the mineral jargon.

qa_pairs.question: Jargonist
qa_pairs.answer: It means One addicted to jargon; one who uses cant or slang.

qa_pairs.question: Jarl
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A chief; an earl; in English history, one of the leaders in the Danish and Norse invasions.

qa_pairs.question: Jarnut
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An earthnut.

qa_pairs.question: Jarosite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An ocher-yellow mineral occurring in minute rhombohedral crystals. It is a hydrous sulphate of iron and potash.

qa_pairs.question: Jar-owl
qa_pairs.answer: It means The goatsucker.

qa_pairs.question: Jarrah
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The mahoganylike wood of the Australian Eucalyptus marginata. See Eucalyptus.

qa_pairs.question: Jarring
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Shaking; disturbing; discordant.

qa_pairs.question: Jarring
qa_pairs.answer: It means A shaking; a tremulous motion; as, the jarring of a steamship, caused by its engines.

qa_pairs.question: Jarringly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a jarring or discordant manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jarvey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The driver of a hackney coach.

qa_pairs.question: Jasey
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A wig; -- so called, perhaps, from being made of, or resembling, Jersey yarn.

qa_pairs.question: Jashawk
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A young hawk.

qa_pairs.question: Jasmine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A shrubby plant of the genus *Jasminum*, bearing flowers of a peculiarly fragrant odor. The Jasminum officinale, common in the south of Europe, bears white flowers. The Arabian jasmine is Jasminum Sambac, and, with Jasminum angustifolia, comes from the East Indies. The yellow false jasmine in the Gelseminum sempervirens (see Gelsemium). Several other plants are called jasmine in the West Indies, as species of *Calotropis* and *Faramea*.

qa_pairs.question: Jason
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is the husband of Medea and leader of the Argonauts who sailed in quest of the Golden Fleece.

qa_pairs.question: Jasp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jaspachate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Agate jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jasp<eacute/
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having the surface decorated with cloudings and streaks, somewhat as if imitating jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jasper
qa_pairs.answer: It means An opaque, impure variety of quartz, of red, yellow, and other dull colors, breaking with a smooth surface. It admits of a high polish, and is used for vases, seals, snuff boxes, etc. When the colors are in stripes or bands, it is called striped jasper _or_ banded jasper. The Egyptian pebble is a brownish yellow jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jasperated
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as mixed with jasper; containing particles of jasper; as, jasperated agate.

qa_pairs.question: Jasperize
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To convert into, or make to resemble, jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jaspery
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of the nature of jasper; mixed with jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jaspidean
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Consisting of jasper, or containing jasper; jaspery; jasperlike.

qa_pairs.question: Jaspilite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A compact siliceous rock resembling jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jaspoid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Resembling jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jasponyx
qa_pairs.answer: It means An onyx, part or all of whose layers consist of jasper.

qa_pairs.question: Jatrophic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to physic nuts, the seeds of plants of the genus *Jatropha*.

qa_pairs.question: Jaunce
qa_pairs.answer: It means To ride hard; to jounce.

qa_pairs.question: Jaundice
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A morbid condition, characterized by yellowness of the eyes, skin, and urine, whiteness of the feces, constipation, uneasiness in the region of the stomach, loss of appetite, and general languor and lassitude. It is caused usually by obstruction of the biliary passages and consequent damming up, in the liver, of the bile, which is then absorbed into the blood.

qa_pairs.question: Jaundice
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To affect with jaundice; to color by prejudice or envy; to prejudice.

qa_pairs.question: Jaundiced
qa_pairs.answer: It means Affected with jaundice.

qa_pairs.question: Jaunt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To ramble here and there; to stroll; to make an excursion.

qa_pairs.question: Jaunt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To jolt; to jounce.

qa_pairs.question: Jaunt
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A wearisome journey.

qa_pairs.question: Jauntily
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a jaunty manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jauntiness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality of being jaunty.

qa_pairs.question: Jaunty
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Airy; showy; finical; hence, characterized by an affected or fantastical manner.

qa_pairs.question: Java
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the islands of the Malay Archipelago belonging to the Netherlands.

qa_pairs.question: Javanese
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to Java, or to the people of Java.

qa_pairs.question: Javel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vagabond.

qa_pairs.question: Javelin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sort of light spear, to be thrown or cast by the hand; anciently, a weapon of war used by horsemen and foot soldiers; now used chiefly in hunting the wild boar and other fierce game.

qa_pairs.question: Javelin
qa_pairs.answer: It means To pierce with a javelin.

qa_pairs.question: Javelinier
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A soldier armed with a javelin.

qa_pairs.question: Jaw
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of the bones, usually bearing teeth, which form the framework of the mouth.

qa_pairs.question: Jaw
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To scold; to clamor.

qa_pairs.question: Jaw
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To assail or abuse by scolding.

qa_pairs.question: Jawbone
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The bone of either jaw; a maxilla or a mandible.

qa_pairs.question: jawbone
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To attempt to influence solely by talking, as contrasted with threatening or inducing by other means, e.g. legislation; esp. to make public appeals in order to influence the behavior of businessmen or labor leaders; -- used especially of the President or other high government officials; as, to jawbone businessmen into forgoing price increases.

qa_pairs.question: Jawed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having jaws; -- chiefly in composition; as, lantern-jawed.

qa_pairs.question: Jaw-fall
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Depression of the jaw; hence, depression of spirits.

qa_pairs.question: Jaw-fallen
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Dejected; chopfallen.

qa_pairs.question: Jawfoot
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Maxilliped.

qa_pairs.question: Jawing
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Scolding; clamorous or abusive talk.

qa_pairs.question: Jawn
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Yawn.

qa_pairs.question: Jawy
qa_pairs.answer: It means Relating to the jaws.

qa_pairs.question: Jay
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any one of the numerous species of birds belonging to *Garrulus*, *Cyanocitta*, and allied genera of the family Corvidae. They are allied to the crows, but are smaller, more graceful in form, often handsomely colored, and usually have a crest.

qa_pairs.question: Jayet
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Jet.

qa_pairs.question: Jayhawker
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A name given to a free-booting, unenlisted, armed man or guerrilla.

qa_pairs.question: Jazel
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A gem of an azure color.

qa_pairs.question: Jazerant
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A coat of defense made of small plates of metal sewed upon linen or the like; also, this kind of armor taken generally; as, a coat of jazerant.

qa_pairs.question: jazz
qa_pairs.answer: It means A type of music that originated in New Orleans around 1900 and developed through increasingly complex styles, but generally featuring intricate rhythms, improvisation, prominent solo segments, and great freedom in harmonic idiom played frequently in a polyphonic style, on various instruments including horn, saxophone, piano and percussion, but rarely stringed instruments.

qa_pairs.question: jazzy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as resembling jazz{1} especially in its rhythm.

qa_pairs.question: JCL
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Job Control Language.

qa_pairs.question: JD
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is juvenile delinquent.

qa_pairs.question: JDL
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Jewish Defense League.

qa_pairs.question: Jealous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Zealous; solicitous; vigilant; anxiously watchful.

qa_pairs.question: Jealoushood
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Jealousy.

qa_pairs.question: Jealously
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a jealous manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jealousness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is State or quality of being jealous.

qa_pairs.question: Jealousy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality of being jealous; earnest concern or solicitude; painful apprehension of rivalship in cases directly affecting one's happiness; painful suspicion of the faithfulness of husband, wife, or lover.

qa_pairs.question: Jeames
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A footman; a flunky.

qa_pairs.question: jean
qa_pairs.answer: It means A twilled cotton cloth.

qa_pairs.question: Jears
qa_pairs.answer: It means See 1st Jeer (b).

qa_pairs.question: Jeat
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jet.

qa_pairs.question: Jedding ax
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A stone mason's tool, having a flat face and a pointed part.

qa_pairs.question: Jee
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Gee.

qa_pairs.question: Jeel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A morass; a shallow lake.

qa_pairs.question: Jeer
qa_pairs.answer: It means A gear; a tackle.

qa_pairs.question: Jeer
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To utter sarcastic or scoffing reflections; to speak with mockery or derision; to use taunting language; to scoff; as, to jeer at a speaker.

qa_pairs.question: Jeer
qa_pairs.answer: It means To treat with scoffs or derision; to address with jeers; to taunt; to flout; to mock at.

qa_pairs.question: Jeer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A railing remark or reflection; a scoff; a taunt; a biting jest; a flout; a jibe; mockery.

qa_pairs.question: Jeerer
qa_pairs.answer: It means A scoffer; a railer; a mocker.

qa_pairs.question: Jeering
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Mocking; scoffing.

qa_pairs.question: Jeers
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See 1st Jeer (b).

qa_pairs.question: Jeffersonia
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An American herb with a pretty, white, solitary blossom, and deeply two-cleft leaves (Jeffersonia diphylla); twinleaf.

qa_pairs.question: Jeffersonian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Pertaining to, or characteristic of, Thomas Jefferson (third President of the United States) or his political doctrines, which were those of the Republicanism of his time, as opposed to those of the Federalists.

qa_pairs.question: Jeffersonian simplicity
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The absence of pomp or display which Jefferson aimed at in his administration as President (1801-1809), eschewing display or ceremony tending to distinguish the President from the people, as in going to the capital on horseback and with no escort, the abolition of court etiquette and the weekly levee, refusal to recognize titles of honor, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Jeffersonite
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A variety of pyroxene of olive-green color passing into brown. It contains zinc.

qa_pairs.question: Jeg
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jig, 6.

qa_pairs.question: jehad
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as jihad.

qa_pairs.question: Jehovah
qa_pairs.answer: It means A Scripture name of the Supreme Being, by which he was revealed to the Jews as their covenant God or Sovereign of the theocracy; the <ldquo/ineffable name<rdquo/ of the Supreme Being, which was not pronounced by the Jews.

qa_pairs.question: Jehovist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who maintains that the vowel points of the word Jehovah, in Hebrew, are the proper vowels of that word; -- opposed to adonist.

qa_pairs.question: Jehovistic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Relating to, or containing, Jehovah, as a name of God; -- said of certain parts of the Old Testament, especially of the Pentateuch, in which Jehovah appears as the name of the Deity. See Elohistic.

qa_pairs.question: Jehu
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A coachman; a driver; especially, one who drives furiously.

qa_pairs.question: Jejunal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Pertaining to the jejunum.

qa_pairs.question: Jejune
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lacking matter; empty; void of substance.

qa_pairs.question: Jejunity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality of being jejune; jejuneness.

qa_pairs.question: Jejunum
qa_pairs.answer: It means The middle division of the small intestine, between the duodenum and ileum; -- so called because usually found empty after death.

qa_pairs.question: Jelerang
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A large, handsome squirrel (Sciurus Javensis), native of Java and Southern Asia; -- called also also known as Java squirrel.

qa_pairs.question: Jell
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To jelly.

qa_pairs.question: jellaba
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a loose cloak with a hood; worn in the Middle East and northern Africa.

qa_pairs.question: jelled
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is congealed from a liquid state into a jelly; jellied.

qa_pairs.question: jellied
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Brought to the state or consistency of jelly.

qa_pairs.question: jellify
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make, or to become, gelatinous; to make into jelly; to jelly.

qa_pairs.question: Jell-O
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a brand of sweetened fruit-flavored powdered mixture, packaged so that it can be conveniently dissolved in hot water and solidified into a gelatin, used as a dessert, sometimes with pieces of fruit mixed in; also the gelatin dessert thus prepared; sometimes used metaphorically; as, when he pulled a gun on me, my knees turned to Jell-O..

qa_pairs.question: jelly
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Anything brought to a gelatinous condition; a viscous, translucent substance in a condition between liquid and solid; a stiffened solution of gelatin, gum, or the like.

qa_pairs.question: Jelly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To become jelly; to come to the state or consistency of jelly.

qa_pairs.question: Jellyfish
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of the acalephs, esp. one of the larger species, having a jellylike appearance. See Medusa and acaleph.

qa_pairs.question: Jemidar
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The chief or leader of a band or body of persons; esp., in the native army of India, an officer of a rank corresponding to that of lieutenant in the English army.

qa_pairs.question: Jemlah goat
qa_pairs.answer: It means The jharal.

qa_pairs.question: Jemminess
qa_pairs.answer: It means Spruceness.

qa_pairs.question: Jemmy
qa_pairs.answer: It means Spruce.

qa_pairs.question: Jemmy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A short crowbar. See Jimmy.

qa_pairs.question: Jeniquen
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A Mexican name for the Sisal hemp (Agave rigida, _var._ Sisalana); also, its fiber.

qa_pairs.question: Jenite
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Yenite.

qa_pairs.question: Jenkins
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A name of contempt for a flatterer of persons high in social or official life; as, the Jenkins employed by a newspaper.

qa_pairs.question: Jennet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A small Spanish horse; a genet.

qa_pairs.question: Jenneting
qa_pairs.answer: It means A variety of early apple. See Juneating.

qa_pairs.question: Jenny
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A familiar or pet form of the proper name Jane.

qa_pairs.question: Jenny
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A machine for spinning a number of threads at once, -- used in factories. Also called also known as spinning jenny.

qa_pairs.question: Jentling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A fish of the genus *Leuciscus*; the blue chub of the Danube.

qa_pairs.question: Jeofail
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An oversight in pleading, or the acknowledgment of a mistake or oversight.

qa_pairs.question: Jeopard
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To put in jeopardy; to expose to loss or injury; to imperil; to jeopardize; to hazard.

qa_pairs.question: jeoparder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who puts in jeopardy.

qa_pairs.question: jeopardize
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To expose to loss or injury; to risk.

qa_pairs.question: Jeopardous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Perilous; hazardous.

qa_pairs.question: Jeopardy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Exposure to death, loss, or injury; hazard; danger.

qa_pairs.question: Jeopardy
qa_pairs.answer: It means To jeopardize.

qa_pairs.question: Jequirity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The seed of the wild licorice (Abrus precatorius) used by the people of India for beads in rosaries and necklaces, as a standard weight, etc.; -- called also also known as jumble bead.

qa_pairs.question: Jerboa
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any small jumping rodent of the genus *Dipus*, esp. Dipus Aegyptius, which is common in Egypt and the adjacent countries. The jerboas have very long hind legs and a long tail.

qa_pairs.question: Jereed
qa_pairs.answer: It means A blunt javelin used by the people of the Levant, especially in mock fights.

qa_pairs.question: Jeremiad
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A tale of sorrow, disappointment, or complaint; a doleful story; a dolorous tirade; -- generally used satirically.

qa_pairs.question: Jerfalcon
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The gyrfalcon.

qa_pairs.question: Jerguer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jerquer.

qa_pairs.question: Jerid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Jereed.

qa_pairs.question: Jerk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To cut into long slices or strips and dry in the sun; as, to jerk beef. See Charqui.

qa_pairs.question: Jerk
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To beat; to strike.

qa_pairs.question: Jerk
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make a sudden motion; to move with a start, or by starts.

qa_pairs.question: Jerk
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A short, sudden pull, thrust, push, twitch, jolt, shake, or similar motion.

qa_pairs.question: Jerker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A beater.

qa_pairs.question: Jerkin
qa_pairs.answer: It means A jacket or short coat; a close waistcoat.

qa_pairs.question: Jerkin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A male gyrfalcon.

qa_pairs.question: Jerking
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of pulling, pushing, or throwing, with a jerk.

qa_pairs.question: Jerkinhead
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The hipped part of a roof which is hipped only for a part of its height, leaving a truncated gable.

qa_pairs.question: jerkoff
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A lazy, foolish, stupid, or otherwise contemptible person; -- an offensive and disparaging term.

qa_pairs.question: jerk off
qa_pairs.answer: It means To masturbate.

qa_pairs.question: jerkwater
qa_pairs.answer: It means small and remote and insignificant; as, a jerkwater college.

qa_pairs.question: jerky
qa_pairs.answer: It means Moving by jerks and starts; characterized by abrupt transitions; as, a jerky vehicle; a jerky style.

qa_pairs.question: jerky
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Meat, especially beef, that has been cut in strips and dried; meat that has been jerked; see first jerk, (v.); as, beef jerky

qa_pairs.question: Jermoonal
qa_pairs.answer: It means The Himalayan snow partridge.

qa_pairs.question: Jeronymite
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One belonging of the mediHermits of St. Jerome.

qa_pairs.question: Jeropigia
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Geropigia.

qa_pairs.question: Jerquer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A customhouse officer who searches ships for unentered goods.

qa_pairs.question: Jerquing
qa_pairs.answer: It means The searching of a ship for unentered goods.

qa_pairs.question: Jerquing
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The searching of a ship for unentered goods.

qa_pairs.question: Jerry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Flimsy; jerry-built.

qa_pairs.question: Jerry-builder
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A professional builder who erects cheap dwellings of poor materials and unsubstantial and slovenly construction.

qa_pairs.question: Jerry-built
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Built hastily and of bad materials; as, jerry-built houses.

qa_pairs.question: Jersey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The finest of wool separated from the rest; combed wool; also, fine yarn of wool.

qa_pairs.question: Jerusalem
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The chief city of Palestine, intimately associated with the glory of the Jewish nation, and the life and death of Jesus Christ.

qa_pairs.question: Jervine
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A poisonous alkaloid resembling veratrine, and found with it in white hellebore (Veratrum album); -- called also also known as jervina.

qa_pairs.question: Jess
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A short strap of leather or silk secured round the leg of a hawk, to which the leash or line, wrapped round the falconer's hand, was attached when used. See Illust. of Falcon.

qa_pairs.question: Jessamine
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Same as Jasmine.

qa_pairs.question: Jessant
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Springing up or emerging; -- said of a plant or animal.

qa_pairs.question: Jesse
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any representation or suggestion of the genealogy of Christ, in decorative art

qa_pairs.question: Jessed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having jesses on, as a hawk.

qa_pairs.question: Jest
qa_pairs.answer: It means A deed; an action; a gest.

qa_pairs.question: Jest
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To take part in a merrymaking; -- especially, to act in a mask or interlude.

qa_pairs.question: Jester
qa_pairs.answer: It means A buffoon; a merry-andrew; a court fool.

qa_pairs.question: Jestful
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Given to jesting; full of jokes.

qa_pairs.question: Jesting
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Sportive; not serious; fit for jests.

qa_pairs.question: Jesting
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act or practice of making jests; joking; pleasantry.

qa_pairs.question: Jestingly
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a jesting manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jesu
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Jesus.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuit
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One of a religious order founded by Ignatius Loyola, and approved in 1540, under the title of The Society of Jesus.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuited
qa_pairs.answer: It means Conforming to the principles of the Jesuits.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitess
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of an order of nuns established on the principles of the Jesuits, but suppressed by Pope Urban in 1633.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the Jesuits, or to their principles and methods.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitically
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a jesuitical manner.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The principles and practices of the Jesuits.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitocracy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Government by Jesuits; also, the whole body of Jesuits in a country.

qa_pairs.question: Jesuitry
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Jesuitism; subtle argument.

qa_pairs.question: Jesus
qa_pairs.answer: It means The Savior; the name of the Son of God as announced by the angel to his parents; the personal name of Our Lord, in distinction from Christ, his official appellation.

qa_pairs.question: Jet
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as 2d Get.

qa_pairs.question: Jet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A variety of lignite, of a very compact texture and velvet black color, susceptible of a good polish, and often wrought into mourning jewelry, toys, buttons, etc. Formerly called also also known as black amber.

qa_pairs.question: Jet
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A shooting forth; a spouting; a spurt; a sudden rush or gush, as of water from a pipe, or of flame from an orifice; also, that which issues in a jet.

qa_pairs.question: Jet
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To strut; to walk with a lofty or haughty gait; to be insolent; to obtrude.

qa_pairs.question: Jet
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To spout; to emit in a stream or jet.

qa_pairs.question: Jet-black
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Black as jet; deep black. See first jet.

qa_pairs.question: Jet deau
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A stream of water spouting, esp. upward, from a fountain or pipe for ornament; also, the fountain or pipe from which it issues.

qa_pairs.question: Jeterus
qa_pairs.answer: It means A yellowness of the parts of plants which are normally green; yellows.

qa_pairs.question: Jetsam
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Goods which sink when cast into the sea, and remain under water; -- distinguished from flotsam, goods which float, and ligan (or lagan), goods which are sunk attached to a buoy.

qa_pairs.question: jet set
qa_pairs.answer: It means an international group of wealthy individuals who travel frequently to international resorts. -- the group is not organized, but membership is defined solely by frequent travel for pleasure.

qa_pairs.question: jet-setter
qa_pairs.answer: It means a member of the jet set.

qa_pairs.question: jet-setting
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is frequent international travel for pleasure, as contrasted with business.

qa_pairs.question: Jetteau
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jet d'eau.

qa_pairs.question: Jettee
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jetty, (n.)

qa_pairs.question: Jetter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who struts; one who bears himself jauntily; a fop.

qa_pairs.question: Jettiness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The state of being jetty; blackness.

qa_pairs.question: jetting
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as being propelled violently in a usually narrow stream; -- of liquids.

qa_pairs.question: Jettison
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The throwing overboard of goods from necessity, in order to lighten a vessel in danger of wreck.

qa_pairs.question: Jetton
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A metal counter used in playing cards.

qa_pairs.question: Jetty
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Made of jet, or like jet in color.

qa_pairs.question: Jetty
qa_pairs.answer: It means A part of a building that jets or projects beyond the rest, and overhangs the wall below.

qa_pairs.question: Jetty
qa_pairs.answer: It means To jut out; to project.

qa_pairs.question: Jeu desprit
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A witticism.

qa_pairs.question: Jeunesse dor<eacute/e
qa_pairs.answer: It means Lit., gilded youth; young people of wealth and fashion, esp. if given to prodigal living; -- in the French Revolution, applied to young men of the upper classes who aided in suppressing the Jacobins after the Reign of Terror.

qa_pairs.question: Jew
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Originally, one belonging to the tribe or kingdom of Judah; after the return from the Babylonish captivity, any member of the new state; a Hebrew; an Israelite.

qa_pairs.question: Jew
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to Jews; Jewish; -- usually considered offensive.

qa_pairs.question: Jew
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To bargain down (a person) in price; as, I jewed him down to ten dollars.

qa_pairs.question: Jew-baiter
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is someone who hates and would persecute Jews; an anti-Semite.

qa_pairs.question: Jewbush
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A euphorbiaceous shrub of the genus *Pedilanthus* (Pedilanthus tithymaloides), found in the West Indies, and possessing powerful emetic and drastic qualities.

qa_pairs.question: Jewel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An ornament of dress usually made of a precious metal, and having enamel or precious stones as a part of its design.

qa_pairs.question: Jewel
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To dress, adorn, deck, or supply with jewels, as a dress, a sword hilt, or a watch; to bespangle, as with jewels; to bejewel.

qa_pairs.question: jeweled
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as covered with beads or jewels or sequins.

qa_pairs.question: Jeweler
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who makes, or deals in, jewels, precious stones, and similar ornaments.

qa_pairs.question: Jewellery
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Jewelry.

qa_pairs.question: Jewelry
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The art or trade of a jeweler.

qa_pairs.question: jewels-of-opar
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An erect plant (Talinum paniculatum) with tuberous roots and terminal panicles of red to yellow flowers, grwing from Southwestern North America to Central America; it has been widely introduced elsewhere.

qa_pairs.question: Jewelweed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Impatiens.

qa_pairs.question: Jewess
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A female Jew; a Hebrew woman; a female adherent of Judaism.

qa_pairs.question: Jewfish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A very large serranoid fish (Promicrops itaiara) of Florida and the Gulf of Mexico. It often reaches the weight of five hundred pounds. Its color is olivaceous or yellowish, with numerous brown spots. Called also also known as guasa, and also known as warsaw.

qa_pairs.question: Jewise
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Juise.

qa_pairs.question: Jewish
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the Jews or Hebrews; characteristic of or resembling the Jews or their customs; Israelitish.

qa_pairs.question: Jewish calendar
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A lunisolar calendar in use among Hebraic peoples, reckoning from the year 3761 b. c., the date traditionally given for the Creation.

qa_pairs.question: Jewry
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Judea; also, a district inhabited by Jews; a Jews' quarter.

qa_pairs.question: Jews-ear
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A widely distributed species of edible fungus (Auricularia auricula-judae, formerly Hirneola Auricula-Jud<ae/, or Hirneola Auricula), bearing some resemblance to the human ear and growing on decaying wood.

qa_pairs.question: Jews-harp
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An instrument of music, which, when placed between the teeth, gives, by means of a bent metal tongue struck by the finger, a sound which is modulated by the breath; -- called also also known as Jew's-trump.

qa_pairs.question: Jews-stone
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A large clavate spine of a fossil sea urchin.

qa_pairs.question: Jezebel
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A bold, vicious woman; a termagant.

qa_pairs.question: Jharal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A wild goat (Capra Jemlaica) which inhabits the loftiest mountains of India. It has long, coarse hair, forming a thick mane on its head and neck.

qa_pairs.question: Jib
qa_pairs.answer: It means A triangular sail set upon a stay or halyard extending from the foremast or fore-topmast to the bowsprit or the jib boom. Large vessels often carry several jibs; as, inner jib; outer jib; flying jib; etc.

qa_pairs.question: Jib
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To move restively backward or sidewise, -- said of a horse; to balk.

qa_pairs.question: Jib
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To shift, or swing round, as a sail, boom, yard, etc., as in tacking.

qa_pairs.question: Jibber
qa_pairs.answer: It means A horse that jibs.

qa_pairs.question: Jibe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To shift, as the boom of a fore-and-aft sail, from one side of a vessel to the other when the wind is aft or on the quarter. See Gybe.

qa_pairs.question: Jibe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To change a ship's course so as to cause a shifting of the boom. See Jibe, (v. t.), and Gybe.

qa_pairs.question: Jiffy
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A moment; an instant; as, I will be ready in a jiffy.

qa_pairs.question: Jig
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A light, brisk musical movement.

qa_pairs.question: Jig
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To sing to the tune of a jig.

qa_pairs.question: Jig
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To dance a jig; to skip about.

qa_pairs.question: jigaboo
qa_pairs.answer: It means A negro, especially an African-American; -- an offensive term usually intended as an ethnic slur.

qa_pairs.question: Jigger
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A species of flea (Tunga penetrans, _or_ Sarcopsylla penetrans, _or_ Pulex penetrans), which burrows beneath the skin; called also also known as jigger flea. See Chigoe.

qa_pairs.question: Jigger
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, jigs; specifically, a miner who sorts or cleans ore by the process of jigging; also, the sieve used in jigging.

qa_pairs.question: Jigger
qa_pairs.answer: It means To move, send, or drive with a jerk; to jerk; also, to drive or send over with a jerk, as a golf ball.

qa_pairs.question: jiggery-pokery
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A verbal misrepresentation intended to take advantage of a person in some way.

qa_pairs.question: Jigging
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act or using a jig; the act of separating ore with a jigger, or wire-bottomed sieve, which is moved up and down in water.

qa_pairs.question: Jiggish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Resembling, or suitable for, a jig, or lively movement.

qa_pairs.question: Jiggle
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To wriggle or frisk about; to move awkwardly; to shake up and down.

qa_pairs.question: Jigjog
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A jolting motion; a jogging pace.

qa_pairs.question: Jigjog
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having a jolting motion.

qa_pairs.question: Jihad
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A religious war against infidels or Muslim heretics; also, any bitter war or crusade for a principle or belief.

qa_pairs.question: Jill
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A young woman; a sweetheart. See Gill.

qa_pairs.question: Jill-flirt
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A light, giddy, or wanton girl or woman. See Gill-flirt.

qa_pairs.question: Jilt
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A woman who capriciously deceives her lover; a coquette; a flirt.

qa_pairs.question: Jilt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cast off capriciously or unfeelingly, as a lover; to deceive in love.

qa_pairs.question: Jilt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To play the jilt; to practice deception in love; to discard lovers capriciously.

qa_pairs.question: Jimcrack
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Gimcrack.

qa_pairs.question: Jim Crow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A negro; -- said to be so called from a popular negro dance song, the refrain of which is Thomas D. Rice (1808-1860), a famous negro minstrel; -- considered disparaging and offensive.

qa_pairs.question: Jim-crow
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is For negroes only; set aside for used of negroes as a policy of racial discrimination.

qa_pairs.question: Jim-crow
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A machine for bending or straightening rails.

qa_pairs.question: jimdandy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is someone excellent of their kind; as, he's a jimdandy of a soldier.

qa_pairs.question: jimhickey
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as jimdandy.

qa_pairs.question: jimmies
qa_pairs.answer: It means Small cylindrical bits of sweet chocolate used as a granular topping on e.g. ice cream.

qa_pairs.question: Jimmy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A short crowbar used by burglars in breaking open doors.

qa_pairs.question: jimmy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An immigrant.

qa_pairs.question: jimmy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To pry open (a door, window, etc.) with a jimmy or similar device; often used with open; as, the burglar jimmied open the back door and stole the TV set.

qa_pairs.question: Jimp
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Neat; handsome; elegant. See Gimp.

qa_pairs.question: Jimson weed
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Jamestown weed.

qa_pairs.question: Jin
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jinnee.

qa_pairs.question: Jingal
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A small portable piece of ordnance, mounted on a swivel.

qa_pairs.question: Jingle
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To sound with a fine, sharp, rattling, clinking, or tinkling sound; as, sleigh bells jingle.

qa_pairs.question: Jingle
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To cause to give a sharp metallic sound as a little bell, or as coins shaken together; to tinkle.

qa_pairs.question: Jingle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A rattling, clinking, or tinkling sound, as of little bells or pieces of metal.

qa_pairs.question: Jingler
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who, or that which, jingles.

qa_pairs.question: Jingling
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act or process of producing a jingle; also, the sound itself; a chink.

qa_pairs.question: Jinglingly
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as So as to jingle.

qa_pairs.question: Jingo
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A word used as a jocular oath.

qa_pairs.question: jingoism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The policy of the Jingoes, so called. See Jingo, 2.

qa_pairs.question: jingoist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who is jingoistic; a bellicose patriot; an extreme bellicose nationalist; an aggressive chauvinist.

qa_pairs.question: jingoistic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is fanatically and bellicosely patriotic; aggressively chauvinistic; belligerent in international relations.

qa_pairs.question: Jink
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To move quickly, esp. with a sudden turn; hence, to dodge; to escape by a quick turn; -- obs. or dial., except as a hunting term in pig-sticking.

qa_pairs.question: jinks
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is noisy and mischievous merrymaking.

qa_pairs.question: Jinnee
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A genius or demon; one of the fabled genii, good and evil spirits, supposed to be the children of fire, and to have the power of assuming various forms.

qa_pairs.question: Jinny road
qa_pairs.answer: It means An inclined road in a coal mine, on which loaded cars descend by gravity, drawing up empty ones.

qa_pairs.question: Jinrikisha
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A small, two-wheeled, hooded vehicle drawn by one or more men.

qa_pairs.question: jinx
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A person, object, influence, or supernatural being which is supposed to bring bad luck or to cause things to go wrong.

qa_pairs.question: jinx
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To bring bad luck to; to cause to malfunction or go wrong; as, some superstitious people are reluctant to predict success for fear it will jinx them.

qa_pairs.question: Jippo
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A waistcoat or kind of stays for women.

qa_pairs.question: jiqui
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A Cuban timber tree (Malpighia obovata) with hard wood very resistant to moisture.

qa_pairs.question: jird
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Any of several North African gerbils.

qa_pairs.question: jitney
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a small bus or similar vehicle carrying passengers on a fixed route, used for public transport.

qa_pairs.question: jitterbug
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a fast and vigorous American dance that was popular in the 1940s, having few standardized steps and personalized with various twirls, twists, and acrobatic moves; it was performed often to the accompaniment of swing or boogie-woogie tunes.

qa_pairs.question: jitterbug
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as to do the jitterbug.

qa_pairs.question: jitters
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as an uneasy state; nervousness; as, the prospect of being drafted gave him a bad case of the jitters.

qa_pairs.question: jittery
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is being in a tense state; easily upset or frightened; -- of a person.

qa_pairs.question: jiujitsu
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as a method of self-defense without weapons that was developed in China and Japan; holds and blows are supplemented by clever use of the attacker's own weight and strength.

qa_pairs.question: jive
qa_pairs.answer: It means a style of jazz played by big bands popular in the 1930s; flowing rhythms but less complex than later styles of jazz.

qa_pairs.question: Jnr.
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Abbreviation for Junior, used after a name by a son who has the same first and last name as his father; -- less commonly used than also known as Jr.

qa_pairs.question: Jo
qa_pairs.answer: It means A sweetheart; a darling.

qa_pairs.question: Job
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A sudden thrust or stab; a jab.

qa_pairs.question: Job
qa_pairs.answer: It means To strike or stab with a pointed instrument.

qa_pairs.question: Job
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To do chance work for hire; to work by the piece; to do petty work.

qa_pairs.question: Job
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The hero of the book of that name in the Old Testament; the prototypical patient man.

qa_pairs.question: Jobation

The root has emetic properties. It is sometimes called the also known as rush-leaved daffodil. See Illust. of Corona.

qa_pairs.question: Joram
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Jorum.

qa_pairs.question: Jouk

qa_pairs.question: joule
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A unit of work which is equal to 107 ergs (the unit of work in the C. G. S. system of units), and is equivalent to one watt-second, the energy expended in one second by an electric current of one ampere in a resistance of one ohm; also called the also known as absolute joule. It is abbreviated J or j. The international joule is slightly larger, being 1.000167 times the absolute joule. The absolute joule is approximately equal to 0.737562 foot pounds, 0.239006 gram-calories (small calories), and 3.72506 x 10-7 horsepower-hours, and 0.000948451 B.t.u.

qa_pairs.question: Joulemeter

qa_pairs.question: Joules cycle
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The cycle for the air engine proposed by Joule. In it air is taken by a pump from a cold chamber and compressed adiabatically until its pressure is eqal to that of the air in a hot chamber, into which it is then delivered, thereby displacing an equal amount of hot air into the engine cylinder. Here it expands adiabatically to the temperature of the cold chamber into which it is finally exhausted. This cycle, reversed, is used in refrigerating machines.

qa_pairs.question: Joules law
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The law that the rate at which heat is produced in any part of an electric circuit is measured by the product of the square of the current times the resistance of that part of the circuit. If the current (_i_) is constant for an interval of time (_t_), the energy (_H_) in heat units equals i2Rt, _R_ being resistance.

qa_pairs.question: Jovialty

qa_pairs.question: Joy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To rejoice; to be glad; to delight; to exult.

It allows for lossy compression, i. e. the compression of data into a form which re-expands into an image close, but not identical to the original image. Files stored in this format usually carry the extension jpg or jpeg. Compare GIF.

Dugdale as an example of the inheritance of criminal and immoral tendencies, disease, and pauperism. Sixty per cent of those traced showed, degeneracy, and they are estimated to have cost society $1,308,000 in 75 years.

qa_pairs.question: Jupe

qa_pairs.question: jussive

qa_pairs.question: Just

qa_pairs.question: Just

qa_pairs.question: Justicehood

qa_pairs.question: Justicement

qa_pairs.question: Justicer

qa_pairs.question: Justiceship

qa_pairs.question: Juwise

qa_pairs.question: V
qa_pairs.answer: It means V, the twenty-second letter of the English alphabet, is a vocal consonant. V and U are only varieties of the same character, U being the cursive form, while V is better adapted for engraving, as in stone. The two letters were formerly used indiscriminately, and till a comparatively recent date words containing them were often classed together in dictionaries and other books of reference (see U). The letter V is from the Latin alphabet, where it was used both as a consonant (about like English _w_) and as a vowel. The Latin derives it from a form (V) of the Greek vowel F (see F), or else added by the Greeks to the alphabet which they took from the Semitic. Etymologically v is most nearly related to u, w, f, b, p; as in vine, wine; avoirdupois, habit, have; safe, save; trover, troubadour, trope. See U, F, etc.

qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The dealfish.

qa_pairs.question: Vaccine point
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Point, (n.), 26.

qa_pairs.question: Vaccinia
