qa_pairs.question: Viridite
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A greenish chloritic mineral common in certain igneous rocks, as diabase, as a result of alternation.

qa_pairs.question: Viridity
qa_pairs.answer: It means Greenness; verdure; the color of grass and foliage.

qa_pairs.question: Viridness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Viridity; greenness.

qa_pairs.question: Virile
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the nature, properties, or qualities, of an adult man; characteristic of developed manhood; hence, masterful; forceful; specifically, capable of begetting; -- opposed to womanly, feminine, and puerile; as, virile age, virile power, virile organs.

qa_pairs.question: Virility
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being virile; developed manhood; manliness; specif., the power of procreation; as, exhaustion.

qa_pairs.question: Viripotent
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Developed in manhood; hence, able to beget; marriageable.

qa_pairs.question: Virmilion
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Vermilion.

qa_pairs.question: Virole
qa_pairs.answer: It means A ring surrounding a bugle or hunting horn.

qa_pairs.question: Viroled
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Furnished with a virole or viroles; -- said of a horn or a bugle when the rings are of different tincture from the rest of the horn.

qa_pairs.question: Virose
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having a nauseous odor; fetid; poisonous.

qa_pairs.question: Virtu
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A love of the fine arts; a taste for curiosities.

qa_pairs.question: Virtual
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the power of acting or of invisible efficacy without the agency of the material or sensible part; potential; energizing.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuality
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being virtual.

qa_pairs.question: Virtually
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a virtual manner; in efficacy or effect only, and not actually; to all intents and purposes; practically.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make efficacious; to give virtue of efficacy.

qa_pairs.question: Virtue
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Manly strength or courage; bravery; daring; spirit; valor.

qa_pairs.question: Virtueless
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Destitute of virtue; without efficacy or operating qualities; powerless.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuosity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being a virtuoso; in a bad sense, the character of one in whom mere artistic feeling or aesthetic cultivation takes the place of religious character; sentimentalism.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuoso
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One devoted to virtu; one skilled in the fine arts, in antiquities, and the like; a collector or ardent admirer of curiosities, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuosoship
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The condition, pursuits, or occupation of a virtuoso.

qa_pairs.question: Virtuous
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Possessing or exhibiting virtue.

qa_pairs.question: Virulence
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being virulent or venomous; poisonousness; malignancy.

qa_pairs.question: Virulent
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Extremely poisonous or venomous; very active in doing injury.

qa_pairs.question: Virulented
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Made virulent; poisoned.

qa_pairs.question: Virulently
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a virulent manner.

qa_pairs.question: Virus
qa_pairs.answer: It means Contagious or poisonous matter, as of specific ulcers, the bite of snakes, etc.; -- applied to organic poisons.

qa_pairs.question: Vis
qa_pairs.answer: It means Force; power.

qa_pairs.question: Visa
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A written stamp or document obtained by a citizen of one country from the proper authorities of another country, denoting that that person's passport has been examined, and that the person who bears the visa is permitted to enter or pass through the second country. It is usually in the form of an endorsement on the passport of the person seeking permission to enter a foreign country; however, in some cases a separate document is issued that does not create a mark in the passport. Same as Vis<eacute/.

qa_pairs.question: Visa
qa_pairs.answer: It means A credit card issued with the Trade Name as, he charged the dinner to his Visa. Visa is a competitor of Master Card, Discover, MBNA, and American Express, and other credit card companies.

qa_pairs.question: Visa
qa_pairs.answer: It means To indorse, after examination, with the word vis<eacute/, as a passport; to vis<eacute/.

qa_pairs.question: Visage
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The face, countenance, or look of a person or an animal; -- chiefly applied to the human face.

qa_pairs.question: Visage
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To face.

qa_pairs.question: Visaged
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having a visage.

qa_pairs.question: Visard
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A mask. See Visor.

qa_pairs.question: Visard
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To mask.

qa_pairs.question: Vis-a-vis
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, is face to face with another; esp., one who faces another in dancing.

qa_pairs.question: Vis-a-vis
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Face to face.

qa_pairs.question: Visayan
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A member of the most numerous of the native races of the Philippines, occupying the Visayan Islands and the northern coast Mindanao; also, their language. The Visayans possessed a native culture and alphabet.

qa_pairs.question: Viscacha
qa_pairs.answer: It means A large burrowing South American rodent (Lagostomus trichodactylus) allied to the chinchillas, but much larger. Its fur is soft and rather long, mottled gray above, white or yellowish white beneath. There is a white band across the muzzle, and a dark band on each cheek. It inhabits grassy plains, and is noted for its extensive burrows and for heaping up miscellaneous articles at the mouth of its burrows. Called also also known as biscacha, also known as bizcacha, also known as vischacha, also known as vishatscha.

qa_pairs.question: Viscera
qa_pairs.answer: It means (pl.) of Viscus.

qa_pairs.question: Visceral
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of, pertaining to, or affecting the viscera; splanchnic.

qa_pairs.question: Viscerate
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To deprive of the viscera, or entrails; to eviscerate; to disembowel.

qa_pairs.question: Visceroskeletal
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the framework, or skeleton, or skeleton, of the viscera; as, the visceroskeletal system of muscles.

qa_pairs.question: Viscid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Sticking or adhering, and having a ropy or glutinous consistency; viscous; glutinous; sticky; tenacious; clammy; as, turpentine, tar, gums, etc., are more or less viscid.

qa_pairs.question: Viscidity
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality or state of being viscid; also, that which is viscid; glutinous concretion; stickiness.

qa_pairs.question: Viscin
qa_pairs.answer: It means A clear, viscous, tasteless substance extracted from the mucilaginous sap of the mistletoe (Viscum album), holly, etc., and constituting an essential ingredient of birdlime.

qa_pairs.question: Viscoidal
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Somewhat viscous. Cf. Mobile, (a.), 2.

qa_pairs.question: Viscosimeter
qa_pairs.answer: It means An instrument for measuring the degree of viscosity of liquids, as solutions of gum.

qa_pairs.question: Viscosity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being viscous.

qa_pairs.question: Viscount
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An officer who formerly supplied the place of the count, or earl; the sheriff of the county.

qa_pairs.question: Viscountcy
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The dignity or jurisdiction of a viscount.

qa_pairs.question: Viscountess
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The wife of a viscount.

qa_pairs.question: Viscountship
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality, rank, or office of a viscount.

qa_pairs.question: Viscous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Adhesive or sticky, and having a ropy or glutinous consistency; viscid; glutinous; clammy; tenacious; as, a viscous juice.

qa_pairs.question: Viscum
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus of parasitic shrubs, including the mistletoe of Europe.

qa_pairs.question: Viscus
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One of the organs, as the brain, heart, or stomach, in the great cavities of the body of an animal; -- especially used in the plural, and applied to the organs contained in the abdomen.

qa_pairs.question: Vise
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An instrument consisting of two jaws, closing by a screw, lever, cam, or the like, for holding work, as in filing.

qa_pairs.question: Vis<eacute/
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A document or an indorsement made on a passport by the proper authorities of certain countries, denoting that the passport has been examined, and that the person who bears it is permitted to proceed on her journey. Same as visa; -- an older spelling now used less frequently than also known as visa.

qa_pairs.question: Vis<eacute/
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To examine and indorse, as a passport; to visa.

qa_pairs.question: Vishnu
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A divinity of the modern Hindu trimurti, or trinity. He is regarded as the preserver, while Brahma is the creator, and Siva the destroyer of the creation.

qa_pairs.question: Visibility
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being visible.

qa_pairs.question: Visible
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Perceivable by the eye; capable of being seen; perceptible; in view; as, a visible star; the least spot is visible on white paper.

qa_pairs.question: Visible speech
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A system of characters invented by Prof. Alexander Melville Bell to represent all sounds that may be uttered by the speech organs, and intended to be suggestive of the position of the organs of speech in uttering them.

qa_pairs.question: Visigoth
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One of the West Goths. See the Note under Goth.

qa_pairs.question: Vision
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of seeing external objects; actual sight.

qa_pairs.question: Vision
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To see in a vision; to dream.

qa_pairs.question: Visional
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to a vision.

qa_pairs.question: Visionariness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being visionary.

qa_pairs.question: Visionary
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to a visions or visions; characterized by, appropriate to, or favorable for, visions.

qa_pairs.question: Visionary
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One whose imagination is disturbed; one who sees visions or phantoms.

qa_pairs.question: Visioned
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the power of seeing visions; inspired; also, seen in visions.

qa_pairs.question: Visionist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A visionary.

qa_pairs.question: Visionless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Destitute of vision; sightless.

qa_pairs.question: Visit
qa_pairs.answer: It means To go or come to see, as for the purpose of friendship, business, curiosity, etc.; to attend; to call upon; as, the physician visits his patient.

qa_pairs.question: Visit
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To make a visit or visits; to maintain visiting relations; to practice calling on others.

qa_pairs.question: Visit
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of visiting, or going to see a person or thing; a brief stay of business, friendship, ceremony, curiosity, or the like, usually longer than a call; as, a visit of civility or respect; a visit to Saratoga; the visit of a physician.

qa_pairs.question: Visitable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Liable or subject to be visited or inspected.

qa_pairs.question: Visitant
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who visits; a guest; a visitor.

qa_pairs.question: Visitant
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Visiting.

qa_pairs.question: Visitation
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of visiting, or the state of being visited; access for inspection or examination.

qa_pairs.question: Visitatorial
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to visitation, or a judicial visitor or superintendent; visitorial.

qa_pairs.question: Visite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A light cape or short cloak of silk or lace worn by women in summer.

qa_pairs.question: Visiter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A visitor.

qa_pairs.question: Visiting
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is (a. & vb. n.) from Visit.

qa_pairs.question: Visitor
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who visits; one who comes or goes to see another, as in civility or friendship.

qa_pairs.question: Visitorial
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Visitatorial.

qa_pairs.question: Visive
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the sight; visual.

qa_pairs.question: Vis major
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A superior force which under certain circumstances is held to exempt from contract obligations; inevitable accident; -- a civil-law term used as nearly equivalent to, but broader than, the common-law term act of God (which see).

qa_pairs.question: Visne
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Neighborhood; vicinity; venue. See Venue.

qa_pairs.question: Visnomy
qa_pairs.answer: It means Face; countenance.

qa_pairs.question: Vison
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The mink.

qa_pairs.question: Visor
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A part of a helmet, arranged so as to lift or open, and so show the face. The openings for seeing and breathing are generally in it.

qa_pairs.question: Visored
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wearing a visor; masked.

qa_pairs.question: Vista
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A view; especially, a view through or between intervening objects, as trees; a view or prospect through an avenue, or the like; hence, the trees or other objects that form the avenue.

qa_pairs.question: Visto
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vista; a prospect.

qa_pairs.question: Visual
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to sight; used in sight; serving as the instrument of seeing; as, the visual nerve.

qa_pairs.question: Visualize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To make visual, or visible.

qa_pairs.question: Visualize
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To form a mental image of something not present before the eye at the time.

qa_pairs.question: Visualizer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who visualizes or is proficient in visualization;

qa_pairs.question: Vitaille
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Food; victuals.

qa_pairs.question: Vital
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Belonging or relating to life, either animal or vegetable; as, vital energies; vital functions; vital actions.

qa_pairs.question: Vital
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vital part; one of the vitals.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalic
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Pertaining to life; vital.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The doctrine that all the functions of a living organism are due to an unknown vital principle distinct from all chemical and physical forces.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A believer in the theory of vitalism; -- opposed to physicist.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalistic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Pertaining to, or involving, vitalism, or the theory of a special vital principle.

qa_pairs.question: Vitality
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being vital; the principle of life; vital force; animation; as, the vitality of eggs or vegetable seeds; the vitality of an enterprise.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalization
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act or process of vitalizing, or infusing the vital principle.

qa_pairs.question: Vitalize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To endow with life, or vitality; to give life to; to make alive; as, vitalized blood.

qa_pairs.question: Vitally
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a vital manner.

qa_pairs.question: Vitals
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Organs that are necessary for life; more especially, the heart, lungs, and brain.

qa_pairs.question: Vitamin
qa_pairs.answer: It means any of several organic chemical substances not synthesized by an animal and required in small quantities for normal metabolism, present in and obtained from the natural foods eaten by the animal. Human vitamins are also produced synthetically, and taken in pure form or in mixtures, as dietary supplements. Deficiencies of specific vitamins lead to certain specific disorders, such as scurvy, caused by an insufficiency of vitamin C (ascorbic acid).

qa_pairs.question: vitamin A
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as any of several related fat-soluble vitamins (such as retinol) essential for normal vision; it also prevents night blindness or inflammation or dryness of the eyes.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin A1
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is retinol (C20H30O), one of the substances also called also known as vitamin A. It is also called more specifically also known as vitamin A alcohol. It is a required factor for human nutrition. The USP unit of activity is equal to 0.30 micrograms of retinol.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin A2
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as dehydroretinol (C20H28O), one of the substances also called also known as vitamin A. It has about 40% of the bioactivity of vitamin A1.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a group of water-soluble vitamins originally thought to be a single vitamin but now separated into several B vitamins.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B1
qa_pairs.answer: It means a B vitamin (C12H17N4OS)Cl that prevents beriberi and maintains appetite and growth. Same as thiamine.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B12
qa_pairs.answer: It means a B vitamin that is used to treat pernicious anemia.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B2
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as a B vitamin that prevents skin lesions and weight loss.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B3
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See nicotinamide.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B5
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See nicotinic acid.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B6
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is a B vitamin that is essential for metabolism of amino acids and starch.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin Bc
qa_pairs.answer: It means a B vitamin that is essential for cell growth and reproduction. Also called also known as folic acid

qa_pairs.question: vitamin B complex
qa_pairs.answer: It means a mixture of water-soluble vitamins originally thought to be a single vitamin but now known to be a mixture of several compounds with vitaminic activity.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin C
qa_pairs.answer: It means a vitamin that prevents scurvy. Also called also known as ascorbic acid.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin D
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is any of several chemically related fat-soluble vitamins that prevent rickets. It is found in fish-liver oils, egg yolks and milk. Component vitamin D2 is also called calciferol, and vitamin D3 is called cholecalciferol.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin E
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is a fat-soluble vitamin that is essential for normal reproduction. It is found in vegetable oils, butter, and eggs.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin G
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is same as vitamin B2.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin H
qa_pairs.answer: It means a B vitamin that aids in body growth.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin K
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as either of two fat-soluble vitamins (vitamin K1 or vitamin K2) that help clot blood by participating in the fromation of prothrombin.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin K1
qa_pairs.answer: It means one of the two K vitamins, (C31H46O2). It is fat-soluble and occurs naturally as the _trans_ isomer. Chemically it is 2-methyl-3-phytyl-1,4,-naphthoquinone.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin K2
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as one of the two K vitamins, actually a mixture of homologous fat-soluble substituted naphthoquinones (called also known as menaquinones), (C11H7O2[C5H8]nH), where n may be 1 to 13 but is mostly 7 to 9. The term is also used for synthetic compounds resembling vitamin K2 and having the same physiological action. The individual components of vitamin K2 are also referred to by the number of isoprenyl units in the side chain (the number n in the formula), as for menadione, having no units at that position of the naphthaquinone ring, and also called vitamin K2(0) (and also called vitamin K3).

qa_pairs.question: vitamin K3
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is menadione, (C11H8O2) being chemically 2-methyl-1,4,-naphthoquinone. Having no side chain in the 3 position, it cannot exert all functions of a true K vitamin and the designation as vitamin K3 has been discouraged

qa_pairs.question: vitamin M
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is same as vitamin Bc; folic acid.

qa_pairs.question: vitamin p
qa_pairs.answer: It means a water-soluble vitamin that maintains the resistance of cell and capillary walls to permeation.

qa_pairs.question: Vitascope
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A form of machine for exhibiting animated pictures.

qa_pairs.question: Vitellary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Vitelline.

qa_pairs.question: Vitelligenous
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Producing yolk, or vitelline substance; -- applied to certain cells (also called nutritive, or yolk, cells) formed in the ovaries of many insects, and supposed to supply nutriment to the developing ova.

qa_pairs.question: Vitellin
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An albuminous body, belonging to the class of globulins, obtained from yolk of egg, of which it is the chief proteid constituent, and from the seeds of many plants. From the latter it can be separated in crystalline form.

qa_pairs.question: Vitelline
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the yolk of eggs; as, the vitelline membrane, a smooth, transparent membrane surrounding the vitellus.

qa_pairs.question: Vitellogene
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A gland secreting the yolk of the eggs in trematodes, turbellarians, and some other helminths.

qa_pairs.question: Vitellus
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The contents or substance of the ovum; egg yolk. See Illust. of Ovum.

qa_pairs.question: Vitiate
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make vicious, faulty, or imperfect; to render defective; to injure the substance or qualities of; to impair; to contaminate; to spoil; as, exaggeration vitiates a style of writing; sewer gas vitiates the air.

qa_pairs.question: Vitiation
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of vitiating, or the state of being vitiated; depravation; corruption; invalidation; as, the vitiation of the blood; the vitiation of a contract.

qa_pairs.question: Viticulose
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having long and slender trailing stems.

qa_pairs.question: Viticultural
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to viticulture.

qa_pairs.question: Viticulture
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The cultivation of the vine; grape growing.

qa_pairs.question: Viticulturist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One engaged in viticulture.

qa_pairs.question: Vitiligo
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A rare skin disease consisting in the development of smooth, milk-white spots upon various parts of the body.

qa_pairs.question: Vitilitigate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To contend in law litigiously or cavilously.

qa_pairs.question: Vitilitigation
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Cavilous litigation; cavillation.

qa_pairs.question: Vitiosity
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Viciousness; depravity.

qa_pairs.question: Vitious
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Vicious, Viciously, Viciousness.

qa_pairs.question: Vitis
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A genus of plants including all true grapevines.

qa_pairs.question: Vitoe
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is See Durukuli.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrage
qa_pairs.answer: It means A curtain of light and translucent material intended to be secured directly to the woodwork of a French casement window or a glazed door.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrella
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the transparent lenslike cells in the ocelli of certain arthropods.

qa_pairs.question: Vitre-o-electic
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Containing or exhibiting positive, or vitreous, electricity.

qa_pairs.question: Vitreous
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Consisting of, or resembling, glass; glassy; as, vitreous rocks.

qa_pairs.question: Vitreousness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being vitreous.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrescence
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality or state of being vitreous; glassiness, or the quality of being vitrescent; capability of conversion into glass; susceptibility of being formed into glass.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrescent
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being formed into glass; tending to become glass.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrescible
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That may be vitrified; vitrifiable.

qa_pairs.question: Vitric
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having the nature and qualities of glass; glasslike; -- distinguished from ceramic.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrics
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The art or study of the manufacture and decoration of glassware.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrifaction
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act, art, or process of vitrifying; also, the state of being vitrified.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrifacture
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The manufacture of glass and glassware.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrifiable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being vitrified, or converted into glass by heat and fusion; as, flint and alkalies are vitrifiable.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrificable
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Vitrifiable.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrificate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To convert into glass; to vitrify.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrification
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Same as Vitrifaction.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrified
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Converted into glass.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriform
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having the form or appearance of glass; resembling glass; glasslike.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrify
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To convert into, or cause to resemble, glass or a glassy substance, by heat and fusion.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrify
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To become glass; to be converted into glass.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrina
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A genus of terrestrial gastropods, having transparent, very thin, and delicate shells, -- whence the name.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrine
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A glass show case for displaying fine wares, specimens, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriol
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A sulphate of any one of certain metals, as copper, iron, zinc, cobalt. So called on account of the glassy appearance or luster.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriol
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To dip in dilute sulphuric acid; to pickle.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To convert into, or change to, a vitriol; to make into sulphuric acid or a sulphate.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolate
qa_pairs.answer: It means Vitriolated.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A sulphate.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolated
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Changed into a vitriol or a sulphate, or subjected to the action of sulphuric acid or of a sulphate; as, vitriolated potash, _i. e._, potassium sulphate.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolation
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act, process, or result of vitriolating.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to vitriol; derived from, or resembling, vitriol; vitriolous; as, a vitriolic taste. Cf. Vitriol.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolizable
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Capable of being converted into a vitriol.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of vitriolizing, or the state of being vitriolized; vitriolation.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To convert into a vitriol; to vitriolate.

qa_pairs.question: Vitriolous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Vitriolic.

qa_pairs.question: Vitrite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A kind of glass which is very hard and difficult to fuse, used as an insulator in electrical lamps and other apparatus.

qa_pairs.question: Vitro-di-trina
qa_pairs.answer: It means A kind of Venetian glass or glassware in which white threads are embedded in transparent glass with a lacelike or netlike effect.

qa_pairs.question: Vitruvian
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to Vitruvius, an ancient Roman architect.

qa_pairs.question: Vitta
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of the oil tubes in the fruit of umbelliferous plants.

qa_pairs.question: Vittate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Bearing or containing vittae.

qa_pairs.question: Vituline
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to a calf or veal.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperable
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Liable to, or deserving, vituperation, or severe censure.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To find fault with; to scold; to overwhelm with wordy abuse; to censure severely or abusively; to rate.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperation
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of vituperating; abuse; severe censure; blame.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperative
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Uttering or writing censure; containing, or characterized by, abuse; scolding; abusive.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperator
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who vituperates, or censures abusively.

qa_pairs.question: Vituperrious
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Worthy of vituperation; shameful; disgraceful.

qa_pairs.question: Viva
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lit., (long) live; -- an exclamation expressing good will, well wishing, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Vivace
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Brisk; vivacious; with spirit; -- a direction to perform a passage in a brisk and lively manner.

qa_pairs.question: Vivacious
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Having vigorous powers of life; tenacious of life; long-lived.

qa_pairs.question: Vivacity
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being vivacious.

qa_pairs.question: Vivandier
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In Continental armies, esp. the French, a sutler.

qa_pairs.question: Vivandi<egrave/re
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In Continental armies, especially in the French army, a woman accompanying a regiment, who sells provisions and liquor to the soldiers; a female sutler.

qa_pairs.question: Vivant
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In mort, bridge, and similar games, the partner of dummy.

qa_pairs.question: Vivarium
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A place artificially arranged for keeping or raising living animals, as a park, a pond, an aquarium, a warren, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Vivary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A vivarium.

qa_pairs.question: Viva voce
qa_pairs.answer: It means By word of mouth; orally.

qa_pairs.question: Vivda
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Vifda.

qa_pairs.question: Vive
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Long live, that is, success to; as, vive le roi, long live the king; vive la bagatelle, success to trifles or sport.

qa_pairs.question: Vive
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Lively; animated; forcible.

qa_pairs.question: Vively
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a lively manner.

qa_pairs.question: Vivency
qa_pairs.answer: It means Manner of supporting or continuing life or vegetation.

qa_pairs.question: Viverra
qa_pairs.answer: It means A genus of carnivores which comprises the civets.

qa_pairs.question: viverrine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to the Viverridae, or Civet family.

qa_pairs.question: vivers
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Provisions; victuals.

qa_pairs.question: vives
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A disease of brute animals, especially of horses, seated in the glands under the ear, where a tumor is formed which sometimes ends in suppuration.

qa_pairs.question: Vivianite
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A hydrous phosphate of iron of a blue to green color, growing darker on exposure. It occurs in monoclinic crystals, also fibrous, massive, and earthy.

qa_pairs.question: vivid
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is True to the life; exhibiting the appearance of life or freshness; animated; spirited; bright; strong; intense; as, vivid colors.

qa_pairs.question: vividity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being vivid; vividness.

qa_pairs.question: vivific
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Giving life; reviving; enlivening.

qa_pairs.question: Vivificate
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To give life to; to animate; to revive; to vivify.

qa_pairs.question: Vivification
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act of vivifying, or the state of being vivified; restoration of life; revival.

qa_pairs.question: Vivificative
qa_pairs.answer: It means Able or tending to vivify, animate, or give life; vivifying.

qa_pairs.question: Vivify
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To endue with life; to make to be living; to quicken; to animate.

qa_pairs.question: Vivipara
qa_pairs.answer: It means An artificial division of vertebrates including those that produce their young alive; -- opposed to Ovipara.

qa_pairs.question: Viviparity
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or condition of being viviparous.

qa_pairs.question: Viviparous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Producing young in a living state, as most mammals, or as those plants the offspring of which are produced alive, either by bulbs instead of seeds, or by the seeds themselves germinating on the plant, instead of falling, as they usually do; -- opposed to oviparous.

qa_pairs.question: Viviparously
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In a viviparous manner.

qa_pairs.question: Viviparousness
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The quality of being viviparous; viviparity.

qa_pairs.question: Vivisect
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To perform vivisection upon; to dissect alive.

qa_pairs.question: Vivisection
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The dissection of an animal while alive, for the purpose of making physiological investigations.

qa_pairs.question: Vivisectional
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Of or pertaining to vivisection.

qa_pairs.question: Vivisectionist
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who practices or advocates vivisection; a vivisector.

qa_pairs.question: Vivisector
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vivisectionist.

qa_pairs.question: Vixen
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A female fox.

qa_pairs.question: Vixenish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to a vixen; resembling a vixen.

qa_pairs.question: Vixenly
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Like a vixen; vixenish.

qa_pairs.question: Viz
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To wit; that is; namely.

qa_pairs.question: Vizard
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A mask; a visor.

qa_pairs.question: Vizarded
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Wearing a vizard.

qa_pairs.question: Vizcacha
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Viscacha.

qa_pairs.question: Vizier
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A councilor of state; a high executive officer in Turkey and other Oriental countries.

qa_pairs.question: Vizierate
qa_pairs.answer: It means The office, dignity, or authority of a vizier.

qa_pairs.question: Vizier-azem
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A grand vizier. See under Vizier.

qa_pairs.question: Vizierial
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of, pertaining to, or issued by, a vizier.

qa_pairs.question: Vizir
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Vizier.

qa_pairs.question: Vizor
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Visor.

qa_pairs.question: Vlissmaki
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The diadem indris. See Indris.

qa_pairs.question: V moth
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A common gray European moth (Halia vauaria) having a V-shaped spot of dark brown on each of the fore wings.

qa_pairs.question: Vocable
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A word; a term; a name; specifically, a word considered as composed of certain sounds or letters, without regard to its meaning.

qa_pairs.question: Vocabulary
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A list or collection of words arranged in alphabetical order and explained; a dictionary or lexicon, either of a whole language, a single work or author, a branch of science, or the like; a word-book.
In simple terms, this is A sum or stock of words employed.

qa_pairs.question: Vocabulist
qa_pairs.answer: It means The writer or maker of a vocabulary; a lexicographer.

qa_pairs.question: Vocal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to the voice or speech; having voice; endowed with utterance; full of voice, or voices.

qa_pairs.question: Vocal
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A vocal sound; specifically, a purely vocal element of speech, unmodified except by resonance; a vowel or a diphthong; a tonic element; a tonic; -- distinguished from a subvocal, and a nonvocal.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to vowel sounds; consisting of the vowel sounds.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalism
qa_pairs.answer: It means The exercise of the vocal organs; vocalization.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A singer, or vocal musician, as opposed to an instrumentalist.

qa_pairs.question: Vocality
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being vocal; utterableness; resonance; as, the vocality of the letters.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalization
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of vocalizing, or the state of being vocalized.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalize
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To form into voice; to make vocal or sonant; to give intonation or resonance to.

qa_pairs.question: Vocally
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as In a vocal manner; with voice; orally; with audible sound.

qa_pairs.question: Vocalness
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The quality of being vocal; vocality.

qa_pairs.question: Vocation
qa_pairs.answer: It means A call; a summons; a citation; especially, a designation or appointment to a particular state, business, or profession.

qa_pairs.question: Vocative
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to calling; used in calling; specifically (Gram.), used in address; appellative; -- said of that case or form of the noun, pronoun, or adjective, in which a person or thing is addressed; as, Domine, O Lord.

qa_pairs.question: Vocative
qa_pairs.answer: It means The vocative case.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferance
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Vociferation; noise; clamor.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferant
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Noisy; clamorous.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferate
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To cry out with vehemence; to exclaim; to bawl; to clamor.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To utter with a loud voice; to shout out.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferation
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The act of vociferating; violent outcry; vehement utterance of the voice.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferator
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who vociferates, or is clamorous.

qa_pairs.question: Vociferous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Making a loud outcry; clamorous; noisy; as, vociferous heralds.

qa_pairs.question: Vocule
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A short or weak utterance; a faint or feeble sound, as that heard on separating the lips in pronouncing p or b.

qa_pairs.question: Vodanium
qa_pairs.answer: It means A supposed element, afterward found to be a mixture of several metals, as copper, iron, lead, nickel, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Vodka
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A Russian drink distilled from rye.

qa_pairs.question: Voe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An inlet, bay, or creek; -- so called in the Orkney and Shetland Islands.

qa_pairs.question: Vogle
qa_pairs.answer: It means Same as Vugg.

qa_pairs.question: Vogue
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The way or fashion of people at any particular time; temporary mode, custom, or practice; popular reception for the time; -- used now generally in the phrase in vogue.

qa_pairs.question: Voice
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Sound uttered by the mouth, especially that uttered by human beings in speech or song; sound thus uttered considered as possessing some special quality or character; as, the human voice; a pleasant voice; a low voice.

qa_pairs.question: Voice
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To give utterance or expression to; to utter; to publish; to announce; to divulge; as, to voice the sentiments of the nation.

qa_pairs.question: Voice
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To clamor; to cry out.

qa_pairs.question: Voiced
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Furnished with a voice; expressed by the voice.

qa_pairs.question: Voiceful
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having a voice or vocal quality; having a loud voice or many voices; vocal; sounding.

qa_pairs.question: Voiceless
qa_pairs.answer: It means Having no voice, utterance, or vote; silent; mute; dumb.

qa_pairs.question: Void
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Containing nothing; empty; vacant; not occupied; not filled.

qa_pairs.question: Void
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An empty space; a vacuum.

qa_pairs.question: Void
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To remove the contents of; to make or leave vacant or empty; to quit; to leave; as, to void a table.

qa_pairs.question: Void
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To be emitted or evacuated.

qa_pairs.question: Voidable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being voided, or evacuated.

qa_pairs.question: Voidance
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of voiding, emptying, ejecting, or evacuating.

qa_pairs.question: Voided
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Emptied; evacuated.

qa_pairs.question: Voider
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who, or that which, voids, <?/mpties, vacates, or annuls.

qa_pairs.question: Voiding
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of one who, or that which, voids.

qa_pairs.question: Voiding
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Receiving what is ejected or voided.

qa_pairs.question: Voidness
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being void; emptiness; vacuity; nullity; want of substantiality.

qa_pairs.question: Voir dire
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An oath administered to a witness, usually before being sworn in chief, requiring him to speak the truth, or make true answers in reference to matters inquired of, to ascertain his competency to give evidence.

qa_pairs.question: Voiture
qa_pairs.answer: It means A carriage.

qa_pairs.question: Voivode
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Waywode.

qa_pairs.question: Volacious
qa_pairs.answer: It means Apt or fit to fly.

qa_pairs.question: Volador
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A flying fish of California (Exoc<oe/tus Californicus): -- called also also known as volator.

qa_pairs.question: Volage
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Light; giddy.

qa_pairs.question: Volant
qa_pairs.answer: It means Passing through the air upon wings, or as if upon wings; flying; hence, passing from place to place; current.

qa_pairs.question: Volante
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A two-wheeled carriage formerly much used in Cuba. The body is in front of the axle; the driver rides on the horse.

qa_pairs.question: Volap<uum/k
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Literally, world's speech; the name of an artificial language invented by Johan Martin Schleyer, of Constance, Switzerland, about 1879. For more about <ldquo/planned languages<rdquo/, see Esperanto.

qa_pairs.question: Volap<uum/kist
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who is conversant with, or who favors adoption of, Volap<uum/k.

qa_pairs.question: Volar
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the palm of the hand or the sole of the foot.

qa_pairs.question: Volary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as See Volery.

qa_pairs.question: Volatile
qa_pairs.answer: It means Passing through the air on wings, or by the buoyant force of the atmosphere; flying; having the power to fly.

qa_pairs.question: Volatile
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A winged animal; wild fowl; game.

qa_pairs.question: Volatileness
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Quality or state of being volatile; disposition to evaporate; changeableness; fickleness.

qa_pairs.question: Volatilizable
qa_pairs.answer: It means Capable of being volatilized.

qa_pairs.question: Volatilization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of volatilizing, or rendering volatile; the state of being volatilized.

qa_pairs.question: Volatilize
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To render volatile; to cause to exhale or evaporate; to cause to pass off in vapor.

qa_pairs.question: Volator
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Same as Volador, 1.

qa_pairs.question: Vol-au-vent
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A light puff paste, with a raised border, filled, after baking, usually with a ragout of fowl, game, or fish.

qa_pairs.question: Volborthite
qa_pairs.answer: It means A mineral occurring in small six-sided tabular crystals of a green or yellow color. It is a hydrous vanadate of copper and lime.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanian
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Volcanic.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanic
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to a volcano or volcanoes; as, volcanic heat.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanically
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Like a volcano.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanicity
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Quality or state of being volcanic; volcanic power.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanic neck
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A column of igneous rock formed by congelation of lava in the conduit of a volcano and later exposed by the removal of surrounding rocks.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanic wind
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A wind associated with a volcanic outburst and due to the eruption or to convection currents over hot lava.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Volcanic power or action; volcanicity.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanist
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One versed in the history and phenomena of volcanoes.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanity
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being volcanic, or volcanic origin; volcanicity.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act of volcanizing, or the state of being volcanized; the process of undergoing volcanic heat, and being affected by it.

qa_pairs.question: Volcanize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To subject to, or cause to undergo, volcanic heat, and to be affected by its action.

qa_pairs.question: Volcano
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A mountain or hill, usually more or less conical in form, from which lava, cinders, steam, sulphur gases, and the like, are ejected; -- often popularly called a also known as burning mountain.

qa_pairs.question: Vole
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A deal at cards that draws all the tricks.

qa_pairs.question: Vole
qa_pairs.answer: It means To win all the tricks by a vole.

qa_pairs.question: Vole
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of micelike rodents belonging to *Arvicola* and allied genera of the subfamily Arvicolinae. They have a thick head, short ears, and a short hairy tail.

qa_pairs.question: Volery
qa_pairs.answer: It means A flight of birds.

qa_pairs.question: Volge
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The common sort of people; the crowd; the mob.

qa_pairs.question: Volitable
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Volatilizable.

qa_pairs.question: Volitation
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act of flying; flight.

qa_pairs.question: Volitient
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Exercising the will; acting from choice; willing, or having power to will.

qa_pairs.question: Volition
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of willing or choosing; the act of forming a purpose; the exercise of the will.

qa_pairs.question: Volitional
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Belonging or relating to volition.

qa_pairs.question: Volitive
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to the will; originating in the will; having the power to will.

qa_pairs.question: Volkslied
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A popular song, or national air.

qa_pairs.question: Volksraad
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A legislative assembly or parliament of any one of several countries colonized by the Dutch, esp. that of the South African Republic, or the Transvaal, and that of the Orange Free State.

qa_pairs.question: Volley
qa_pairs.answer: It means A flight of missiles, as arrows, bullets, or the like; the simultaneous discharge of a number of small arms.

qa_pairs.question: Volley
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To discharge with, or as with, a volley.

qa_pairs.question: Volley
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To be thrown out, or discharged, at once; to be discharged in a volley, or as if in a volley; to make a volley or volleys.

qa_pairs.question: Volley ball
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A game played by volleying a large inflated ball with the hands over a net 7 ft. 6 in. high.

qa_pairs.question: Volleyed
qa_pairs.answer: It means Discharged with a sudden burst, or as if in a volley; as, volleyed thunder.

qa_pairs.question: Volost
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is In the greater part of Russia, a division for local government consisting of a group of mirs, or village communities; a canton.

qa_pairs.question: Volow
qa_pairs.answer: It means To baptize; -- used in contempt by the Reformers.

qa_pairs.question: Volplane
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To glide in a flying machine.

qa_pairs.question: Volt
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A circular tread; a gait by which a horse going sideways round a center makes two concentric tracks.

qa_pairs.question: Volt
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The unit of electro-motive force; -- defined by the International Electrical Congress in 1893 and by United States Statute as, that electro-motive force which steadily applied to a conductor whose resistance is one ohm will produce a current of one amp<egrave/re. It is practically equivalent to <frac1000x1434/ the electro-motive force of a standard Clark's cell at a temperature of 15<deg/ C.

qa_pairs.question: Volta
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A turning; a time; -- chiefly used in phrases signifying that the part is to be repeated one, two, or more times; as, una volta, once. Seconda volta, second time, points to certain modifications in the close of a repeated strain.

qa_pairs.question: Volta-electric
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to voltaic electricity, or voltaism.

qa_pairs.question: Volta-electrometer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An instrument for the exact measurement of electric currents.

qa_pairs.question: Voltage
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Electric potential or potential difference, expressed in volts.

qa_pairs.question: Voltagraphy
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as In electrotypy, the act or art of copying, in metals deposited by electrolytic action, a form or pattern which is made the negative electrode.

qa_pairs.question: Voltaic
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to Alessandro Volta, who first devised apparatus for developing electric currents by chemical action, and established this branch of electric science; discovered by Volta; as, voltaic electricity.

qa_pairs.question: Voltairean
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or relating to Voltaire, the French author.

qa_pairs.question: Voltairism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The theories or practice of Voltaire.

qa_pairs.question: Voltaism
qa_pairs.answer: It means That form of electricity which is developed by the chemical action between metals and different liquids; voltaic electricity; also, the science which treats of this form of electricity; -- called also also known as galvanism, from Galvani, on account of his experiments showing the remarkable influence of this agent on animals.

qa_pairs.question: Voltameter
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for measuring the voltaic electricity passing through it, by its effect in decomposing water or some other chemical compound acting as an electrolyte.

qa_pairs.question: Voltammeter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A wattmeter.

qa_pairs.question: Volt amp<egrave/re
qa_pairs.answer: It means A unit of electric measurement equal to the product of a volt and an ampere. For direct current it is a measure of power and is the same as a watt; for alternating current it is a measure of apparent power.

qa_pairs.question: Voltaplast
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A form of voltaic, or galvanic, battery suitable for use electrotyping.

qa_pairs.question: Voltatype
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An electrotype.

qa_pairs.question: Volti
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Turn, that is, turn over the leaf.

qa_pairs.question: Voltigeur
qa_pairs.answer: It means A tumbler; a leaper or vaulter.

qa_pairs.question: Voltmeter
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An instrument for measuring in volts the differences of potential between different points of an electrical circuit.

qa_pairs.question: Voltzite
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An oxysulphide of lead occurring in implanted spherical globules of a yellowish or brownish color; -- called also also known as voltzine.

qa_pairs.question: Volubilate
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Turning, or whirling; winding; twining; voluble.

qa_pairs.question: Volubility
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality or state of being voluble (in any of the senses of the adjective).

qa_pairs.question: Voluble
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Easily rolling or turning; easily set in motion; apt to roll; rotating; as, voluble particles of matter.

qa_pairs.question: Volume
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A roll; a scroll; a written document rolled up for keeping or for use, after the manner of the ancients.

qa_pairs.question: Volumed
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Having the form of a volume, or roil; as, volumed mist.

qa_pairs.question: Volumenometer
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An instrument for measuring the volume of a body, especially a solid, by means of the difference in tension caused by its presence and absence in a confined portion of air.

qa_pairs.question: Volumenometry
qa_pairs.answer: It means The method or process of measuring volumes by means of the volumenometer.

qa_pairs.question: Volumescope
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is An instrument consisting essentially of a glass tube provided with a graduated scale, for exhibiting to the eye the changes of volume of a gas or gaseous mixture resulting from chemical action, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Volumeter
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An instrument for measuring the volumes of gases or liquids by introducing them into a vessel of known capacity.

qa_pairs.question: Volumetric
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to the measurement of volume.

qa_pairs.question: Volumetrical
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Volumetric.

qa_pairs.question: Voluminous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Of or pertaining to volume or volumes.

qa_pairs.question: Volumist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who writes a volume; an author.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntarily
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is In a voluntary manner; of one's own will; spontaneously.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntariness
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The quality or state of being voluntary; spontaneousness; specifically, the quality or state of being free in the exercise of one's will.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntarism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Any theory which conceives will to be the dominant factor in experience or in the constitution of the world; -- contrasted with intellectualism. Schopenhauer and Fichte are typical exponents of the two types of metaphysical voluntarism, Schopenhauer teaching that the evolution of the universe is the activity of a blind and irrational will, Fichte holding that the intelligent activity of the ego is the fundamental fact of reality.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntary
qa_pairs.answer: It means Proceeding from the will; produced in or by an act of choice.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One who engages in any affair of his own free will; a volunteer.

qa_pairs.question: Voluntaryism
qa_pairs.answer: It means The principle of supporting a religious system and its institutions by voluntary association and effort, rather than by the aid or patronage of the state.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who enters into, or offers for, any service of his own free will.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to a volunteer or volunteers; consisting of volunteers; voluntary; as, volunteer companies; volunteer advice.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To offer or bestow voluntarily, or without solicitation or compulsion; as, to volunteer one's services.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To enter into, or offer for, any service of one's own free will, without solicitation or compulsion; as, he volunteered in that undertaking.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer navy
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A navy of vessels fitted out and manned by volunteers who sail under the flag of the regular navy and subject to naval discipline. Prussia in 1870, in the Franco-German war, organized such a navy, which was commanded by merchant seamen with temporary commissions, with the claim (in which England acquiesced) that it did not come within the meaning of the term privateer.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteers of America
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A religious and philanthropic organization, similar to the Salvation Army, founded (1896) by Commander and Mrs. Ballington Booth.

qa_pairs.question: Volunteer State
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Tennessee; -- a nickname.

qa_pairs.question: Volupere
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A woman's cap.

qa_pairs.question: Voluptuary
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A voluptuous person; one who makes his physical enjoyment his chief care; one addicted to luxury, and the gratification of sensual appetites.

qa_pairs.question: Voluptuary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Voluptuous; luxurious.

qa_pairs.question: Voluptuous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Full of delight or pleasure, especially that of the senses; ministering to sensuous or sensual gratification; exciting sensual desires; luxurious; sensual.

qa_pairs.question: Volupty
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as Voluptuousness.

qa_pairs.question: Voluta
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Any one of numerous species of large, handsome marine gastropods belonging to *Voluta* and allied genera.

qa_pairs.question: Volutation
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A rolling of a body; a wallowing.

qa_pairs.question: Volute
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A spiral scroll which forms the chief feature of the Ionic capital, and which, on a much smaller scale, is a feature in the Corinthian and Composite capitals. See Illust. of Capital, also Helix, and Stale.

qa_pairs.question: Voluted
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Having a volute, or spiral scroll.

qa_pairs.question: Volution
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A spiral turn or wreath.

qa_pairs.question: Volva
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A saclike envelope of certain fungi, which bursts open as the plant develops.

qa_pairs.question: Volvox
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A genus of minute, pale-green, globular, organisms, about one fiftieth of an inch in diameter, found rolling through water, the motion being produced by minute colorless cilia. It has been considered as belonging to the flagellate Infusoria, but is now referred to the vegetable kingdom, and each globule is considered a colony of many individuals. The commonest species is Volvox globator, often called globe animalcule.

qa_pairs.question: Volvulus
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The spasmodic contraction of the intestines which causes colic.

qa_pairs.question: Volyer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A lurcher.

qa_pairs.question: Vomer
qa_pairs.answer: It means A bone, or one of a pair of bones, beneath the ethmoid region of the skull, forming a part a part of the partition between the nostrils in man and other mammals.

qa_pairs.question: Vomerine
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the vomer.

qa_pairs.question: Vomica
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An abscess cavity in the lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Vomicine
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as See Brucine.

qa_pairs.question: Vomic nut
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Nux vomica.

qa_pairs.question: Vomit
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To eject the contents of the stomach by the mouth; to puke; to spew.

qa_pairs.question: Vomit
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To throw up; to eject from the stomach through the mouth; to disgorge; to puke; to spew out; -- often followed by up or out.

qa_pairs.question: Vomit
qa_pairs.answer: It means Matter that is vomited; esp., matter ejected from the stomach through the mouth.

qa_pairs.question: Vomiting
qa_pairs.answer: It means The spasmodic ejection of matter from the stomach through the mouth.

qa_pairs.question: Vomition
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The act or power of vomiting.

qa_pairs.question: Vomitive
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Causing the ejection of matter from the stomach; emetic.

qa_pairs.question: Vomito
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The yellow fever in its worst form, when it is usually attended with black vomit. See Black vomit.

qa_pairs.question: Vomitory
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Causing vomiting; emetic; vomitive.

qa_pairs.question: Vomitory
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is An emetic; a vomit.

qa_pairs.question: Vomiturition
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An ineffectual attempt to vomit.

qa_pairs.question: Vondsira
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Vansire.

qa_pairs.question: Voodoo
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is See Voodooism.

qa_pairs.question: Voodoo
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to voodooism, or a voodoo; as, voodoo incantations.

qa_pairs.question: Voodoo economics
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is an economic hypothesis, proposed by President Ronald Regan, that large cuts in tax rates would so stimulate the economy that the tax revenue on the increases in business and personal income would offset the anticipated tax revenue losses, so that such tax cuts would not increasing the federal budget deficit. Its believers do not consider the actual massive deficit increases subsequent to the 1982-83 tax cut as being caused by the tax cut itself, but by other governmental policies. This hypothesis was graphically illustrated by the Laffer curve.

qa_pairs.question: Voodooism
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A degraded form of superstition and sorcery, said to include human sacrifices and cannibalism in some of its rites. It is prevalent among the negroes of Haiti, and to some extent in the United States, and is regarded as a relic of African barbarism.

qa_pairs.question: Voortreker
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who treks before or first; a pioneer.

qa_pairs.question: Voracious
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Greedy in eating; very hungry; eager to devour or swallow; ravenous; gluttonous; edacious; rapacious; as, a voracious man or appetite; a voracious gulf or whirlpool.

qa_pairs.question: Voracity
qa_pairs.answer: It means The quality of being voracious; voraciousness.

qa_pairs.question: Voraginous
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Pertaining to a gulf; full of gulfs; hence, devouring.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A mass of fluid, especially of a liquid, having a whirling or circular motion tending to form a cavity or vacuum in the center of the circle, and to draw in towards the center bodies subject to its action; the form assumed by a fluid in such motion; a whirlpool; an eddy.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex filament
qa_pairs.answer: It means A vortex tube of infinitesimal cross section.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex fringe
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The region immediately surrounding a disk moving flatwise through air; -- so called because the air has a cyclic motion as in vortex ring.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex line
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A line, within a rotating fluid, whose tangent at every point is the instantaneous axis of rotation as that point of the fluid.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex ring
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A ring-shaped mass of moving fluid which, by virtue of its motion of rotation around an axis disposed in circular form, attains a more or less distinct separation from the surrounding medium and has many of the properties of a solid.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex theory
qa_pairs.answer: It means The theory, advanced by Thomson (Lord Kelvin) on the basis of investigation by Helmholtz, that the atoms are vortically moving ring-shaped masses (or masses of other forms having a similar internal motion) of a homogeneous, incompressible, frictionless fluid. Various properties of such atoms (vortex atoms) can be mathematically deduced. This theory is now (1998) obsolete, and has been superseded by quantum mechanics, which provides more accurate and detailed explanations of atomic behavior.

qa_pairs.question: Vortex tube
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An imaginary tube within a rotating fluid, formed by drawing the vortex lines through all points of a closed curve.

qa_pairs.question: Vortical
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to a vortex or vortexes; resembling a vortex in form or motion; whirling; as, a vortical motion.

qa_pairs.question: Vorticel
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A vorticella.

qa_pairs.question: Vorticella
qa_pairs.answer: It means Any one of numerous species of ciliated Infusoria belonging to *Vorticella* and many other genera of the family Vorticellidae. They have a more or less bell-shaped body with a circle of vibrating cilia around the oral disk. Most of the species have slender, contractile stems, either simple or branched.

qa_pairs.question: Vorticose
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Vortical; whirling; as, a vorticose motion.

qa_pairs.question: Vortiginous
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Moving rapidly round a center; vortical.

qa_pairs.question: Votaress
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A woman who is a votary.

qa_pairs.question: Votarist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A votary.

qa_pairs.question: Votary
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Consecrated by a vow or promise; consequent on a vow; devoted; promised.

qa_pairs.question: Votary
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One devoted, consecrated, or engaged by a vow or promise; hence, especially, one devoted, given, or addicted, to some particular service, worship, study, or state of life.

qa_pairs.question: Vote
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as An ardent wish or desire; a vow; a prayer.

qa_pairs.question: Vote
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To express or signify the mind, will, or preference, either viva voce, or by ballot, or by other authorized means, as in electing persons to office, in passing laws, regulations, etc., or in deciding on any proposition in which one has an interest with others.

qa_pairs.question: Vote
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To choose by suffrage; to elecas, to vote a candidate into office.

qa_pairs.question: Voter
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is One who votes; one who has a legal right to vote, or give his suffrage; an elector; a suffragist; as, an independent voter.

qa_pairs.question: Voting
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is (a. & n.) from Vote, (v.)

qa_pairs.question: Votist
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who makes a vow.

qa_pairs.question: Votive
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Given by vow, or in fulfillment of a vow; consecrated by a vow; devoted; as, votive offerings; a votive tablet.

qa_pairs.question: Votress
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A votaress.

qa_pairs.question: Vouch
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To call; to summon.

qa_pairs.question: Vouch
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To bear witness; to give testimony or full attestation.

qa_pairs.question: Vouch
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is Warrant; attestation.

qa_pairs.question: Vouchee
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The person who is vouched, or called into court to support or make good his warranty of title in the process of common recovery.

qa_pairs.question: Voucher
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is One who vouches, or gives witness or full attestation, to anything.

qa_pairs.question: Vouchment
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A solemn assertion.

qa_pairs.question: Vouchor
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Same as Voucher, 3 (b).

qa_pairs.question: Vouchsafe
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To condescend to grant; to concede; to bestow.

qa_pairs.question: Vouchsafe
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To condescend; to deign; to yield; to descend or stoop.

qa_pairs.question: Vouchsafement
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The act of vouchsafing, or that which is vouchsafed; a gift or grant in condescension.

qa_pairs.question: Voussoir
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as One of the wedgelike stones of which an arch is composed.

qa_pairs.question: Vow
qa_pairs.answer: It means A solemn promise made to God, or to some deity; an act by which one consecrates or devotes himself, absolutely or conditionally, wholly or in part, for a longer or shorter time, to some act, service, or condition; a devotion of one's possessions; as, a baptismal vow; a vow of poverty.

qa_pairs.question: Vow
qa_pairs.answer: It means To give, consecrate, or dedicate to God, or to some deity, by a solemn promise; to devote; to promise solemnly.

qa_pairs.question: Vow
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as To make a vow, or solemn promise.

qa_pairs.question: Vowel
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A vocal, or sometimes a whispered, sound modified by resonance in the oral passage, the peculiar resonance in each case giving to each several vowel its distinctive character or quality as a sound of speech; -- distinguished from a consonant in that the latter, whether made with or without vocality, derives its character in every case from some kind of obstructive action by the mouth organs. Also, a letter or character which represents such a sound. See Guide to Pronunciation, <sect/<sect/ 5, 146-149.

qa_pairs.question: Vowel
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Of or pertaining to a vowel; vocal.

qa_pairs.question: Voweled
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Furnished with vowels.

qa_pairs.question: Vowelish
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of the nature of a vowel.

qa_pairs.question: Vowelism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is The use of vowels.

qa_pairs.question: Vowelize
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is To give the quality, sound, or office of a vowel to.

qa_pairs.question: Vower
qa_pairs.answer: It means One who makes a vow.

qa_pairs.question: Vow-fellow
qa_pairs.answer: It means One bound by the same vow as another.

qa_pairs.question: Vox
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is A voice.

qa_pairs.question: Vox angelica
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as An organ stop of delicate stringlike quality, having for each finger key a pair of pipes, of which one is tuned slightly sharp to give a wavy effect to their joint tone.

qa_pairs.question: Voyage
qa_pairs.answer: It means Formerly, a passage either by sea or land; a journey, in general; but not chiefly limited to a passing by sea or water from one place, port, or country, to another; especially, a passing or journey by water to a distant place or country.

qa_pairs.question: Voyage
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is To take a voyage; especially, to sail or pass by water.

qa_pairs.question: Voyage
qa_pairs.answer: It means To travel; to pass over; to traverse.

qa_pairs.question: Voyageable
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is That may be sailed over, as water or air; navigable.

qa_pairs.question: Voyager
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who voyages; one who sails or passes by sea or water.

qa_pairs.question: Voyageur
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is A traveler; -- applied in Canada to a man employed by the fur companies in transporting goods by the rivers and across the land, to and from the remote stations in the Northwest.

qa_pairs.question: Voyol
qa_pairs.answer: It means See Viol, 2.

qa_pairs.question: Vraisemblance
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The appearance of truth; verisimilitude.

qa_pairs.question: Vugg
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A cavity in a lode; -- called also also known as vogle.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcan
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The god of fire, who presided over the working of metals; -- answering to the Greek Hephaestus.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanian
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Of or pertaining to Vulcan; made by Vulcan; hence, of or pertaining to works in iron or other metals.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanic
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to Vulcan; made by Vulcan; Vulcanian.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanicity
qa_pairs.answer: It means Volcanicity.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanism
qa_pairs.answer: In simple terms, this is Volcanism.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanist
qa_pairs.answer: It means A volcanist.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanite
qa_pairs.answer: It means Hard rubber produced by vulcanizing with a large proportion of sulphur.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanization
qa_pairs.answer: It means The act or process of imparting to caoutchouc, gutta-percha, or the like, greater elasticity, durability, or hardness by heating with sulphur under pressure.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanize
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To change the properties of, as caoutchouc, or India rubber, by the process of vulcanization.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanizer
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as One who, or that which, vulcanizes; esp., an apparatus for vulcanizing caoutchouc.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcano
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A volcano.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcanology
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as The science which treats of phenomena due to plutonic action, as in volcanoes, hot springs, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Vulcan powder
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as A dynamite composed of nitroglycerin (30 parts), sodium nitrate (52.5), charcoal (10.5), and sulphur (7), used in mining and blasting.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgar
qa_pairs.answer: It means Of or pertaining to the mass, or multitude, of people; common; general; ordinary; public; hence, in general use; vernacular.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgar
qa_pairs.answer: It means One of the common people; a vulgar person.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarian
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as A vulgar person; one who has vulgar ideas. Used also adjectively.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarism
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as Grossness; rudeness; vulgarity.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarity
qa_pairs.answer: You can think of it as The quality or state of being vulgar; mean condition of life; the state of the lower classes of society.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarization
qa_pairs.answer: One way to understand this is The act or process of making vulgar, or common.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarize
qa_pairs.answer: You might recognize this as To make vulgar, or common.

qa_pairs.question: Vulgarly
